review_text:
We've been to the Corner Grind many times and have had all kinds of things. Basically everything we've had has been really good, and the people are all super helpful and friendly. AND its nice to support a local business owner and not the green machine from Seattle. 

They're breakfast sandwiches are fantastic and all come on homemade english muffin. She really likes the turkey sausage but the ones w/ onions and and peppers are what I get. The homemade granola bars are also hearty and delicious. The donuts, cinnamon buns, and muffins all look incredible (and huge), but I've never had any. Also really wanna try their lunch options.  I always get the house coffee which is tasty, and she's ordered various smoothies and cappuccinos which all seem to please.

I must confess.  I don't drink coffee, so I can't tell you how the coffee is at this coffee house!  I can tell you that they make some delicious scones, muffins, and donuts.  The blackberry and cinnamon scones are my favorite, but flavors change depending on the season.  

The staff is always welcoming and friendly.  Recently, I finally made it there for lunch.  Well, another confession, we were just too late for breakfast.  We are night owls not early birds.  We really went for breakfast, walked in and realized it was after 11AM.  The sandwiches were gigantic and very good.  I don't remember the name, but it was a chicken salad sandwich with bacon.  I ordered the 6", but it was much larger than that.  I ate half and took the rest home.   My foodie 11-year-old had a turkey club of some sort.  He polished his off and said it was very good.

I highly recommend stopping in at The Corner Grind.  Great little coffee house in a great little town!

So I came here a couple weeks ago after searching for bakery stuff. I have to say they didn't have a lot on that part but they also sell sandwiches. I got the Italian one and it didn't disappoint. It's a good price for good meat and veggies on it and it's very fresh. They also stuff the bread so it's very filling. At least for me lol. Also there coffee is very tasty. I'd come here again if we have the time. The only thing is that they close early.

Yum yum YUMMMMM! I'd give more than 5 stars if I could. I've tried three different sandwiches, and each one was better than the last. The Boar's Head meats and cheeses are delicious. Soups are yummy too. It's a small place, but a nice atmosphere. Excellent food at a fair price - what a concept!  Can't wait to go back.
My FAVORITE place for lunch in the area! Freshest food I've ever had! Great staff with fast and friendly service!!!

This is a wonderful local coffee shop with my favorite latte and delicious home made baked goods, the do nuts are simply wonderful and their sandwiches have perfect bread and fresh and plentiful cold cuts and cheeses. This place is wonderful and it's so nice to see it so busy all the time!

I just started grad school and needed to collaborate on a paper with my group member who lives in Dekalb (I live in St. Charles).  Elburn was smack dab in the middle for us to meet and The Corner Grind was perfect!

They get pretty busy here no matter the time.  I came in around 9am and it was quiet but then the morning rush came in, followed by the lunch crowd. They have a big sandwich selection and one rotating daily soup.  Had a cup of their steak and potato soup ($2.75) and a 12 oz. soy chai tea latte ($ 3.10). Both were amazing.  Service is extremely quick and friendly.  Wifi is password free and worked like a charm.

If you're a local, don't forget to ask about their punch card so you can work yourself up to a freebie!

Had to make the trip because of the reviews. For anyone that looks to yelp to find a new place or great food options - you will love this stop!!
We ordered 3 different sandwiches- the 1-3-5, coffee, lemon berry smoothie, an a monkey mocha. And yes, there were three of us . The generous amount of meat and cheese on the sandwich was well worth the 7.50- you could share or save for leftover. 
It was a bit loud inside but when the food is that good you can give them a pass on noise.  
If they only had space for a patio this place would have locals standin in line for the food and sweets. 
Already planning next trip back.
One of the best sandwiches of my life. It was so good I felt compelled to call them on the way home and compliment them on a job well done.
Outstanding sandwiches, baked goods, coffee, and service. I haven't had anything that hasn't been fabulous! A true gem for the Elburn community.

I'm not just raving about this place because it's local to me, I am raving because it is just THAT good. Utterly fabulous coffee, DELICIOUS food, cozy atmosphere, and friendly, relaxed service. I am a big fan of their weekly specials - their Steak and Potato Soup comes to mind, as well as the Southwest Chopped Salad with grilled steak just last week. I've tried a variety of their breads/muffins and sandwiches and honestly, all but one have floored me. I could eat here every day.

I must comment on the servers/baristas. They are ALWAYS accommodating and helpful and genuinely seem to enjoy their job. They deserve props for always having a smile on their face.

It also happens to be one of few places I can sit down with my two-year-old for more than twenty minutes because for some reason, she is always relaxed and well-behaved here. Even she knows it's a great place. :)
This place is great! The employees like what they do and are very friendly. The coffee is great and the soup/sandwiches are perfect. They have Boars Head meats which are the best. Super tasty stuff!

Love!! Great coffee and lattes with breakfast sandwiches or great lunch sandwiches!! Board Head quality place with a small town friendly vibe! Great for kids too! Coloring books, kids menu and treats are sure to make them happy too!
All those reviews about food, just to find out no lunch on Sunday. Coffee was ok, but we're so disappointed that we can't get soup, salad, or sandwiches

I don't usually gush, it is not in my nature.  I frequent the Corner Grind on a near daily basis when I am not on the road working. The people are friendly and put me in a good mood first thing in the morning. On the weekend I love to  treat myself and stop in and get one of their Breakfast Sandwiches.  OK this is where I start to gush. If you have not had the pleasure or opportunity to try one, I feel less than happy for you. These sandwiches are over the top in freshness and quality. If you have the opportunity do yourself a huge favor and try one. Gush, gush, gush, gush, Gush....
 P.S. The one moderate review this  place received was because they don't serve lunch on Sunday...
So please remember they don't serve lunch on Sunday, so order the Breakfast sandwich.

Although I don't really pass through Elburn too often, I have been here a few times with my mom. It's nice to have a local coffee place. Elburn has been needing a place like this for a long time. The staff are friendly. The ambiance is cute and cozy. The space is a little small, but is always packed. The coffee menu is extensive and they have some lunch items as well. I will return whenever I'm in the area.

My husband and I go here a LOT cause it never disappoints. We have both had breakfast and lunch here, sometimes on the same day. Not once have I ever been disappointed in their food or their drinks. The staff are all awesome people and the place is always clean, even when they are busy. I will continue to be a loyal customer at Corner Grind!
The Corner Grind is a fantastic place for lunch or a cup of coffee. The sandwiches are large and made with fresh ingredients. The pastries are homemade. The service is also cheerful and friendly.

Corner Grind has huge delicious sandwiches for lunch and the price is right at about $7.50 including a bag of chips.  All Boars Head meats and cheeses.  I eat here almost once a week.  Different soup and sandwich specials daily.  Highly recommended for lunch or coffee.  Note:  Lunch is served from 11am - 3pm only and they can get a little busy.
Get the cinnamon roll muffin warmed! Delicious with a black cup of coffee. They brew their own coffee which is a medium. They offered a dark but it was decaf.
The best everything! Mochas and chai tea lattes,  fresh baked pastries, hot homemade soup, and delicious sandwiches made with homemade bread! Service is super friendly!

Glad I gave it a 2nd chance!  Servers were friendly and helpful. Blackberry & Lemon Muffin was fantastic. This is what I was expecting when I first tried it. Very good and very reasonably priced. Will try lunch soon.

Elburn lucked out by getting this coffee spot to open up last year. Although the city prevents them from much signage (while the new DD down the street has had cheap plastic flags and roadside "grand opening" signs up for months now), Corner Grind has developed a loyal customer base by serving great coffee, fresh baked pastries, and AMAZING lunches!

Hoping they'll be around for many years to come!!

Just went to this place for the first time with my daughter: both of our "treats" were good and the coffee was good too. 
I believe I had coffee cake. I cannot remember what she had. The employees are also very nice.

We grabbed a coffee and breakfast sandwich this morning before missing the earlier metra train into the city. That was sad, but the espresso was not sad. It was fantastic. There was a plate of doughnut hole samples on the counter and they were delicious. You could tell they were fresh and house made. The breakfast sandwich was basic but very solid. You could tell they use good ingredients. I'd go back!! Very friendly staff!

Cool little corner cafe. Coffee was good, but almond biscotti was amazing. Twice the size of normal biscotti with a nice chew to it. No need for dunking to soften it up. This place is now on my fav list.
Best Coffee for miles. Love the Red Eye, can't get enough of that. If your a soup fan, as I stop in for it.
Corner grind is awesome great subs very nice people always do a fantastic job preparing healthy fresh sandwiches .

I am so happy my husband suggested this place to me! My sister and I were about to drive all the way out to Randall to get sandwiches or salad when he called and said to check them out first. Elburn needed a place like this! I even went back the next day to try something else. So far (between my husband's, sister's and my meals!) everything has been delicious. The black bird is not just an ordinary turkey sandwich, but has a nice kick. The Thailand Salad is amazing and I love the edamame.  The broccoli cheddar soup is the perfect balance of creamy and cheesy. The peanut butter cookie is a great bite without being dry, like peanut butter cookies can be. My favorite so far is the Root Beer Frappe. So unique and delicious!  I highly recommend it, but call your order in ahead of you are in a rush, as it can take a bit, especially if they are busy (which they seem to be often), but it is so worth it. Enjoy!

Update: I've tried soups to sandwiches to muffins and treats and everything is top notch.   The sandwiches are very good although really big.  You can do half a sandwich with soup, but the sandwich is still enormous.  Tasty though.  Friendly staff and good drinks.
Awesome craft coffee beverages. The sandwiches are made with quality fresh ingredients. Makes a stop In Elburn a 100 times better.

I contacted the owner to give her a "heads up" about my husband & I both having something "gritty" in both of our sandwiches.  The "roast top round" in the beef & cheddar was tough/fatty/scarce.  To make things worse, we were both up all night with upset stomachs!  I suggested that possibly whomever was making the sandwiches, may have not properly washed the lettuce or something...?  After advising me that she herself makes the sandwiches, she basically argued the fact, explaining she had a lettuce washing machine.  After listening to what I consider nothing but excuses, it seemed like she was in total denial & wanted to do nothing but disagree with whatever I had to say.  Although she offered to give us a couple "free" sandwiches to make up for our experience, we've decided to never return.  Who argues with a paying customer?!?!?  Good luck!!!  Sorry I bothered to call!!!

Whenever I go in everyone is genuinely warm and friendly. My staple drink is a mocha frappacino, and, because I work as a barista, I am a little particular to how my coffee tastes. Every time I order a mocha frappacino from the Corner Grind, the flavor and consistency is top notch. Just the right combination of coffee and chocolate taste, with a not too icy undertone. Divine! Top that off with a very inviting and classy atmosphere,(and added lunch menu!-just tried the soup of the day, A-MAZING!) and you have a coffee shop to end all coffee shops. 
Wish I could give a 10 out of 10!
Great food and friendly staff...great addition to the small town..wish they had longer hours...
Great pastries here. It can be busy sometimes but it's ok because it kind of reminds me of that Seinfeld soup nazi kitchen episode and I'm humored for the time waiting. NO SOUP FOR YOU!

Wonderful little coffee shop!!! Came here with my Mom on a Saturday and enjoyed a pumpkin spice latte and tea. We tried the Apple Scones as well, which we informed were the first batch of the season. They were served warm and so delicious!! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Menu is large and is full of options, for both food and beverages.

Finally a good coffee shop on my morning commute route. I stopped in this morning and tried a Pumpkin Latte, it was perfect. They had a nice selection of baked goods and pastries as well. They were fast and friendly I will definitely return.
Elburn has needed a place like this for a long time. Great coffee and friendly staff.

So thankful to have a great coffee shop in the neighborhood. My favorite thing about CG is that they serve dairy alternatives. Yahoo! All of their treats are delicious. I get especially excited when they have vanilla glazed donuts holes out as free samples. Wonderful addition to this growing area.
The best everything! Mochas and chai tea lattes,  fresh baked pastries, hot homemade soup, and delicious sandwiches made with homemade bread! Service is super friendly!

Glad I gave it a 2nd chance!  Servers were friendly and helpful. Blackberry & Lemon Muffin was fantastic. This is what I was expecting when I first tried it. Very good and very reasonably priced. Will try lunch soon.

Finally a good coffee shop on my morning commute route. I stopped in this morning and tried a Pumpkin Latte, it was perfect. They had a nice selection of baked goods and pastries as well. They were fast and friendly I will definitely return.
Elburn has needed a place like this for a long time. Great coffee and friendly staff.

So thankful to have a great coffee shop in the neighborhood. My favorite thing about CG is that they serve dairy alternatives. Yahoo! All of their treats are delicious. I get especially excited when they have vanilla glazed donuts holes out as free samples. Wonderful addition to this growing area.

Fantastic coffee shop with just the right mix of small town hospitality and urban style. I've been in too many times to count - the drinks are always excellent and the Boar's Head sandwiches are delicious. The service is friendly and the place is spotless. It's the best addition to Main Street since 1954.

It's nice to get a lunch place here in Elburn that serves something besides fried food. I have eaten here two times for lunch and it is delicious. The service is great and always friendly. I had the Corner Grind sandwich both times and the meat and bread are delicious.

Updating this review to say that the sandwiches and soups are top notch, and made with Boars Head products. Along with the breakfast pastry items, nearly all made in-house from scratch with quality ingredients; you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I agree with the other reviewer: this place is the best thing to happen to Elburn in probably half a century - and at least the 10 years I've been here.
Killer grub in Elburn? Yes! Great sandwiches and soup! It's a secret so don't share it...

Three visits and all were spot-on!

First two visits were lattes and sinfully rich pastries.  While the Vanilla Latte was a little sweet for me, the plain latte was great. Pastries are a diet-buster. Donut holes are really perfect....not sure why, they just are.

Today I stopped for lunch and really enjoyed it. I ordered the soup and 1/2 sandwich combo which really was generous. I ended up bringing half of my Creamy chicken rice soup home due to the amazing sandwich. Perfectly crusty roll, super thinly sliced lean Boar's head beef with all the fixin's. YUM! This East coast girl will be back to enjoy what we call a "hoagie" done just right.

Great atmosphere and service make this a five-star. Sure glad to have them here in town.

My husband and I stopped out at The Corner Grind today while we were in Elburn. What a fantastic little coffee shop! I got a butterscotch frappe that was so delish. I could actually taste the coffee and the flavoring! My husband got an almond late,  his favorite flavor that is hard to find, and he was very pleased with his drink. Friendly staff, fast service, super cute place with an incredibly clean sugar/stir station. I may have to drive the extra few miles for my weekly coffee treat.
Best thing to come to Elburn since Reams! What a great addition to the community! Great service, friendly staff, perfect location. The pastries and beverages were excellent and affordable!

Really enjoying this addition to downtown Elburn.  I spent about 90 minutes in here during a week day and was pleased to see a steady stream of folks coming in to grab a coffee or a snack.  Even better, a number of people inquired about lunch and the friendly staff were happy to report that it would be starting soon (Monday, Nov 17 I believe).  

Service was excellent as was my pastry and mocha. Informed baristas with pleasant attitudes.  My only hesitation with a 5 star review is that the place lacked a bit of warmth.  I know that the store has only been open for a few weeks, but a few arm chairs would go a long way to make it feel just a dot more cozy.  Other than that, really looking forward to patronizing the Coffee Grind moving forward.  Way to go!
Good food nice ppl.  Parking can be challenge.  The wait can be long.  Wouldn't stop in if you are in a rush.  But overall...nice place.

For a new business in Elburn, Corner Grind opened up in a completely revamped space. I found it to be very clean, organized and hospitable. Marble counters and a functional, yet manageable display case showing their food offerings. While I didn't eat, their coffee blend was very good and at a good value. Glad to see this in our small humble town. I will definitely be back for my morning cup of coffee and then some.

Stopped by today for an after school snack with my kids! Loved it! Iced tea was delicious and my son loved the smoothie. The apple cider donut was also wonderful. Friendly staff-can't wait to make this a regular stop!

Always enter to a warm smile from all of the staff. The coffee aroma coupled with the delectable scent of freshly homemade goodies...YUM! The sandwiches are phenomenal! The best part is sitting there remembering it as my grandpa's restaurant back in the 80's when I was a kid. Thank you for adding to the community! Give yourselves a pat on the back!
Better than the Dunkin up the street. Drink my coffee black and it is delicious!! They are so kind here, it's a great place to have while Alice's is closed!!!

I understand why the reviews for this little place are so good. The food is really great and the staff is very friendly. The restaurant has a very warm feeling overall. The sandwiches are good but leave room for a chocolate chip cookie. They are great!

The Corner Grind has fabulous coffee, sandwiches that I crave all week until I can get there on a Saturday when they serve lunch and sweet treats that are amazing!  So thankful to have another gem in Elburn and to all the out of towners the Corner Grind is definitely worth the trip.

This place is great and just what Elburn needed. The coffee is amazing and the service is great. I wish it was a bit bigger, but I'm sure they'll get there. Spread the word, this place deserves positive support!
Fantastic addition to Elburn!  We had two of their hot sandwiches for lunch and they were excellent.  Their baked goods are fresh and delicious, too.
Just had what was for sure the best grilled cheese panini ever! Delicious, unique cheeses and a bag of kettle chips to boot - for $6.75. Cute place!! Would definitely go back.

It's nice to get a lunch place here in Elburn that serves something besides fried food. I have eaten here two times for lunch and it is delicious. The service is great and always friendly. I had the Corner Grind sandwich both times and the meat and bread are delicious.

Updating this review to say that the sandwiches and soups are top notch, and made with Boars Head products. Along with the breakfast pastry items, nearly all made in-house from scratch with quality ingredients; you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I agree with the other reviewer: this place is the best thing to happen to Elburn in probably half a century - and at least the 10 years I've been here.

This place is great and just what Elburn needed. The coffee is amazing and the service is great. I wish it was a bit bigger, but I'm sure they'll get there. Spread the word, this place deserves positive support!
Fantastic addition to Elburn!  We had two of their hot sandwiches for lunch and they were excellent.  Their baked goods are fresh and delicious, too.
Just had what was for sure the best grilled cheese panini ever! Delicious, unique cheeses and a bag of kettle chips to boot - for $6.75. Cute place!! Would definitely go back.

Employees friendly and helpful.
You look at the menu on the wall and choose what you want.  Grab the bag for that.
The you choose the particulars.  I chose a Caprese sandwich.  Caprese, Basil and tomato.
I added onions and oil and vinegar.  Tasty.

Today was my first which wich experience . I ordered a lettuce wrap with buffalo chicken . It was okay . The ingredients were really fresh , especially the lettuce . If I were to come back , I would probably try a different lettuce wrap like turkey or something . The buffalo chicken lettuce wrap was not extremely satisfying .

This was my first experience with Which Wich and it will most likely be my last. The line was long and slow moving. When I got up to the front I ordered the philly cheese steak which there was an up charge for, so I paid almost $8 for a dry, flavorless 6 inch sub. The sand which I got had little flavor and was just dry. The only flavor came from the banana peppers I had them add. I don't think they even remembered to put the cheese in but I was rushing to get back to work and didn't have time to complain. I will not be returning here. There are much better options in the area.

OK. So I am giving the benefit of the doubt on a few things here. I am giving them 5 stars because I know they just opened up and learning the ropes. Sl

I am here because I absolutely love Italian Subs. I really wanted to test this place out when I saw this place passing it up. 

First - I like how you pick out a bag and check all the things you want on a sandwich. Very clever.

Second - I like how they categorize the menu. So, for example, under  seafood you can get a tuna sandwich, crab salad sandwich, surf and turf sandwich, etc. Clever. Easier to choose your sandwiches.

Third - The Small Grinder is 7 inches. So one  of those is good enough for me. 

Total cost for a small sandwich, chips, and a regular fountain drink was 9.71.

Negatives - Again they just opened so giving them the benefit of the doubt. But they were a bit slow making my sandwich. Maybe it's because they were heating up my sandwich. Service was still awesome. No I am sure there was a reason for it.

Also no combo meals." Deals. Sort of odd of a sandwich shop. Never seen that before and I go to many sub shops.

I will definitely come back again to test out the other Italian Sub options here. 

I took a pic of the menu so I hope this helps.

Only giving 1 start because I had to give something.  Ordered the day before online to pickup the next day.  Paid in advance.  Went to pickup at the time I requested and nobody was there.  1 employee who knew nothing about the order.  Wouldn't refund.  NEVER AGAIN!!!!  Absolutely the worst service I've ever had
Never again!  Super RUDE staff and NOT a good money value.  Got a Philly steak sandwich and it was very small and dry.  Dirty tables as well.  Steer clear!

The place looked nice and clean, i went around 12pm on a wed. Employees were nice, it was my first time there and the cashier came out and explained how their ordering went.

You first look at what type of meat you want then find the bag with the meat that you and then you can read and mark what you want on the bag. When you have marked all that you want on a the bag you can bring it to the cashier and they ring you up and you wait a couple minutes for them to make your sandwich for you.

I got 2 sandwiches
The gyro sandwich with classic onions and tomato, was very good it was comparable meat and sauce to a real classic gyro.

The other sandwich i got was a roast beef with pepperjack cheese, honey mustard,regular mayo, crispy strings (fried onions), lettuce, spinich, tomatoes, pickles, house chip (not sure what they were or if they even were in there), mushrooms, oregano,garlic,salt, and pepper.    This one was bigger than the gyro cuase it had way more stuff in it. It also was a great sandwich  and everything tasted fresh.

Overall i think this is a good place to eat at, comparable to jimmy johns but with more cuatomizable.

I love me a good sammy, so when I heard that Which Wich was opening up 5 minutes from our place, I was super excited.

Came in here during a lunch hour and totally expected to be overwhelmed cause I had looked at the menu online and it seems very extensive.  Now, is it as easy as Subway or JJs?  No, but you have awesome selections and the food is insanely fresh.  You order your type of sandwich by first picking out what kind of meat you want, then you can add toppings, make it skinny, pick out your sammy style (bread, bowl, or lettuce), and then you hand the cashier your marked up bag.  

Each employee was super helpful and friendly.  My chicken pesto was really good -- as I said before, everything is really fresh.  I opted to not have my sammy warmed up, so I enjoyed how each bite had a snap to it.  

I cannot wait to be back to try other options!

This place is good if you want a quick sandwich and you want something slightly better than Jimmy Johns or subway. 

I had the gyro and I can honestly say it wasn't bad at all! I got the 10' with no chips or drink and still paid 9.50 so I wasn't too thrilled about that, especially when I could've gotten a burger and bottomless fries at red robin (next door) for $10.

There is no combo option, the ridiculously high priced chips and drink come at a hefty cost (almost $4 if you want both) and no discount for getting both as opposed to most other Sandwich places. 

The sandwich was good, I ate it all and was full but it didn't knock my socks off or make me want to go back in a hurry for more. I think I honestly would be perfectly fine if I never went back (this was my second time)

The sauce on the gyro was pretty good and comparable to actual gyro sauce (the white colored cucumber sauce i don't know how to spell it) 

Overall if you are into sandwiches this place has a ton of options, is fast and taste pretty good, but for $9 and no chips or drink it seems a bit overpriced.

Great veggie/vegan options and the meat versions of things aren't bad either and my kiddos love the sandwiches. My only issue with every which wich I've ever been in is it takes FOREVER to get your food, even when its dead and everyone there looks like they are in pain as they make your food. Its a fraction of the size of other sandwich chains and yet it takes twice as long to get the food. Like I said, its good food and plenty of options, but if other known chains had the same options I'd go elsewhere

Tons of Sandwich options and great tasting!! Be careful though when you order sauces as I ordered only light mayo and dijon on my sandwich and when I got home and unwrapped my sandwich to eat, it was soggy and oozing with the sauces! I could barely eat it I had to take a napkin and wipe of so much sauce. 

A little on the pricey side. My fiance ordered a large Italian sub and I ordered a medium tuna and the total was around $21.00 not including chips or drinks. 

There was one lady working there and I looked at her name tag her name is Emma. She made being there waiting for our sandwiches super uncomfortable. They close at 9pm and we got there around 8:30pm. When we walked in she was sweeping and seemed like she was extremely unhappy about it and unhappy that we walked in. She was banging the broom around so loudly and shoving the chairs everywhere. As she was sweeping she was talking to another employee about her personal life and everyone in the restaurant could hear it. She would give us a couple glances that did not look friendly. Not very professional. 

I will come back here just next time say extremely light on the sauces.

I almost wanted to go there with a cross section of my 15 dollar sandwich and complain. it was so skimpy i finished it even though I have a light appetite, does that make sense that a light appetite finishes a 14 inch 15 dollar sandwich??? They served me this 1 layer of meat on my "wicked" sandwich so  they can handle my review instead of me ever going in again.  1 slice of turkey 1 of "beef"  a few thin slices of pepperoni, and 2 super thin slices of bacon, for 15 dollars.  There was less than 1/4 lb of meat and cheese, Ill never return.

Tasted ok (although a bit expensive) but both my husband and I got very sick after eating the sandwiches.
Ordering was not easy for first timers and the girl who was there to help, totally ignored us for some reason.
We probably will not be going back...

Yeah I know that all of the toppings are listed on the bags, but wouldn't one assume that an Italian sub would have lettuce and tomato and maybe even some onion?  Nope. I got a meat sandwich with nothing on it.
Normally I like this chain but the past two times I have been here they have messed up my sandwich

A friend from Crystal Lake was telling me all about the Which Wich that opened up out there, so when I saw there was one in Schaumburg, I stopped in there with my boyfriend. I enjoyed the ordering process of writing on the bag and then handing that to the cashier. I will say, that the prices were astronomical. For two 10.5 inch sandwiches and one large drink, it was $20. I could run to the grocery store and buy all the fixings to make sandwiches for a week with twenty bucks. Also, it was not busy at the time, but it seemed like it took them way too long to round up two sandwiches. Putting that aside, I did highly enjoy the food. The quality of the ingredients was good, and the service was friendly. I will probably never return, because of the price, but it was nice to experience.
Prices are way too high. Sandwiches are fine, but I got two 10" subs and it was $20! That was without any chips or drinks. Definitely overpriced for what you get.
Awesome food I don't know anything about the service but he food is awesome and I'm going back 100%...

At first I was annoyed because I was unfamiliar with the concept & how I had to basically build my own sandwich which I can do at home, but once I realized each meat category had its own selection of sandwich option, I got it! There really are a ton of options! I had the wicked & it was really good! Chocolate shake was good too :) it was a little pricey but we got 2 mediums thinking they'd be average size, but they were huge.

The Ultimate BLT was above average, but $10.65 for a BLT and a medium drink???  The place was filthy at 2:30 on a Friday afternoon.  The stainless steel tables were anything but shiny. They were greasy, sticky, and full of crumbs and other unknown bits  of food. The garbage can next to the pop machine was overflowing. None of this seemed to bother the employees, four of them sat in the dining room eating their sandwiches. I opted to eat in my car. If the front of the house is this dirty, I can only imagine what the food storage area looks like.  It's obvious that the first review (five stars) for this shop was from an employee. I call BS on that review.
Under 2.5 minutes for mine and my husband's sandwhich....which....(get it?)....is unheard of for a which which. The one near Barrington's Arboretum is BRUTALLY slow compared to this one.
This place is really good! Reminds me of Quiznos. 4 stars, could have had a clean table. Would go back!

We used to go there once a week and loved the food, people and the service, to the fact that we recommended this place to all our friends and now they are regulars too. However, last time when we visited they were lagging behind the orders so we expected a delay and sat down patiently. To our surprise people who came and ordered after us got their sandwiches before us and left. We were sitting there with no food for more than 45 minutes. Imagine waiting 45 minutes for a damn sandwich. REALLY! Really pissed with the service and I hope they fix it else they lose very frequent customers.

This is one of those places that is easy to overlook: uneventful exterior, completely forgettable inside, no
real seating, and no hype. Yet, nestled within the Glen Ellyn downtown and the charm of all the other restaurants is this western suburbs standout Mexican food.

Simple, delicious, and plentiful. Those three words nail this place and believe me you'll be saying they nailed it. Yes. You have to take the food and find seating somewhere. Yes. There is no ambiance to mention.

This is a I'm looking for authentic Mexican from good souls that treat you like family. Game. Set. Match.

TIP: they have two, yes only two, four person tables outside. On a beautiful summer day, you can't beat it in the western burbs!

Date of my visit: 13-November-2016
Time of my visit: Dinner

My girlfriend and I were in the mood for some Mexican and wanted to try a new place.  So we chose this one.  I got very excited as they would deliver for free on orders over $10.  We got our order together and called in for delivery, only to be informed that they did not deliver on Sundays....

The delivery order turned into pick up order.  Once, I got to the place, I realized that the place was pretty much pick up, delivery or take out, there were absolutely no table to seat at.  We ordered 2 regular (bigger than junior) burritos, chips and guacamole with rice water.  My total was just under $24.  So I reached out for my AMEX, only to be told that they did not accept it.  Again, this is one of my big pet peeves, either accept them all or be cash only.

I got home and we started eating.  The burrito was not that large.  Unfortunately, as I started eating it, the tortilla started to fall apart.  I must say, I liked the way pork was seasoned and the quality was good as I did not come across any chewy peaces.

The chips bag looked a bit small, but I am sure the volume was compatible to other place.  Guacamole was really fresh and tasted really good!

C-.  I would like to come back, but I am not sure when it'll be.  I would not mind trying their al pastor tacos.

Zero stars if I could....and I didn't even get a chance to eat what the GE folks have given a hearty 4.5 stars. 

As we walked into Javi's, we noticed a pile of beef just sitting on the counter in back. No big deal...right?  It's a dive Mexican joint....the screen door doesn't even close properly. Awesome....my kind of place.  (Not really....but let's order some food to try it for ourselves)

We were prepped, looked at the menu online prior and really wanted to get our Mexican grub on!  However, there is a group ordering ahead of us. They start talking to the cashier about Halloween costumes......"what are your costumes?....Are you dressing up?"  (Whatever...no biggie....right?)  The cashier decides to not place their order and to get the next order like any "normal" establishment and then talk to her friends about whatever after....  Nope. Stop the presses!  She proceeds to walk over to the aforementioned pile of meat, reach around the pile of beef and grab her cell phone.  Walking back out...."Here's our costumes! Yeah....really cute!"  

We walked out.  We had seen and heard enough. 

....to the folks complaining about why their orders are taking so stinking long....I think we cracked the code. 

To those that have actually had food from Javi's....congrats on the miracle!  Hope you remained healthy too!

To those who think the health department needs to revisit.... we concur. 

Sorry Javi....Your Mexican food doesn't earn nor deserve any stars or our money in our book.  Way too many quality Mexican establishments in this area. 

As a footnote.... we decided to eat at a different downtown GE establishment. Over an hour later, after we finished dinner....we walked past Javi's again on our way to our car.... the pile of beef still sitting on the counter....untouched.

We ordered for a group lunch of 16.  No two orders were the same and some orders had dietary restrictions like vegetarian only, no beans, etc.  Every order was correct and the delivery was right on time.
Javi's is a great choice for Mexican food in the Glen Ellyn and Wheaton area and they do a nice job on large orders.
Excellent authentic Mexican carry-out located in downtown Glen Ellyn.  The steak fajitas or fish tacos are among our favorites.

I was in the area for a floral arrangement class and I was hungry. I came to my bfff Yelp to find a place in the area since I'm unfamiliar. I stumbled across this place and decided to stop in. 

This is strictly a carry out restaurant. They had a few chairs lined up so you could sit and wait if you want. 

It's a family owned restaurant and they have their son there who's a little ham! He was adorable. He definitely made the wait more bearable with his crazy antics and entertaining personality.

I ordered 2 carne asada tacos with cilantro and onion. Anddddd elote!!! I love when places sell elote. They didn't skimp on the steak and it was well seasoned. My only complaint was they went a little too hard on the onion. I was tried to get as much off as I could but was difficult since I had to eat it in my car. The elote was pretty good just wish it had more spice to it. Total $10 and some change. 

My friend ordered the chicken taco with everything and a cheese quesadilla. She said both were delicious. $5

If I'm ever in the area again I might stop back, but then again maybe not since there's no seating.

I tried the pork, steak, and fish taco. The pork wasn't too greasy, and was savory.  The fish taco is made of tilapia, but I honestly could not taste the fish with all the vegetables they put in the taco. The steak taco was plain and ordinary.  I also tried the small chimichanga. While it tasted great, it was like an eggroll and much too small for the price. 

The Verde sauce is ok at best. The hot sauce has a bit of heat, but not overwhelming. Also, they provide generous amounts of lime. 

Overall, it's a solid taco takeout joint within Glen Ellyn , but pales in comparison to other taquiera places in terms of pricing and the amount of food.
Super delicious hole in the wall family restaurant. One of the best Mexican places I've had in all Chicagoland. Would highly recommend

Pretty good! They give you a lot of filling which is always nice. Comes out hot and ready. Nom.

Small Chimichanga is worth trying 
Fish Taco was spicy but good 
Pork Taco was also good 

I don't think it's the best I've ever had, but it's really good food and their service is awesome. 

No seats though. Only takeout.

OK, Mexican food is likely my favorite of all foods and I heard of a new burrito spot so of course i'm gunna give it a shot as i'm always game to find a better burrito or taco than what I knew existed. So Javis comes into my view and I grab a spot and pull in. I walk in the door and it is a small floor space without tables so its a take out spot. No problem, I order a a pork burrito. I request a cup of red and green sauce  to go with it. I got home and unwrapped it, stood it up and took a bite. The pork is seasoned very well, there is a great flavor with every bite! I pull out the red sauce and put a dab on for the next bite. The consistency of the sauce screams freshly made as its not total liquid, it's got a bit of body to it and the taste really got my attention. It paired very nicely with the pork! The green was also good but didnt complement the pork as well as it might with a chicken burrito but its still a good sauce!

Ambiance: It's a take out spot....not dining in here.
Taste: Thumbs up! It was really good! If Im in the area, Im stopping here for sure!
Value: With the flavor they are packing in there you cant get it at a better price!

I'll be back for sure!

I order from this location when I am at work. So I can review a few items.  The California burrito is delicious it come in different sizes. The junior can be eaten throughout the day and king size can be split between two people. The tacos are top notch and horchata is amazing. They know what they are doing!

Awesome authentic Mexican food in downtown Glen Ellyn!  Very accommodating and friendly owners.  

Highlights:
Pork Tamales (YUM! - good amount of heat too)
Chile Rellenos (Cooked to perfection, with a good red sauce)
Al Pastor Tacos (Giving Los Burritos a run for their money good!)
Steak Tacos (YUM, available with cilantro and onions upon request)
Steak Burritos (Awesome flavor, comes with sour cream, beans, lettuce, and cheese)

Wish List:
Get some to go Menus (I'll post some pictures here of the menu, however zoom may not work the greatest on yelp).  Please Javi get some menu's printed ASAP, even a black and white menu would be very helpful to your customers who phone orders in.

The first thing that struck me about Javi's is the hilarious small child sitting out front eating a sandwich on the step. He couldn't have been more than two, and yet there he was, chillin' and taking in the sites of downtown Glen Ellyn. Not a sight you often see in these parts, but I kinda like it!

Others have mentioned a "hole in the wall" vibe here, and I definitely got that. Odd paint job, subpar lighting, no tables or counter, just three counter height chairs scattered around. But I could see into the kitchen, and it was clean. The two adults we encountered were friendly and made us feel like they were happy we were there. Also, as I will explain later, the food was good. So I really don't care about all the other stuff.

Javi's accepts cash only, but they did mention that they're working on getting a "credit card machine" (which is not so much a machine these days, as a tiny device that can connect to a smart phone, but who am I to complain?) It was sort of a fun challenge for my husband and I to scrape together enough cash for our meals.

Now, the food...I highly recommend trying the chile relleno. Best I've ever had! The quesadilla was nothing to sneeze at either, but it was just overshadowed by that tasty, cheesy pepper. My husband liked his fajita meal as well, though it was served with chicken when he had ordered steak.

The location can't be beat. I love the walkability of our little downtowns. We'll be back to try some more, and to see Baby Javi taking in the sights out front. Though why he was eating a Subway sandwich and not a chile relleno, I'll never understand.

Ordered through Grubhub last night and was very impressed with the food and delivery time. Got a torta, mini chimis, and tacos. Really good stuff. They forgot to deliver our horchatas and when I called and just wanted a refund for the horchata, rather than having them redeliver they apologized and came back out right away with the horchatas. Super nice and accommodating. Also got some free guac and chips.

Definitely on our "go to" list.  Super fast.  Very friendly.  Order is always accurate (and we have kids who all have special requests).  Food is great.  No seating, so it is a "pick-up only" kind of joint.  They may have delivery (not sure).  Food is always super hot when we get it home.  One of our favs!

Just went to Javi's for the first time for lunch.  Had two tocos - 1 beef, 1 chicken.  Both were fantastic, but i think i liked the chicken slightly more than the beef.  The tacos tasted very authentic.  We plan to become regulars!
Unfriendly phone answer and reluctant to deliver. Not be willing to make any recommendations on choice of menu by bluffing everything here is perfect. Barbarians.

Greasy. Meat for tamale was not good. Burrito is terrible. If you are from the suburbs, this may pass as 'good' but those of us from the city-this is straight garbage. The nachos were not that bad, so I give it two stars (and they serve you quickly and the place is clean). But, the food is awful. Go to Rogers Park or Pilsen or West Town in Chicago and you can laugh at how awful the food is here compared to those areas.

Great hole-in-the-wall Mexican value.
I'm not normally big on Mexican food but I do enjoy Javi's.

Was very pleased with my first visit. I had the steak burrito and in my usual boring way had it with meat and cheese only and it was very tasty. A couple of more visits and I can say it is my favorite place for burritos.

Javi's is a weekly staple for us. My girlfriend tends to order the Enchiladas Verde, and they have always been delicious. The tacos remind me of something I'd get from a taqueria in southern California. Nothing on the menu has ever disappointed.

I second all previous reviews. 
Tacos were fantastic tasting.  Quiet location. Friendly people. Will return as often whenever  I'm looking for Mexican food.

Genuine service oriented lovely people and superb delicious fresh food!!!

I ordered for delivery in Lombard and they actually came it is the 3rd time I order and they never disappoint. 

I usually go for steak tacos with cilantro and onion. This time I ordered the lettuce, tomato, sour cream in them. Both were yummy great quality and fresh ingredients. I was bummed they had no horchata but I asked for Mexican coke and they had that so I was happy as it's much better than the one we get here. Delivery was quick, comes very chilled and food very hot.

Next, time I plan on stopping by to meet the infamous lil boy Javi. 

I WISH Lombard had Mexican food like this. Until then I'll happily order from Javi's!!!
Excellent food and service, but wish there was an easier pick up menu available for call-in orders. Very affordable and the burritos are big, especially considering the price. Very good

This is our "go to" restaurant for the family. Kids love it, we love it.

The tacos are all killer. Burritos are to die for. Great inexpensive Mexican food.

Javi's is the best. To-go only due to village ordinance.

The couple who run it live in the city and make the treacherous commute each day, sometimes with their toddler son, the infamous "Javi," in tow. They embody an old school work ethic, and they are always truly grateful for one's patronage. Their food is made fresh and is excellent. You won't find better takeout Mexican in the area. And the only sit-down Mexican that is better is A Toda Madre around the corner. But that's a completely different price point and experience.  Because they operate on a skeleton crew and make everything right there, wait times can be a bit long for takeout. But hey, you can spend the time you're  waiting thinking of the countless aphorisms in the English language that remind us that good things are worth the wait. Also, because they don't have a public restroom, they cannot have a seating area.

When you go--and you must!--order a burrito or nachos with steak. You won't be disappointed. Tacos al pastor...ridiculous. Rice and beans are always fresh, not crusted over from being reheated four times a week. Chile relleno is as good as the greatest pepper in the world smothered with cheese gets. 

So, if you've got 15 minutes to wait and you're ready to be impressed, make little Javi's parents' day and pay them a visit.
Javi's inspired me to write my first Yelp review.  Love the carne asada burrito and service with a smile.  Hope they're here in Glen Ellyn for a long time to come.  Cheers!
One of the best Mexican places I have had in IL. The tacos are amazing!! I highly recommend if you are looking for delicious tacos! I hope they expand their location into a dinning in restaurant.

We stopped in late last night to grab a bite to take home. Normally we'd go to Los Burritos Tapatios. However, after reading many of the positive reviews, we decided to give Javi's a try. I must say, I was impressed with their kindness even though we were walking in at 9:45pm, 15 minutes before closing. There was no attitude at all. I ordered a pastor taco and my husband ordered a steak burrito. Both were delicious and we agreed that the quality was better than Los B's. My husband said that Los B's burritos had a little more flavor, though probably from cooking with more fat(lard?). Next time we're craving Mexican, we're choosing Javi's if they're open.

This place is amazing! I love Mexican food and I'm always on the search for great tacos! The shrimp tacos are to die for and so are chicken and steak! Everything had great flavor and was well priced. The only down side is I wish they had tables to sit at and it seems the only way you can eat your food is to go!

Delicious food and great price.  Doesn't have a huge sign but its just east of The Stand and the Glen Art Theater on Crescent.  Very nice people - really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  They don't skimp on the meat and ingredients are all fresh and high quality.

I work in downtown Glen Ellyn so when the office needs tacos we always order javi's!. Maricruz is always soo pleasant when she takes my order and she even remembers who I am when I call. They are always super quick in getting our orders to our office and they don't charge us any extra for delivery! Her husband is also realy nice.

Lets get down to the food. The tacos are really good. I just wish they would add tacos de lengua, and they didn't make agua de horchata seasonal!. The burritos are always a favorite in our office. The meat is always well cooked. The taco salads are excellent as well. Their green salsa is sooooooo good!!

If you blink your eyes you wil miss javi's in downtown Glen Ellyn so look closely! It's deff a gem!

My sister introduced me to this place! I'm in love with their steak and el pastor burritos. I'm also very picky with my horchata, and this place is right up there with my #1 spot! This definitely is the place to go for some yummy, authentic, Mexican food! I can honestly say that we will be frequenting this place on a regular basis.

Best damn burrito I've had in a long time.  We have tried burritos in several other places, and they were good.  But this was GREAT!  Three of us had the skirt steak burritos, while one had the chicken burrito.  All of us had guacamole put on them.

The burritos tortillas were slightly crisped and the meat was well seasoned.  But the flavor of the guacamole made them great!  

There is no sit down seating.  The whole place is a waiting area.  You can see right into the kitchen, which looked clean.  It certainly needs a paint job and some more seating for those who are waiting.  But really, who cares?  You go there to pick up your food.

I think we found a new favorite!  Can't wait to try some of their other dishes.

I went on a recommendation of a fellow yelper, the carne asada burrito (but decided to add avocado). Incredible. The meat flavorful, the beans seasoned nicely, and a bonus is that you can add extra meat if you want to! I think it's about comparable with Los, maybe not as large of a burrito as Los in diameter (it may have been the overabundance of beans there versus meat), but the quality and flavor surpasses that aspect. 

What a little town gem. I cannot wait to make my way through the menu.

I was greeted by little Javi as most people have, and he handed me a book to semi-read, he'd come back and want to go through the book when he wasn't moving around or dancing. Adorable.

I live in Downtown Glen Ellyn and I was here when this place first opened. They're amazing. I always order pickup and bring it back up to my apartment and they never let me down. Perfect for broke college kids who want delicious food at affordable prices.

Excellent food and service. The people who run this place are so kind! I work a few doors down and eat here at least twice a week. I hope they are here to stay!

The al pastor in both taco and burrito form is the best I've ever had! Really wonderful place.

I live in downtown Glen Ellyn.  I eat here at least once a week.  It is delicious.  The steak is tasty and cleaned of fat, so you don't get bites of steak fat like you do at other places.  I definitely recommend this place.  I have all my friends and family  going here now. The restaurant  itself  is coming along. They have a nice new counter, credit card system, and  a really nice mural and paint job.

I am sorry to say, as this place had come highly recommended to me, but I will never be dining here.  I ordered delivery to my office, was quoted 20 minutes.  Over 45 minutes later, I called and was told by the woman on the phone, that she would call the delivery driver, that he was "very busy", and she would call back.  I waited another 25 minutes, and received no call back.  

I then called again, only to have a gentleman answer the phone, argue with me, tell me I was not in my office (I never left) and then to say " I'M BUSY!" and hang up the phone on me.  

It doesn't really matter how good your burritos are with a piss poor attitude, you'll lose customers quickly.

I ordered from here today. The guy who picked up was extremely rude. I placed an order and paid on grubhub and when I called to check in. He told me that there was no driver and that the owners didn't pick up their phone. Extremely unprofessional people. The guy at the restaurant kept hanging up. Really sad considering I used to order from here all the time. Pathetic service.

This food is nothing less than perfect! So good!!! Everything is very flavorful and you can't stop eating :) we found our favorite Mexican place. The people that work there are really nice too! So friendly! Thanks for the great food!

How funny, first time going to the movies in Glen Ellyn, and we find a brand new, just opened Mexican restaurant that is owned by a chef who cooked at one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Chicago for 22 years! They don't have tables, so at this point, it's really take out. The carne asada tacos are delicious, salsa is tasty. Please give them a try, they will grow the restaurant as they get further permits, so they really need your support!

We had Javi's food just yesterday for our tailgate party at the Bears game and it was awesome!  Javier, the owner, was nice enough to actually come to the tailgate and cook the food for us right there right on the spot. We had a wide selection of food and it was all really good.  

My favorites were the guac and the chorizo and egg tacos.  I high recommend Javi's for a private party and to eat if you are looking for good Mexican food.  Glen Ellyn was in need of a good Mexican restaurant so I'm happy Javi's is now in town.
Javi and his family run an A+ joint here. Food is authentic and good. Serving sizes are large.

So pleased to have a decent taco joint in downtown Glen Ellyn!

I had the steak and pork taco dinner. The steak taco was good --I could have used a little bit more flavor from the meat, but it was still tasty; the pork was tender, flavorful and topped with a tangy, spicy tomatillo(?) sauce that made things even more delicious. My order included the traditional red/green sauces which both tasted fresh, with just the right amount of spice, and made an excellent counterpart to the steak. 

The pricing is reasonable, and the service is great. I'm already looking forward to my next taco run at Javi's.

This place is a dive with awesome al Pastor tacos. The chicken tacos are pretty good too but the carne asada is way too chewy. Javi's is way better than Los B's. 

FYI, Javi is the adorable toddler hanging around out front. 

PS: Credit cards are now welcome.
So glad this is in town!  The burritos are delish and the service is quick.  You certainly cannot beat the price either!!!!

Definitely a no frills restaurant. As stated by others no seating, only a couple chairs while you wait. I can't really comment on the service since you just order and wait for your food. I had the steak tacos and found them to be just average and a little on the bland side. My husband had the fajitas and they were delicious. After reading all the yelp reviews I had really high expectations. The prices are decent though so we would go back but with keeping in mind not everything is exceptional.

This is a dive restaraunt, with no real seating.  We ordered the steak fajita dinner and the carne asada tacos.  The portions were generously large.  The food was very well prepared with good seasoning on the meat.  

The customer service was extremely friendly.

Overall, the food and customer service was very good and we will be back.

Great burritos. I can definitely say they sure do make their burritos better than most around chicago.  Makes me feel at home. And a little baby running around. No tables to eat at, but just bring it home.

My go-to Mexican food place :)
Meat is made with amazing spices.
You should eat here!!!

The freshest, tastiest, most affordable mexican food in the area. The steak burritos are to die for--so juicy and full of flavor. The guac is awesome as are the grilled fish tacos with onion and cilantro. They were out of street corn--must try it next time! The wait is long on a Friday at dinnertime--that's the only drawback, but it's worth it!
They're nachos, street corn, tacos are all tummy satisfying delicious! Though they have no tables to sit down and eat. But inside has beautiful murals and art work!
This place is lovely. The pork tacos are super good, the walls are lime green, and the owners seem like sweet folks. Hot tip tho: it's currently takeout only.

This is my favorite local Mexican Restaurant for carry out. I love the Shrimp Fajitas. The come with corn tortillas, beans, rice, lettuce and tomatoes. Everything I have ordered from Javi's has been really good.

My wife & I are from California. San Diego to be specific. We've been searching high and low for a place that reminds us of home. Well...we found it. HANDS DOWN the best burritos we've had in the NW Suburbs. A must try.  Take out only. Go with the Carne Asada or Al Pastor. Gotta try California style...add some Guac & Sour Cream if you'd like. Game over.

Great local burrito place! I go here quite often and the food is consistently great! The woman is always friendly when she takes your order. If you call ahead your order will be ready in 10 minutes. The prices are average (not low / not high). I highly recommend the steak burrito and steak tacos.

Delish and cheap!  That's how I like it. I love their steak burritos. My daughter loves the chorizo burritos n the quesadillas with chorizo. Also tried their tacos, rice, n beans. Great taste. You got to try them. And they deliver!!!!?

Javi's kicks donkey butt.   This is the best taco and or burrito place newly strategically placed one block west of our beloved GBW. Recommend any tacos or burritos.  Can't wait till they get tables.   Until then. Go there for lunch or breakfast soon. 

Hasta la vista BABY!!!!!!!!!!!  @Javis
Went to Javi's after reading all the great Yelp reviews. Got an Al pastor burrito and LOVED it. Huge portions, great quality. Hope to try everything on the menu!!

Authentic Mexican food with great flavor and friendly workers.  That's great news for Glen Ellyn. I tried the steak burrito. I found  the flavor just slightly on the salty side. However,  it was delicious! ! No regrets here. I will be back. Thank you Javi's Burrito for the great burrito.

Today, Wednesday November 5 2014, I tried a steak taco, and the steak tostada. The steak tostada had a sturdy flat hard shell as a foundation,  coated with thick past of delicious frijoles (smahed beans), covered with home style seasond steak, in top with lettuce tomatoes and shredded cheese.

The steak taco was was well made, the tortilla held the meat without breaking apart. Both items, the tostadas and the taco were delicious, and authentic. Javi's is definitely the taste of the town. Javi's Burrito has earned my 5 stars.

wooooooo...shrimp tacos for lent. and they are delicious!
the whole place got a new coat of paint, and a great mural.
love this place.

I was so happy to find Javi's. It reminds me of one of my favorite restaurants in California; a family run place that is proud to share their food with you. I have also lived in New Mexico and so I have eaten at lots of Mexican restaurants.
In New Mexico enchiladas and chile rellenos were the test of good food. Hardly ever do you find good enchiladas. Javi's enchiladas are the best I have found in a long time. I crave them and that speaks volumes! In New Mexico you are judged by your enchiladas and at gatherings it gets very competive! People always want you to try "my enchiladas"they are the best! Javi's are really delicious with the right amount of heat. The rellenos are very good and I appreciate that you put a tasty ranchero sauce on them. Some places neglect that touch. I lived in The Hatch Valley and have eaten the best chile that the SW has to offer. 
This is a really good place with honest Mexican food true to the spirit of Familia. I hope they prosper!

I live between Los Angeles and Chicago and this place is at the top of my list of favorite traditional Mexican restaurants. Javi is awesome, and his place is a gem in uGlen Ellyn. Personal favorites: pastor burrito and steak fajita burrito. Keep these guys busy!

Stopped late last night after a few for a burrito. Great! Fresh not greasy. Definitely recommend, so much that i am her right now getting dinner again! Having the taco dinner with pastor, carne asada and fish will update the review. Join others in saying well worth the visit and should support!

This place just gets more delicious by the visit. Faves are the avocado taco and pastor taco. Just wanted to update this review to day they just REDECORATED and have a very nice new paint job both outside and in! CHECK IT OUT!!! I LOVE YOU JAVIS!!!!! EAT HERE!!!!!!
Good food served fast by friendly people- exactly what you want from your local burrito establishment.
They honestly have the best tacos I have ever had. I believe they rival the fancy mexican place (Atoda Madre) in taste. Not to mention it's super fast. The steak tacos are heavenly.

Finally I don't have to go all the way to the city or West Chicago to get authentic Mexican food at legit cheap prices! They do take credit cards now and it's $2.50 or so for a taco! Unlike most fake Mexican food places in Wheaton and Glen Ellyn, they also have horchata, the deliciously sweet cinnamon-rice drink I crave all summer. Though their tacos are American style (sour cream + lettuce) it's super delicious. They give homemade hot sauce too! SO good!
I recently got the chorizo torta.  Excellent!  This is the kind of place we need to keep in downtown Glen Ellyn.  Thank you, Javi!

Los B's has been my standby burrito and taco choice. I tried Javi's for the first time today, ordering a couple of pastor tacos. The first thing I noticed was that the bag seemed heavier than expected. Indeed the tacos were stuffed. In the end, they were the best tacos I've had in a while. And two actually filled me up for lunch. Will be back to try a fajita burrito next time!

We just discovered this little restaurant in downtown Glen Ellyn. The first week alone we ordered takeout three times! I personally haven't seen the interior but the food is outstanding and very authentic. If you want to try something on the healthier side try the tacos with onion and cilantro...very flavorful. So glad Javi's opened in Glen Ellyn!
This is a great takeout place, and the owner is so nice. Santa Fe has the atmosphere but the food here is far superior.

I absolutely love this place, and get carry out 2-3xs a week.  Service is extremely fast esp if you call ahead. By far the best authentic Mexican food that I know of in the area.  The fact they deliver is also a huge plus!

This is some of the best Mexican food around. It is freshly made to order and take out only. The burritos are tasty and full of flavor. The fish tacos are made from fresh grilled fillets. Try this place before the high school students catch on.

Good food, fairly inexpensive.  I had the chicken fajita burrito.  They crisp the burrito tortilla which I really liked.  The only thing that I didn't like was that it was so juicy that it was really hard to eat when i got to the end as it was VERY messy.

I got a carne asada and avocado taco for about $2.50. I totally approve! It was delicious, it was the perfect size to fill me up, and it had a lot of ingredients stuffed in there! I wish that there were tables to sit down and eat there, but it's a great place to go for a quick lunch that is cheap, yummy, and filling. The guacamole was really good. I liked the chips, but they weren't my favorite. I prefer tortilla chips to be a little thinner. I work close by so I would totally go back when I want a cheap and quick lunch. I was skeptical of this place as it looks like a little hole in the wall, and it definitely exceeded my expectations. Yumm.

This place is awesome - I loved the legit tacos de asada and my boyfriend said the vegetarian burrito was delicious.  Plus, everything was reasonably-priced and ready right away.   I have to admit I'm nervous that they won't survive in Glen Ellyn due to the inability to pay with credit/debit cards and their low prices, but we'll do our best to keep them here!
Had the steak burrito and it was excellent!!! Very economical.  May have to make it a weekly ritual.  Loved it!!!

Bare bones but delicious!  And cheap to boot.  I was a little hesitant as the aesthetics are, well, missing.  But, this is a find. Amazing fish tacos with the perfect amount of spice. My husband had the pork burrito.  Everything made fresh while you wait.  They may give A Todo Madre a run for their money!

This is a sleeper burrito place that makes fantastic authentic California-style burritos much better than you can get in chain burrito places. It's a very small establishment, and doesn't seem very busy, but you'll be glad you tried it and will come back again and again. A treat to have inexpensive quality take-out so lacking in downtown Glen Ellyn. You'll love it.

This place is great. We had the steak torta, and 3 tacos - chicken, fish, and pork. All had really good flavor but the seasoning on the pork really stood out! Javi's doesn't skimp on the ingredients either. The guacamole is fresh and delicious but was a bit milder than I usually like. The only negatives about this place are the lack of seating for those waiting, and it's obviously pretty tough to find parking in the downtown area especially on the weekends. I hope Javi's sticks around - love it!

Outstanding Mexican food and very reasonable prices. I love the fish tacos but need to order them mild because they can be fiery. Great but spicy. My husband could exist on their beef/steak tostadas, eating them every night.

Just what downtown Glen Ellyn needed! Been here a couple of times (take out) and sold to be a regular. Great food and service at the best value in the downtown area. Owner/family run hence the results noted above.

Great hole-in-the-wall restaurant. I've been there twice now and the food is fantastic. I've had vegetarian burritos both times I went and they were always very delicious with a good mixture of ingredients, and the fish taco I ate had excellent pico de gallo and the fish was very well cooked. The service seems really friendly and it deserves further permits from the village to spruce up its aesthetic design. Of course, with the village president owning The Stand, which is next door, there definitely could be a large conflict of interest there. Anyways, I highly recommend trying Javi's out, it's probably the best mexican place in Glen Ellyn right now.

Stopped in last night for the first time. Had the pork (pastor) burrito. I was pretty darn good.  The sauce on the pork was great, and not too spicy.  I will be back to try the other menu items.  Only wish it was open later, because I can see a lot of late night post-bar potential with no driving required.
Best Mexican food in the area. Fast, cheap, super nice owners. No seating so it's all to go.

Finally a place with good Mexican food!  My son and I stopped by for a quick lunch after walking around the village. Good prices, great food, excellent service. Best restaurant I've been to in Glen Ellyn so far, we will definitely be going back.

A cafeteria you will love more than any cafeteria ever.

Its not just a cafe. It offers you wide range of yummy gelatos, smoothies, shakes and what not. Ofcourse they all taste yummy.

Apart from a great eat-out, you can get yourself a mug/tee/bottle/keychains printed with any art of yours. Each table has a set of sharpies and paper, draw what you want to be printed on any goodie. They have board games too!! You just cant get bored there. 

It is run by interns of GigiU. They are just adorable and will serve you with all their heart.

Just went to Hugs & Mugs with my fianc...AMAZING! We got coffee and sampled some gelato. Christine gave us a tour of Gigi's Playhouse and it was awesome. Christine is wonderful the place is wonderful and we will definitely be back.

This place is a hidden gem.  It is connected to Gigi U which I believe is a continual education & offers internship for those with down syndrome.  It's a pretty cool place and will definitely warm your heart.  We highly recommend this place.

I have been to Hugs and Mugs several times. It is a "feel good" place to be. The staff is all friendly and knowledgeable. I learned all about the healthy ingredients that are put into the  cookies. The gelato is a hit among myself and my grandchildren, and there is plenty of room with great furniture to interact or just to relax. You can also have parties here and unleash your creative side by creating artwork on mugs or water bottles to take home. The best part is that the money made at the cafe is for a great cause.

I had guests in from Sweden Skilltwins Josef and Jakob YouTube soccer sensations. I was looking for something to do being that we already did the typical tourist things. 

I logged in and had an issue getting tickets so I messaged them direct. They answered immediately and were able to accommodate a party of 10 with no issues. 

We arrived an everything was easy. Our tickets were upfront and we barely had to wait. 

Our seats were third row and it was an amazing view. 

I highly recommend this type of activity for your out of town guests especially if they are from overseas. They all had a blast. There was nothing like this from back home. 

As far as silverware. You don't need any Bc you use your hands. They offer alcoholic frozen drinks from the bar which my favorite was the mango margarita and you can get a virgin one fir the kids. All of them come in a take home cup. 

Thank you to the awesome staff and managers that made our night out one to remember. This was so much fun. 

The waitress was very nice and always attentive to us. 

Thank you again

A night full of nerd-tastic fun! 

Pros: 
Fun and entertaining
Friendly, engaging staff
Good food

Cons: 
Crazy expensive

This place is probably not for EVERYONE, but if you're a nerd at heart, you'll love it. The staff is very friendly and, though a bit campy, very good at keeping in character. 

The price - oy yikes! Tickets are like $60 normally, but I was lucky to have been invited to go when they're having their fall sale. They also have a Throwback Thursday sale ($36/ticket). The Royalty upgrade is, in my opinion, definitely worth it. Front row alone was too awesome to pass up, but you also get a commemorative VIP towel!

I'm super cheap - in fact, I've gone 32 years without going to this because I was always reluctant to spend so much money. But it was a good time.

The real kicker is all of the "fun" stuff you'll be tempted to buy. Trinkets, toys, even WEAPONS. And if you want a commemorative glass, you'll pay quite a penny - most expensive VIRGIN pina colada I've ever had ($15) just so I could go home with a pretty purple goblet. 

As far as the food - it's actually pretty good, if a bit simple. And I was surprised to be full, despite the fact that it wasn't what one would consider "feast sized." You get a piece of garlic bread, a bowl of soup (tomato, which was really good), a quarter chicken, piece of corn, half an herb-roasted potato and the pastry of the night (in my case, a delicious piece of lemon pound cake YUM). The wench was witty and pretended everything was dragon parts: dragon scale, dragon blood, baby dragon, dragon horn, dragon egg - tee hee!

I was very impressed with the horsemanship and, of course, the King's falcon! So neat! 

All in all a good time, though not something I could afford to do on a regular basis.

Oh man -- I've been wanting to go here since I was a kid... now that I have kids of my own, I can fulfill them and not be that creepy guy alone in the playground! In case you don't know, Medieval Times is a dinner a show, featuring decent food you eat with your hands (no silverware!) and cool storyline of a king hosting a tournament of knights fighting to the death. The venue itself looks like a Spanish castle and inside, the place is pretty cool. 

The ticket itself says you should be there 90-minutes or so earlier than showtime, but from reading other Yelp reviews and just talking to past peeps, this doesn't seem necessary. They do have a gigantic "waiting area" which is pretty huge, almost as spacious as the stage/arena and seating area itself where you can spend and waste your time/money before the show starts. PRO-TIP: We did a Sunday early afternoon 1:30PM show, and got to the place at 1:00PM, and the timing was perfect -- we had time to check-in, peruse the displays of swords, weaponry, and stare at horses, and before-ya-know-it, it was time to go into the arena. There were plenty of seats at the Sunday early afternoon show, so if you don't like crowds or waiting, and an early Sunday afternoon is doable, definitely aim to go to this showtime.

Upon entering, you can take a picture with either the princess or king and right before the show, they will take a picture of you and your party with you wearing your souvenir paper-crowns, at your seat. After the show, they have a green-screen for more photo opportunities. All in which case you will have to fork over some dineros to get a copy of. I forked-over the money for the before the show seated picture.

Before and during the show, there are vendors peddling lighted and flashy swords and all sorts of plastic toys. Be strong and say "no!" ha. For those who forked-over some extra cash, you can sit in the VIP section, which is essentially the front row. We opted for the "first-come, first-seated" seats, and we were seated in the second row, which is perfectly fine. In the VIP section, you also get a flag/banner thingy with your knight's color, to cheer your designated knight on with. Each seat is pre-populated with banners and towels, regardless if anyone sits at the seat or not. 
PRO-TIP: After the show, there were plenty of banners and towels laying around. Feel free to grab em. The waitstaff don't mind and they said it was fairgame

The waitstaff who serve you the food is extremely friendly and everyone role-played as if we were in medieval times. The menu included:
- Tomato bisque (dragon blood)
- A baked half-chicken (dragon flesh)
- Half bake potato (dragon ears)
- A slice of garlic bread (dragon eggs)
- Apple turnover (no clever name for this one by the waiter)
- Small quarter corn-on-a-cob (I forgot what he called this)
Note: Past reviews from others, indicate a rib, but there were no such thing here.

Overall, food was good, chicken was moist and not dry, and the apple turnover was pretty good. I would agree with others that the tomato bisque was rather too salty for me. They had lemonade, pepsi, water, and coffee as well to wash this all down. PRO-TIP: If you have to shred or separate the chicken from the bones, which I had to, definitely bring your own plasticware and plenty of napkins. I did, and it was money. Everyone said it was a lot of food, but being a beast like me, I was skeptical. I believe it was just enough. If you have picky kids like me, they will find something to eat -- since there were several different food, the kids were able to find enough to eat. 

BATHROOM REVIEW: Located outside the arena, the mens bathroom was roomy and had enough urinals to keep the waiting line flowing nicely. There were 5 urinals (i believe... I don't remember) and 4 or 5 stalls. The lines moved quickly. Sit or squat? Squat, my lord.

We had a pretty good time here. Food was simple but pretty good with soup chicken potato corn and dessert. They have full bar and really neat artifacts. The show kinda dragged at times but it was still interesting. We used a coupon so it wasn't that bad. Service was good. However minus one star for them constantly trying to sell you stuff.

Quite possibly one of the most unique places to enjoy an evening of fun. Great deal when you consider the constant deals and coupons that are available for shows.

While the food isn't Michelin Star worthy -- it is definitely much better than what you'll find at the majority of entertainment / food combination offerings. Portion sizes are huge, flavors are simple but enjoyable (closer to restaurant than amusement park style food), and the service is extremely friendly. In particular, I have to commend the amazing service I received as my waiter was extremely patient, funny, an excellent listener, and frequently checked up on me to make sure that I was having an amazing experience. From the other sections I could see, it seemed that others were also very happy with their service, especially with how well the servers interacted with the kids.

The show itself is very entertaining and professionally run. Although there's lots of moving elements, weapons, lights, etc. going on at the same time -- everything was perfectly synchronized. The show included many aspects of tricks with the horses, fights with the knights, some Medieval-themed story, and a falcon show. This is a nice change from the comedy or musical theater shows which are typically the live shows I watch locally.

Overall, if you're looking for a very unique experience in the suburbs, definitely give Medieval Times a try. It'll provide a very fun and memorable experience and is a great deal considering that you get a full show, awesome atmosphere,and enough food for leftovers for a reasonable price.
