I have been through full surgery twice in April to remove a breast mass, so I emailed the "contact us" via website about where to buy/get a t-shirt being a huge supporter of October as Breast Cancer Awareness month. I certainly "Go Pink" & support "Fight for the Cure" everything the very best I can. I was emailed back saying, they would love to ship me a T-Shirt free of charge & to please confirm my mailing address. (I must have been on file from multiple prior visits over the years or for being signed up on their email lists.) A couple weeks had passed & I was still waiting at months end. I replied to the email if they ever shipped 1 since it didn't make it to me yet, but if available or lost in mail I was still interested. I was kindly replied to that they were sorry for the delay (They were sorry? It is my pleasure to have received your gift, kindness, and modesty in that way!) but were trying to find me a size small & weren't having much luck nearing month end (my guess would be contacting the sales coordinators at the other castles). This was beyond thoughtful effort & my gift arrival was exceedingly generous beyond expectations. This is all a gift, so any good person shall be grateful for ANY size shirt delivery at any time. I was THRILLED that my email led to a package on my doorstep, the when opened included: A t-shirt, a pink Medieval Times goblet of fantastic quality - metal, durable, the splendid ones you see on the Castle's bar for sale & the most heart touching part was an envelope enclosed w/ a letter. The unfolded letter read, "Our Kingdom is in need of a Fearless Warrior & Survivor Just like YOU! Enclosed you will find two free tickets redeemable at the Chicago Castle." The envelope had a post it stuck to it reading, "Hi Amanda! Feel free to call me directly @ ###-#### to book your reservation. -Nereide Crisologo; Sales Coordinator." WOW. Talk about a company, sales coordinator, or INDIVIDUAL person going above & beyond. I am tremendously thankful for everything, including people like you. The company is blessed to have you on their staff, & customers are hugely lucky. I am happy just crossing paths w/ people like you! Godspeed!

I called to book my tickets & chose the cheapest day I have seen all year: Black Friday. $30 for ALL seats. We were granted the best seats I could ever imagine, front row of the mid blue section. I had a friend from Germany (working on an internship for his PhD in USA for 3 months) visiting & wanted to show him OUR castle. Germany has real castles, but we have the BEST castles with the whole set-up that makes the entire evening at Medieval Times so grand. We pulled in the free parking lot and he giggled & said, "That's a castle? That is very cute!" Follow-up after visit, he was DELIGHTED by everything inside; Staff, Museum, Bar, Feast, Knights, Real Horses, Attire, & SHOW! Neddy & Medieval Times - I cannot thank you enough in words. You have been a Godsend through a very long tough year. What you have done for me, & the friend I was able to share it with, was nothing less than amazing. I have always loved Medieval Times, but now will forever be a loyal fan of your business from the bottom of my heart. To reach out like that to one person is remarkable. In life, we can't do everything, but we can do something. I have reached for a hand, & you reached back to my HEART. Godspeed to you! Neddy: Thanks-thou art most kind my fair lady!

The castle is most beauteous. Arrive early & see the Medieval Torture Museum. It's a small walk through that is painfully fascinating! The bar makes excellent drinks & even the normal cups are plastic holographic keepsakes. Mayhap I will fetch the ale. Yay, methinks so! I had 2 pina coladas He had 2 beers.

Dinner is served 1 item at a time during the show. The Feast: Garlic Bread, Tomato Bisque Soup, Oven-Roasted Chicken (Dragon Leg per the Royal King), Spare Rib, Herb-Basted Potato, Pastry, Coffee. Beverages included (unlimited refills) are: Pepsi, Diet, Iced Tea, Lemonade. A vegetarian feast is available & I hear they are served silverware. Silverware? Nay, methinks not during this era! Methinks thine art cheaters!

Ye cheer for a knight of thy color section through the games followed by mounted & ground combat. The noble knights ride out like strapping Lords atop majestic horses. Our blue knight was grand! Ye art quite handsome. I have been admiring thee. Ye did well in the games & combat. HUZZAH! Tis most splendid! After the show, you can meet your knight for a photo. I asked if I could sit on his lap or chair edge. He said, "Certainly." Greetings, Blue Knight! How fare thee? Perchance we shall meet again. Fare thee well, My Lord!

Medieval Times- Cheers for an "out-of-the-ballpark" evening & spectacular customer service!

The kids loved Medieval Times.  The food was slightly above average, the kids loved having the opportunity to eat with their hands and not get yelled at by mom and dad.  The entertainment is very good, although very clearly choreographed and staged.  Don't get me wrong, I think the performers do put a lot of effort into it and I think the choreography is how they keep it safe for them, I just think they could do a little better job not making it so obvious.

Now the price was pretty high and they do seize every opportunity to extract more money out of you (drinks, souvenirs, upgrades, etc.)

I think the key is to show up pretty early to get a good seat.  If you're going on a weeknight it appears there aren't a ton of people visiting so you can get very good seats without paying for the upgrade packages.

It was one of those great experiences for the kids. I expect it was a once in a lifetime experiences and probably not something will be coming back to any time in the future, but that's purely from the standpoint of once you've seen the show you've really seen it all.

Highly recommended for a reasonably good meal, a very good show and overall a highly entertaining evening!

If Chuck E. Cheeses and Game of Thrones had a baby, it would be Medieval Times. Special note, Medieval Times is not a good idea for those with equinophobia (fear of horses).

After all of these years and a recession, it's amazing that Medieval Times is still in business. Surprisingly, I really enjoyed myself. For starters, they had beer and not just your typical Miller products but Newcastle Brown Ale. $6 for a 16 ounce beer - not bad when you're used to downtown prices. The price doesn't bother you as much after being called "m'lord" from the bartenders. 

All of the knights had long flowing manes with facial hair - I wouldn't be surprised if they were previous Metallica cover band members. The entertainment was a medieval version of WWE style action and choreography. Just like professional wrestling, you think it's stupid in the beginning until you get sucked in and can't help but cheer along. The actors did a great job of keeping in character. In particular, the announcer had an excellent Old English accent - definitely better than Tyrion Lannister's. But like Game of Thrones, there was a lot of dialogue and I didn't understand the plot but kept watching anyways. 

There is something about Medieval Times that brings out the child in you. Maybe it's something about girls and horses and boys and swords. For horse lovers, the horses are definitely an attraction since you'll see horse choreography at its best - expect plenty of galloping and prancing. For the boys, you'll see plenty of clashing of weapons from maces, long swords, to battle axes. If you want to add to your collection or take a special souvenir home, you can even buy real swords. You can get a claymore or a rapier to add your chainmail set. Purchase $200 worth of value, you'll get 50% off a shield - perfect for the LARPer in your family. 

For the overall value, we got a deal for buy one get one free so it ended up being $35 a person. Not bad when you think about it in terms of a two hour show with dinner. Otherwise, I would not recommend going for the full price of $59.95 for adults. It's equivalent to watching a movie and going out to eat for dinner but for the whole family.

In the end, Medieval Times is really for the children. For parents, here is a breakdown of why Medieval Times is great for your child's next party:

1. Children are well behaved and seated which makes large groups easy to manage
2. There are horses and plenty of them
3. Two hours of entertainment that also comes with a full meal
4. Your children will become the coolest kids in school afterwards

Ok so the prospect of talking in a strange medieval dialect while bravehearting my food (hands only) didn't strike me as being an awesome evening.  

Man was I wrong!!!!

This was our first visit, went for hubbies bday and it was one of the coldest nights this winter---thought we were going to be the only people there--but luckily some other cray cray people wanted to come out for an evening of entertainment---and lovely liquid libations to warm them up.

It is a little on the pricey side if you pay full price but they were running a promo where all tix were $35, kiddies $29--tolerable---they are great at upselling a variety of packages.  Actually I would say they're pretty good at the upselling game.  The show started at 7:30 but they encourage you to be there at 6:30---so you can be bombarded by all the randomness from the wine bar, main bar, glitter tattoos, things that light up/glow, torture museum---I give them props---they're just trying to get that paper! We opted for the "Royal" upgrade $10 more--includes VIP seating, program, banner to waive, behind the scenes DVD.

In terms of the drinks at the bar--thought I was going to pay and arm and a leg, but the prices were actually pretty decent and about the same as going to any other restaurant bar.  Lots of yummy concoctions in fanciful cups.  Kiddies had their non alcoholic slushies in the knight head cups--and they were happy.  Food was actually a lot better than I expected it to be--bonus!--not the best since its food for the masses--but could have been a whole lot worse.

The upgrade was totally worth it for us---we actually got upgraded to the front row----so my group was giddy, tipsy, and feeling good with a touch of brute excitement.  Luckily we were seated in the area of the winning knight so we had a blast cheering him on.  The show actually had a nice variety and it wasn't just a bunch of jousting dudes with long hair on pretty horses.

Staff was attentive and all were really nice.  My youngest was given a "token" (sash that said queen of the tournament) from the winning knight....so she was excited.  We did a lot of screaming, yelling, eating, and drinking!  It was a great knight!!! (wink wink)

Medieval Times is great and could be a lot of fun.  When my son was little, this was one of his favorite places.  We have gone so many times now...and it is always exactly the same show...maybe it is time they switch it up a bit?

The show was awesome not to mention the food (good portion size)was delicious. Please with the service couldn't ask for a better waiter. If your in Schaumburg take time to go Medieval Times, definitely worth the money!!

Love this little place in Bartlett, very very good food. 
Absolutely Awesome 
Anything you order you will enjoy
Good food! Only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because they didn't have guac and they didn't give us salsa in our to go bags :(

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. I've had a hell of a time finding good, consistent, mexican food around here and Emily's is definitely on my list of places I can count on for some amazing steak tacos. We go here often after football or a day at the pool. The service is very friendly and they are also fast. I also love the spicy green salsa! So far we haven't had anything that we don't care for so if you are looking for some authentic mexican food - check this place out.
Tried their steak burrito and tacos. Well made and fresh tasting. I will most likely come back since it is a local restaurant but they are a bit pricey in my opinion.
Best food ever.  Eaten mexican food all over and they have the highest quality ingredients which you can taste in every bite

A hidden gem. 
The steak burrito and horchata I had today were on the mark. I got my steak burrito "loaded" which included sour cream, cheese, rice, beans and avocado. This is key: they are generous with the avocado!  The fresh cilantro added a little something special. The steak was freshly grilled, juicy and plentiful. Three super salsas available: mild green, smokey spicy red salsa and a peppery HOT green. 
Granted the $8.50 price tag on the burrito is  bordering pricey, but the freshness and portion size make it worth it to me. 
Super clean dining area. Service was speedy and polite. 
I'll be back.
Great little taco/burrito place in Bartlett. Everything is fresh and made to order, but it is worth the few extra minutes.

Good, fast, cheap, and easy... Don't worry  I am talking about the restaurant.    I stopped here the other night as I just wasn't in the mood for my clean eating diet. 

We got steak, chicken and el pastor tacos.  The best part though?  The salsas. Most of the flavor on the food came from those. 

I was very satisfied.  They even forgot a part of our order and came running out to get us.  

I'll definitely be back.

A little expensive for fast food mexican but very good! Had the loaded steak burrito and it had great flavor and the hot sauce was very hot which it should be. So for two loaded burritos at just under 20$ is the most expensive around I think but might be the best tasting!

Emily's is a great Mexican food spot in Bartlett. There aren't that many options in Bartlett for authentic Mexican food and this place hits the spot. As someone who is Mexican and knows the food well I love going here when I'm in the mood for my tacos con salsa. Every time I've been here I've had a good experience. I recommend getting a torta or a loaded burrito, my favorite meat of choice is the carne asada. Lastly, their horchata is good, not amazing so I gave them a 4 out of 5 for the review. Horchata (rice water) is a must for Mexican food joints and I love having it with my meal. Make sure to try it, personally I prefer mine to be a tad bit sweeter. Overall, make sure to stop by Emily's and give them a try.

Best meat quality of any burrito place that I've been too.  Tried it once and have been going back consistently ever since .  Owner is friendly and always there.  Food made fresh- steak quality is unbelievable , and not greasy.  Stay away from the others. Once you come here for takeout you won't go elsewhere

I haven't penned a creative review in awhile so forgive my ditty if it taint' so pretty.
My background:
I grew up with a great family who were Mexican from Texas, so I have had many great meals growing up of having fresh food. I have also dined at the best places in Acapulco and can appreciate a freshly prepared meal.

My experience here:
I walked in at 3pm and it was empty. Just one other customer before me. I sat at the counter and watched tv. I ordered a stuffed steak burrito that had it rolled in with rice, avocado, fresh onion, and cilantro. I also ordered 3 chicken  tacos with beans and rice. 

Order total came to $18.50. I ordered the larger burrito at $8.50, there is a smaller one for $4.25.

I am pleased the burrito had fresh ingredients great fresh lively cilantro, REAL AVOCADO and fresh rice. A Good amount of  steak.

 Emily's is across the street from the Jewel by Stearns ( strip mall next door where UPS store is). It was worth the tiny extra drive from Downtown Bartlett.
 
Will go again for freshly prepped food.  Its casual where you can eat there if you grab one of the 4 booths or a place at the counter. Otherwise, don't cook tonight and enjoy take out.

PS: I enjoyed the real re fried beans and rice

Mexican Restaurant Comparison:

Before this restaurant came along; Bartlett , Streamwood, and Roselle and yes, even Schaumburg have had pretty much dog food for Mexican Restaurants over the past 14 years that I have been around trying places.
I had settled for Chipotle for awhile until I learned about their GMO reporting. Most places over- salt meats or use Adobo seasonings containing MSG which can give you wicked headaches and is a toxic additive anyway. Some places use rice from a can. This restaurant had fresh prep food so its a good alternative.

I've had four good tostadas here, which is more than enough for me to recommend it to anyone looking for some good Mexican food in Bartlett.

I've had tostadas with steak, chicken and al pastor. They're, more or less, open-faced tacos. Except instead of sandwich bread, you have a crispy corn tortilla as the base.

The veggies are good and all, but you're here for the meats. It doesn't matter what kind of meat you get, it's well seasoned. They also give you some free green salsa on the side (not habanero, surprisingly, just something a bit sour.)

Best of all, the tostadas are only $2 and change each, and two is enough to assuage even the most intense lunch craving. I even threw in some yellow rice on the side, which was nicely seasoned as well.

For less than $6 for lunch, it's hard to find a better place than Emily's.
This place was great.  The food was a bit salty for me but dam it was good.  Definitely coming back and trying more food.  The tacos and torta hit the spot.

I started ordering takeout soft pork flour tacos with green sauce when my 16 yr old daughter said they were really good, they cook everything fresh to order on an open flame grill so it has a slight char flavor that is just killer good. My wife and I order there all the time now and I can't get enough. Keep up the good work everyone at Emily's. Dan from Bartlett.

I'm not wasting any time. I learned that Emily's Mexican Grill was open for business and five hours later, I was here for dinner. 

The hubby and I wandered over to the shopping center across the street from Jewel and noticed a few people milling about inside. We walked in and quickly decided on our carryout order. 

So this restaurant has been open for about a month. It is family owned and operated (my favorite!). A couple of cousins and the mom/aunt are hustling to run this fresh operation. The grand opening complete with free tacos al pastor is scheduled for the first week of November. I don't know an exact date, but it's worth a visit to find out before then. 

Anyhow, there is seating for about 12 people although they are definitely doing mostly carryout. The whole look is bare bones right now, but it's clean, the kitchen is wide open and they are totally focused on the food. 

Let's talk about the food. Shall we?

We ordered a steak burrito without cilantro, chicken quesadillas (not on the menu for our son), a side of rice, a side of refried beans, a chicken taco, a steak taco and a ground beef taco (all tacos with onion and lettuce). Dinner for three for under $20!  Heck to the yeah!!  So the good and the not-so-good...the burrito arrived with cilantro. The hubby wasn't thrilled but still enjoyed the meal. Quality steak that was very filling.  The chicken quesadillas were perfect. Beautifully cooked chicken breast showed up in both the quesadilla and the taco. Order the steak or the chicken...or both!  The rice was nice. The beans arrived with melted cheese and that addition was a surprise. The tacos were delicious even though they arrived with cilantro and onions rather than lettuce and onions. The tortillas were pliable and clearly fresh. We watched the auntie/mom slice the fresh beef off a roast before she grilled it.  You can't get any better than that!  The ground beef taco was kinda boring, but the steak and the chicken made up for that. The wait time was a little lengthy and they knew it. They're still finding their groove, so they apologized, but we were totally okay with waiting for a fresh cooked dinner. Plus, the Bears game was being recorded on the DVR so we weren't missing anything!  

To recap, try the chicken or steak. Call ahead to cut down on your wait time. And support this local, non-chain business!  It's nice to have somewhere different to go that is five minutes from home. Let's keep it that way, Bartlett friends. :-)

Restaurant is freezing! Sign says .99 cent taco Tuesdays. So I order 4 tacos and 2 drinks and its $13. When I question it they say its .99 cent taquitos. Not what your sign says! Change order. After waiting 15 minutes for my take out and watching the staff move like turtles as the customers freeze waiting, I question where order is, only to now be told there are several phone in orders ahead of me!!! Should of said this to me before you took my order! Got $ back, left hungry and with bad taste. They need some management and efficiency training.
Best Mexican in Bartlett by far. Love my all American steak burrito, and the kiddos love the quesadillas.

5 flavorless, gristle tacos, $14, 45+ minute wait. Seriously. There was literally no flavor whatsoever in any bite of rubbery, gristle filled meat [al pastor and carne asada] the tortillas were stale. Wasn't given any salsa to make choking them down easier, out of chips. How they've lasted over a year is beyond me.

This is a decent Mexican restaurant.  The biggest thing it has going for it is everything is made fresh, so it tastes fresh.  Because of that, you're paying a bit more and getting a bit less....not the "burrito as big as your head" you'd get at a late night place.  You're also getting something that tastes a lot better though.  I'd say the prices are about in line with say, Chipotle, if it helps.  They just updated their menu and added some new things as well so if you like Mexican food you'll definitely find something you like. I really like their steak offerings.
Don't be fooled though....this is not "authentic" Mexican food.  It is however, authentic American Mexican food, which is what most people really mean when they say that.  And its good.  I'd say its probably my third favorite Mexican place and if you're in the area you should give it a try.

Hungry for a mouthwatering steak quesadilla or taco?? Then this is the SPOT! I always get a side of guacamole, too. This place is awesome! The sign says "Tacos" because it's a no-nonsense taco joint. My family loves this place! Don't ever change! We love love LOVE your food and service!

Very good for something that is close by. The tacos were create and made to order, which is always a good thing. The guacamole was pretty bad though. A little bit pricy to justify going there more often.
Unassuming & no grizzle.  Best in Bartlett!

My dad loves this place and is a regular but to me it tastes different from the Mexican food I know. The tacos are good but too greasy for my taste. Rice is slightly hard but the meats are grilled in front of you so they have a nice grilled taste to them. The steak burrito I had was great. The steak was how steak should be and had no fat or veins to the majority of it. Would definitely come back but I wish they had complimentary chips and salsa.
Friendly service and fresh, fast mexican food. Loved the tacos. Great price!

Fantastic, authentic Mexican food with a great price to match. Small, family owned place with some of best service I've had in awhile. Fresh made right in front of you. I had the loaded burrito and let me tell you, it WAS loaded!  We'll be coming again, that's for sure.
Loved it! Got two steak tacos and can't complain. If you love authentic mexican good you have to check out this place.

Where to begin.... Called in a phone order for a steak taco dinner with cilantro, onion lettuce and cheese., chips and salsa, quac and chips and two chicken quesadillas. Was told the cheese was .25 extra, no prob. Told to come in 15 minutes.  I show up 15 minutes later and see the food sitting on the table all bagged up.  The male employee is just starting to fill some sauces in cups and looking around kind  of like a lost puppy opening cabinets, fridges etc.  A dine in customer get there food served to them by the young male. (as I stand and wait).  I repeated the order just to make sure he had it all. he agreed it was all in the bag.  WRONG  Get home, open food.  Guess what, tacos have no cheese or lettuce.  I called the store just to mention they forgot the cheese etc, he immediately tells me they did put cheese, then he says they didn't and to check my receipt he doesn't THINK he charged me.  Ok whatever obviously this kid will be working a register forever with his personality.  I hang up, take a bite of the taco...STEAK IS COLD.  Call back and asked why it is cold.  He tells me it cant be cold.  They made it today and the steak is always hot.  So not fresh.  I open the guac, out of the 4oz cup they give you about 2oz for $4.  The chips were store bought milagro brand as I watched them fill the bags. 

The guy on the phone tells me to microwave it and if I don't like it call the manager.  Ok is the manager there, no.  When will he be in?  I don't know, whats the managers name? Jesus.  
I asked him if they always have this type of attitude. he said I don't know.  Well they obviously don't know much.   

What I got today was horrible. Hopefully my $20 will help them pay the attorney fees, to break the lease within the next few months at 968 S Bartlett Rd since there is no way they are going to make it.  So anyone looking to buy some new restaurant equipment, maybe you should leave your number with "The Manager" because I don't see them needing it much longer.  

For Mexican restaurants being a dime a dozen, you would think you would provide better food and service.  Skip this place and head down to El Faro.
This was a treat for a quick burrito to go. Service was quick and courteous, steak was grilled as I waited for order, all very fresh. Very clean restaraunt, and the food was very good.

I just finished my first chicken burrito from Emily's and it won't be my last. It was delicious - it was the $7 version without cheese and without sour cream and it needed nothing more added, not even the sauces placed in my bag. It was very fresh and tasted like very high quality ingredients. 
I'm rating Emily's 5 stars for what it is to me - an excellent take out place in Bartlett for Mexican food. There are a couple of sit down tables but I am not comparing Emily's to the Mexican sit down restaurants in Bartlett.
It fills for me a Mexican lunch niche perfectly. I'd been going to another place in Bartlett on 59 for take out for years but I recently got a very sharp 1-inch chicken bone in a burrito. I reported it but about a month or so later I got another. So, I tried Emily's and was blown away by the value - again, much more taste and freshness than what I had experienced elsewhere.
Finally, Mexican food in the far west burbs that I look forward to eating. Good Price too.

So good!!! Saw this opened a few months ago. We usually go to a place in Streamwood on Barrington rd but decided to try this since it's only 5 minutes from home. Placed our order for 2 steak tacos. Took 10-15 minutes, but it was worth it!! Fresh ingredients and by far the best steak I've received at a place like this. Delicious and not crazy fatty/grisly like some places. Hot sauces were great and the ingredients in the burrito were all at a good ratio. Can't wait to go again! Told a few people already about it.
We had an excellent dinner tonight with 2 stuffed burritos.  Everyone working in the restaurant were working very hard and were very friendly.  Great food, prepared with care!
This place is a great find, the squirt steak and tacos are amazing. prices are right on the money. thanks for fast service and fresh food.
Fresh steak tacos grilled while you wait. The spicy salsa is worth a try, too. I'm glad there's a good taco place in my neighborhood! Hola, Emily!

ordered 4 steak tacos...onion, cilantro, cheese...you would think simple enough not to screw it up...charged for the cheese, not sure where they put it since it wasn't on the tacos...steak tough and chewy...tried them when they first opened...not good then...not good now

Just did take out lunch there. I was a bit surprised my burrito was $8:50! Thought right away that this was my last time here. Once back in my office, I was delightfully surprised at how good and fresh it was.  I'll be back, but not too often for that price. Will try the tacos next, which also seem a tad pricey at 2 bucks a pop.  They need some take out menus and next time some napkins in my bag!

Wish I could give 3.5 stars
Pretty good! The tacos tend to be dry. The hot sauce is hot though! I recommend it.

Just saw that this has replaced Sandwichville, so we thought we'd try it out.  Great food at a good price, tried the chicken taco which had great flavor.  The Quesadilla was good, the Steak Burrito was good as well maybe a bit too much beans but still good.  We will definitely be trying it again!  Glad we have a nice local place to grab good tacos.  The menu is very basic and straightforward, but that's a good thing.  Stick to what you do best and we'll keep coming back for the great food!
Sandy, Susie, and Mindy were at The Outpost for lunch and it was delicious!  The Taco Special was great and the Burgers were out of this world.  We enjoyed the cold beer too.  Hope to see you soon!

I guess it's a huge destination for the volleyball groups. Rode in this eve to check in for the first time. There was a smattering of people outside at the picnic tables and a few indoors. Memorial Day today so not much of a crowd. We tried the $10 / Monday pizza special and it was A-OK. Nothing special but pretty good. Thin pizza with a crispoy crust, the only kind I really like. Good service here too. Inside is a bit divey but nearly exactly as expected. 

It's sort of in the middle of nowhere and I think the only place in Pingree Grove. Glad we stopped.

Having grown up in the Greater Pingree Grove Statistical Metropolitan area, the Outpost has always been a big part of my life. 

The Outpost has slowly transformed from a hillbilly dive bar to a hybrid hillbilly/trendy dive bar.  The Cambridge Lakes and Highland Woods developments brought in a lot of city folk who love to drink beer at the Outpost.  They've kinda taken over as the primary clientele of the bar, essentially pushing the area hill rods out.  You'll see a guy in a flannel and work boots from time to time, but he's like Waldo immersed in a crowd of women with coach purses and guys wearing deck shoes and polo shirts with popped collars talking about how much they love "country" life. (Holy run on... Sorry!)

Haven't had much experience with the food, but I will say the barkeep pours a mean Jack and Coke. It's so strong it burns your nose hairs clear off.  

It's always super sketchy pulling out of that place - I'm always worried that I will become the hood ornament of a 1991 Mack gravel truck.  

A Pingree Grove Staple, and if it's lasted this long, it gets four stars and two thumbs up from me

Giving this place 1 stars only because the first time i was there is was just ok. Second time.  Awful.  We sat outside and waited. Hubby had to go in and order drinks,  which is ok but you should check your outside seating more. Then waitress came with drinks and never came back for food order. So hubby went back in to order 2 burritos. 20 minutes later we were served lettuce burritos. There was barely 2 tbs of meat and ALL lettuce. When waitress asked how they were and i said "all lettuce" she told me they portion them. Yeah..with all lettuce was my reply.  She then tried to sell me their tacos. No thanx. Terrible food and service.
Stopped in for a quick bite. The bartenders were attentive and the food was delicious. Got the outpost melt in your mouth burger, which hit the spot.
Went there late night, and our little group more than doubled the population of the place.  Drinks were good, not expensive, but if you like premium beer this probably isn't the place for you.
Great Mexican food at a great price. Coors Light is always cold and the staff is always amazing. Keep up the great work

Been in twice on Saturday evenings for 1/2 price pizza. The pizza is really good, and the service has been great! Very friendly staff, the place is clean, and I have some friends that play volleyball here over the summer (they have a really nice outdoor volleyball sand court). Definitely will continue eating their food, and drinking their beer, haha.

Loved playing volleyball on the HUGE volleyball court! They also had baggos (sp?). They also had a giant porch that looked amazing. The inside of the bar looked ok but the updated jukebox made up for it. We will definately be booking for my boyfriends 21st. Loved that it was kind of in the middle of nowhere and you could just kind of get away. It was close to home yet felt like we were far away. Love.

went here for my lunch break, I ordered a mushroom swiss burger with fries. it was ready reasonably quick and it was damn good so was the fries and a rather generous portion. also the customer service was friendly

I just want to recognize the exemplary service provided to us at Francesca's Famiglia in Barrington on Saturday, May 28 during dinner.  

I had surgery on the Wednesday prior and have been learning how to move around on crutches for the past 3 days.  My mother and I were looking forward to a delicious dinner, but the village was hosting an art show and had closed the roads leading to the restaurant.  As such I had to slowly hobble down 2 blocks from where we parked.  It's amazing what you take for granted as normally this distance would have been a trifle, but crutches really slow you down.

After our wonderful dinner we were trying to strategize the easiest way for my mother to get the car and pick me up as she is visiting from out of town and is not familiar with the area.  The General Manager, Stash, saw us trying to find an easy way to the car and offered to show us a shortcut.  Not only did he lead us to a back way out, but he showed me a place to sit while he walked my mother to my car and then drove with her to where I was waiting.  Stash lastly helped me place my crutches in the car and would not accept the tip my mother was trying to give him.

I cannot thank Stash enough for everything he did for my mother and me.  He truly exceeded my already high expectations.

Joined a party of four for dinner here. I only had a salad but tried two of the others dishes. Three people at the table ordered the Salmon. Which was very good. The other dish that I tried was the Lagnsa. This was very good and I could have probably ate that entire dish. However I decided to only order a casear salad, which you can pretty much order anywhere and it should taste the same. This wasn't the case, but it was awful. Average at best. With this said, I would come to eat here again with the expectation that I would order a delicious italian dish...

We'll see!
If I could give more than five stars, I would!  We literally closed the place down with our friends.  Moises and Dario who work the bar are both absolutely AMAZING!Incredibly accommodating!!

Have been here for lunch and dinner.... Great food and fabulous staff. 

Just recently had my wedding reception here and utilized the patio for appetizers as well as both private dining rooms for dinner. I had about 90 people for a family style meal and drinks. Everything was perfect! The food was outstanding and the cost was better than anything I could do at a banquet hall. So happy with this choice! Loved it! THANK YOU FOR A GREAT NIGHT!

Can't say enough great things about this restaurant.

I just had back surgery and asked for the comfiest seat in the house.  We were directed to a wonderful booth.  Manager checked several times to insure my comfort.

The service was exemplary.  Food amazing!!
I ordered their signature chicken dish which is a much better version of chicken vesuvio.  Delicious!

I love the Italian food scene in Barrington; this place is one of the reasons why. I've been a regular over the years, and I can say with the utmost confidence that the food here is always fresh and filling - never a time to be disappointed. 

Two dishes I'd like to highlight on my most recent trip here, the calamari fritti and quattro stagioni pizza. The calamari batter is so light and the portion is HUGE - definitely not complaining ;). The pizza on the other hand has everything you can ask for - prosciutto, artichoke, mushroom, olive, egg. There's an over easy egg right in the middle of the pizza and the waiter will come sprinkle that yolk just. right. over. everywhere. Love It.

You can definitely get a sense of family when you come here (I searched up for famiglia meant in Italian and indeed it means family). Whether it be the first warm plate of bread that they bring out with the killer olive oil to the friendly waitstaff, you just can't get enough off that in this busy world. Hope this place will always keep up the good work.

Nice atmosphere, could be a romantic restaurant if it wasn't so damn loud. I've been there three times it's always oddly loud. The food is fair,  small portions and a little on the pricey side. I don't think we will be going back.

My absolute favorite restaurant in Barrington.  My first experience here was not that great but every time I have been here after has been amazing.  

I usually come here every Friday & it is always packed.  I would recommend reservations especially on a weekend night.  One of the main reasons my first experience here was not excellent is I didn't really see anything on the menu I was familiar with or cared a lot for.  My second visit here I asked for something that wasn't on the menu with was gnocchi with vodka sauce.  I can say with out hesitation that this place served me the absolute best gnocchi with vodka sauce that I have ever tasted.  

Another one of my favorites here is the clams.  They serve two different kinds of clams.  One of them is served in a red marinara sauce & the second is served in a white creamier sauce.  

They do have a full bar here & serve champagne by the bottle.  Their champagne prices by the bottle are reasonable.  We usually order a bottle of Vueve Clicquot for $90.  This is definitely cheaper than some champgane prices in the city.  

Lastly the service here has always been phenomenal.  Between the service the food & the atmosphere I really enjoy eating here & will continue to come here on a regular basis.  I also like the outside seating that they have available in the summer.  It makes coming here for lunch even better.

My husband and I stopped here because we stumbled upon this place while having coffee. Coming here, we didn't just have dinner, we had an experience. They have a great atmosphere! Furthermore, since the restaurant is in sort of an alley way, it gave me the feeling of eating overseas...it was intimate, inviting, and the service was amazing. So happy that we found this place. Great food! Great service! We will definitely be back!
We just got my daughters wedding dress and decided to stop here to celebrate. What a wonderful dinner and celebration. Love this place and the setting. We will be back.

I was very impressed with food at Francesca's! I loved the spinach ravioli with the four cheese sauce. It was also a really nice atmosphere for a quiet evening for dinner with a friend. My friend wanted sangria, and there wasn't any on the drink menu. They were able to accommodate her, and the sangria was actually very good! I can't wait to go back!

Watch your receipts. I left a $14 dollar tip and the waiter, Gino, entered a $50 dollar tip when my credit card was charged.  Typically I would think this might be an accidental error but our waiter had said and acted in ways throughout the night that gave me an untrusting feeling.

When I called the restaurant to ask about why I was overcharged on my credit card, they looked into it and found the "error".  They asked I come all the way back to the restaurant to pick up the $36 dollar difference in cash because to put the amount back on my card would be "too much paperwork".  It was a huge inconvenience and... I'm still baffled about this, but I did not get a SINGLE apology from the restaurant.  

I've been in the service industry and I understand accidents happen but this was a huge error to make that would not be tolerated in most places.  To top that off, their response was terrible.


The food was good but because of the poor customer service and sketchy activity at this location I will never go back again.

One word to describe this Francesca's location. TOILET! It's sad to say because I visited pretty much every Francesca's in the Northwest suburbs and they have all been quite good. My first visit was mediocre at best so I didn't leave a review, I thought I would give it another chance and I'm sorry I did. The wait staff was horrible and the food was even worse. When you walk in the arrogance of the hostess and manager truly feels like they are doing you a favor visiting their restaurant. Kind of weird. Sorry guys this place is not that special...The pasta tasted like frozen store bought and the sauce was tasteless and not seasoned. As for the fish... OMG! Freezer burned, over cooked what ever they want to call it was not good. This place better make some management changes or it will be definitely be closing soon. The recent reviews reflect this place is in a downward spiral.

We went there for dinner tonight and I'm glad we had a coupon. The waitress was just a bit off. She didn't seem to actually care how we were doing or want to check in. She asked if we wanted soup or salad and we both ordered one. We had no idea that the salad was going to be $7! If you want to ask if we want to add a soup or salad fine, but I felt like the practice was a bit predatory. That said, the minestrone was some of the best we've ever had. The salad was pretty good and a decent portion. I just wish they had been more upfront and honest about it. 

Actually, this was one of the best Italian meals I've had in a while. I find most Italian places are just pasta and sauce that I could make myself. Not here. The rigatoni was exceptional. The veggies were all well done and the sauce was well above average. My friend got the salmon and said it was fine. They asked how he wanted the fish done (i.e. medium, well done, etc). Is that even a thing? It was a bit odd but it was good. Overall, I give them 5 stars for the food but 1-2 stars for service.

So we have frequented this location many times and have had amazing experiences here.  Unfortunately, our experience dining Saturday evening will keep us away for the foreseeable future.  While they were predictably busy at 5:30 on a Saturday night, they were not handling the traffic gracefully.  Once seated, drinks were so hard to come by that we were making trips to the bar just to get our own refills.  The food was great as always, but the lack of service  turned a laid back group of 4 into enraged diners facing a $300 check no one felt justified to pay.
Good place in a cool setting. Wish the menu would turn over more, but have to say, have never left this place disappointed. Staff is always friendly and has a good vibe....

My fianc and I went to Francesca's last night for dinner to try it out as we are planning on having our rehearsal dinner here in a couple months. We were so impressed by the quality of the food and by how wonderful the service was. Our waiter, Antonucci, was spot-on with all of his recommendations! Truly one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. Highly recommend the espresso bread pudding- an amazing dessert!!!!
GREAT place for lunch. Best linguini with shrimp I can remember. I will most definitely come back. A place where you can talk and have a great meal at the same time.

I went with 2 others this past week and was very disappointed in the quality of the pasta dishes. We all chose a different one. In each case the pasta was very undercooked, the cream sauces were very heavy, the tomato based sauce was ok.
The fact that there was no waiting might have been clue, but we were hungry and had tried this place because we wanted to avoid a 45 min wait. We will not be returning soon.

Food was wonderful. Service great. Pretty good wine list.  The menu is limited. However, this means they focus more on their offerings. The only reason for the four stars is that we ordered one of the most expensive wines and when we asked to have the wine decanted, the waiter took the bottle away from the table and then brought it back with the decanter. Small thing, but open the wine at the table and leave it there. 

The one thing I loved the most here us the fact that they treated us like we were regular customers. They made us feel like we mattered and that our experience was important. This is something you rarely find in restaurants these days.

Been to the downtown restaurant and was not impressed at all. This one however is much much better. Service was impeccable, friendly, genuine, attentive and made us feel right at home. Server name was Dario and you could tell he was a bit nervous (maybe new) but did not skip a beat. Food was great, especially the carpaccio....yummmm. Best place i have been to in the suburbs so far!!
Live I. Barrington and eaten here maybe 10 times. Consistently excellent. Keep it up !!

Surprisingly good! Was a breath of fresh air here. Restaurant was half full this Sunday evening and most parties had at least one child. Lots of families around here. I didn't experience any difficulty with the speed and the server was very helpful (charming even, may I say), but I can imagine how hungry folks would see different.

However there's also the subtle things -- the freshness of the bread, the playfulness of the presentation, the preemptory plate of fine Parmesan, the crispness of the salmon outside with an absolutely fresh inside.

There were three of us for a late lunch on a snowy Friday afternoon. Our server was very nice and thorough, but our lunches took a very long time. Shortly after we placed our order, a group of kids (around 9 or 10 years old who should have been in school, I thought) came in. They were loud (but not as loud as one might have expected) and held up the kitchen a while, I suspect. When we left, the host apologized to us about the noise and explained that the group was the final "exam" of an etiquette class. 

The food was good--I had a veggie panino with goat cheese and it was lovely. My friend ordered the three course prix fixe and said it was the best meal she'd had in a long time (they had a special menu in honor of their anniversary). Something on her plate involved meat balls. I did not try it. I loved the crme brle, which made it all worthwhile for me. 

I've been to Francesca's Fortunado in Frankfort and that experience didn't make me super excited to try Francesca's Famiglia, but I was glad I did. Except for the long wait on our food (and the unexpected group of children nearby), it was a tasty experience with good service.

I have been to Barrington location twice and Arlington Heights twice... Pretty much the same 

Went to Barrington in Mother's Day and in summary.  The kitchen was insanely slow and got my order wrong twice 

I think we are done here... Good luck with your meals

Yuck.  I'd been dying to try Francesca's for a while because of their gluten free menu, but picking up food from here was a total disappointment!  I got the gluten free Penne Aalio e Olio.  The description on the menu said it had fresh garlic, diced tomatoes, and spinach.  Sounds good, right?  The gluten free pasta actually had an okay taste, but it was terribly overcooked so the penne was just shreds of pasta.  I know gluten free pasta is delicate, but that's really not acceptable for pasta from a restaurant.  Also, there were hardly any tomatoes, and the spinach was really really soggy.  The garlic was in a giant clump at the bottom of the dish, so when I discovered it and tried to spread it out, the flavor was overwhelming.  I felt like a fire-breathing dragon.

Maybe I'd come back and give them another chance, but at $14 a dish (with tax), I think there are a bunch of better options out there.  I should have listened to the other reviews!

I have always enjoyed this restaurant. Not tonight.
They had a wonderful Ravioli special I had REALLY been looking forward to. Sold out at 6:30. Really? The chef couldn't plan better?
I ordered my second choice and it was so bland, I couldn't believe it. I left hungry and ticked off. Should have stayed home and made Bertolli.

While it's not bad - it's not all that great - Barrington so sadly so has so few food options. 

It's straight on Franchesca's branded food that I would describe as somewhat overpriced and inconsistent dish over dish over time - I eat here often and come up with the same refrain - who is in the kitchen ? 

While it's Italian - it's incredibly Hispanic on all fronts.  

I wish they would become a gourmet Hispanic restaurant - we have nothing like that here.

Identity issues but that being said they appear to do well - but again the food - restaurant choices are so slim that almost average could be considered great. 

Open up up new restaurants in Barringtin!

Please !

I was confused at first why this Francesca's had lower ratings than other the others.  I have been to several locations and this was by far the worse.  The service was horrible.

I came here with my boyfriend on a double date with my parents.  It was a Saturday night so I called and asked how long the wait was, the girl on the phone said 15 minutes.  I then asked if they do call ahead seating so I could put my name on the waiting list and head over.  She said yes and took my information.

When I arrived they claimed they do not do call ahead seating or reservations and the wait was now 25 minutes.  I was frustrated and they told me that they would get me seated as soon as possible.  Well our 15 minutes quickly turned into over an hour with someone telling us you will be next a couple times.

The service sucked.  Our waiter kept forgetting about us.  The table next too us was a bunch of obnoxiously drunk and loud 40 year olds.

It took about 40 minutes and we asked about the food.  once we asked it was brought out immediately... my pasta was burnt like it had sat under the fryer.

I would give them one star, but the manager tried to appease us by giving us a free dessert platter.  But, needless to say, I will not be returning anytime soon.

They get a star for trying to put out the steam that was coming from my ears.  We called and asked how long the wait was for a party of 4 on Saturday, they said oh, about 15 minutes.  Seriously,  we even called a second time and again "about 15 minutes" so we put our name in and said we would be there in a few minutes because we were in the area..  So when we got there and the place was packed we walked up to the hostess and gave our name and she said we can't find it, so the other girl came and looked in the book and in the computer and couldn't find our name.  The manager came up and said oh we don't take names until people are actually here.  We told him about our conversation we JUST had with his staff and he said he would oblige our request and it would be a few minutes.  

We waited and waited and after a bit I went and asked the hostess how long it would be and she said "well we said 15 minutes and it has been only 12 minutes.  !!!!!!!!!!!!
Needless to say we waited and one of the managers or assistant manager not sure who, kept coming buy and saying "only a few more minutes, we're clearing a table now"  "only a few more minutes, tables are leaving now"  " we will be seating you shortly", etc. etc.  I kid you not, I would have rather cut our losses and been told the truth and made it another time.  

Finally seated 50 minutes later!   Well, the other couple at this point was so hungry they could have cared less what we ordered.  So we started with calamari, it was served nicely and fresh and pretty timely.  We finished our appetizer and were waiting with empty glasses (both water and wine) for our waiter to take out order.  We flagged him down twice.  We were given the "one minute sign".  Finally, we ordered!!  Nothing exceptionally difficult.  A chicken dish, ravioli, a salad and some lamb chips.  IT TOOK OVER  40 MINUTES.  When the waiter came to the table and I asked if there was a problem he said "the manager knows that you have been waiting"  "it's not my fault". Seriously??  When the food arrived you could tell it had been under the heat lamps for a long time because the ravioli was dry around the edges.

The manager arrived and said he was sorry and would love to buy us a Limoncello after dinner, we graciously accepted, acknowledging his attempt to make things right.  When our waiter returned to clear the table, we asked for the check, not knowing when or if he would return again.  Another manager came to the table and apologized and asked if we would please accept dessert for our troubles.  My appetite was pretty well shot by this time, but again we accepted.  10 minutes later, dessert, we were asked if we wanted coffee.  We ordered cappuccino and regular coffee.  While we waited, the Lemoncello arrived, from the other manager.  One hand didn't know what the other was doing.  But they tried.

Well the end to a perfectly horrible experience, the coffee was cold!!  I was here once before and gave it a good rating based on the food and service back in 2011-what changed?  Looking at some of the other reviews, it seems like a lot.

Thanks for trying, but too many wrongs did not make it right.  I won't be back.

Food is consistently bad.  We live down the street and I wish it was better.  I would like to give them our business.  Simple things like appropriately salting and seasoning the food is challenging for them.  I refuse to go back.

Always great service and great food! Went there last night for dinner. They were packed but still very attentive and we enjoyed our entire family dinner! They have done a few things to lower the noise level and we appreciate that too. There are always super nice healthy options; we do love that since most of the time we want to eat gourmet healthy.

I went to lunch on a Wednesday afternoon to celebrate my sister's birthday.  Also in attendance were my mom, aunt, and son.  All of our orders were fresh and delicious.  Great environment as we  were seated by a wall of windows.  The best part, though, was the service.  Our waitress, Alexandra, was so efficient, friendly and funny!  Our busboy, Chase, was also so friendly and attentive.  They made for such an enjoyable celebration.  We will definitely be back.

It's a little far for dinner but we love this family restaurant as there aren't many great restaurants in the burbs, service is good & I like the manager's personal hello, he always remembers our family no matter how long it's been since our last visit.
Awesome bread, great service, delicious entrees!  Even my picky kids loved their meals.  Will come back soon!

What a Valentines Day disaster. I had a 6:45 reservation. Showed up at 6:30, the lady said they were not checking in the 6:45 crowd, so I should come back in 15 minutes to check in. Fine, squeezed between 30 people in the waiting area, stood at the crowded bar. Ordered a Sauvignon Blanc, got a Chardonnay. Politely told the bartender, he rudely got me another glass.  At 6:45 I go back to check in, the lasy says 15 minute wait for my table. At 7:05 I ask again, told to keep waiting. At 7:15 I hear them seating the 7pm people, so I politely remind them I have a 6:45 reservation. The lady has the nerve to tell me I am going to have to leave the bar, get in a line by the door, and wait behind 6 other couples with 7pm reservations. They had no clue what they were doing at this place, what a joke.  Finally sit after complaining, get a table with bread and cheese, no oil. That takes a while. Order a glass of wine and meals at same time, wine never shows up. Salads arrive, and then we wait....and wait...and wait...people seated after us get their appetizers, salads, entrees, drinks and checks before we finally mention I have no wine, and where are our entrees!  No apology, just a shrug and "everyone is waiting."  Well, the food was mediocre, the service was aweful, and the experience was lousy. Never, ever again. What a sorry pitiful excuse for a restaurant. Amateurs. Go somewhere else and get better service, food and atmosphere for less money.

Very disappointed.  With all of the great restaurants to pick from in this price range why did I go to Francescas last night? Because the food and service WAS ALWAYS top notch. Last night our server was so distracted and unorganized she forgot to bring wine, messed up our orders, (that we waited forever to get--and were COLD), and while we waited for our entrees she came BACK to the table and asked, 'are you ready to order yet?"---as if she'd never been there. Her station wasn't even busy-she had our table and 2 others (all with 4 guests). Starters and salads were tasty-as always, but SUPER skimpy..are they suddenly cost cutting? We were celebrating and made the restaurant aware of it when we booked the reservation and when we arrived with a cake. Sure, the waitress perked up and acknowledged it AT tip time, just before she brought our cake. Never again. I spoke to the manager and gave him the feedback-he fiend a weak apology and invited us back to try again. Why? To be ignored? served cold food that was supposed to be hot? Goodbye Francescas!

We have been coming here since they opened. The food is always great but it is time for a menu change.  An Italian Restauarant without veal? Back room is noisy but overall A good value - just don't go expecting anything new

Always a great place to eat... Menu always has something a little different and tasty.  Can't go wrong with really any of the options. The staff is always friendly and very welcoming. One of my favorite spots to eat any day of the week!

My wife and I ate here last Monday. Really liked the food. I had the Whitefish and wife had the Rigatoni Con Broccoli. Both dishes were very good. Our waiter was so good I asked if he was the owner. He wasn't. Just a very professional server.

I can't say that the night was a bust but it wasn't what I expected when I think fine dining in Barrington. The food was good but not great and the services was nice but slow. I would go back though to give it a second chance.

We were a party of two and were seated in a room with a group of 18 and a group of 12. The group of 12 which was behind was louder than the group of 18 to our right! Another family was seated in the same area of the restaurant and after 5 minutes, they got up and carried their plates out to another section (we should of done the same) Restaurant was busy, but host should of recognized any small party would of been better seated in another area. And because of the large groups, we waited on for everything...we had to ask several times for bread and water. When dinner arrived food was hot and flavorful, but the loudness of the table behind us was VERY hard to ignore. Normally we linger with desert, coffee and after dinner drink....not on Saturday night! In hindsight if the host does not pay attention to the area where you are being seated, you should speak up.

Loud, very loud.

Crowded - can hardly walk between tables - they must be over the fire code limit - no way you can pack that many people in there.

Was there on a Sat night for a bday dinner with a group of 10 and there were several other groups - I felt sorry for any couple trying to have a nice dinner/conversation.

Just way to jam packed to enjoy yourself.

Food was ok, nothing to write home about.  Portions are grossly huge.

Bread was hard as a rock but 1,000 degrees inside

Service was fair at best. Menu tries to be too trendy. No decent choices for kids either.  Hard to read the sloppy hand written menu too.

Could be really good with a few minor improvements, but I won't be back.

No way a 4 star place!

I think this is the best Italian restaurant in the area.  The asparagus and cucumber salads are very fresh and light, and the pasta dishes are consistently good.  Come to think of it, I've never had a disappointing dish here ever!  I love the decor, with photographs of Italy on the wall.  It's a great restaurant for a night out with friends or older family or for a date night!  I wouldn't encourage bringing children here because it is more of a romantic/classy restaurant.
Drinks are always good.  Great wine selection, too.  Although my other half isn't a huge fan, I love this place.  Pasta dishes are always flavorful & service is very good, too.

I have a general dislike of Italian food but this place completely brought me to the other side. The only Italian places I remember are all the Olive Gardens and some hole in the wall place in Wheeling (on Hintz Road, disgusting).

Right from the get-go, this place was awesome. The servers were all extremely friendly. We ordered a two glasses of reisling, salad and a shrimp bisque for starters. The salad was nice but the bisque was out of this world!! Of course, we were given the usual bread and butter and olive oil before this. It was fresh and warm. :)

Then for main course we had some chicken tortellini dish and i think a "pollo alla salvio" or something. Both of these dishes were unbelievably tasty. It just left you with a very satisfied feeling. I kept wanting to stuff my face but resisted and got it packed for lunch the next day. Also, I had to save some space in the tummy for dessert. 

To bring the meal to a close, we ordered a creme brulee and a coconut cake with caramel sauce and creme anglais. I cannot even begin to describe how delicious the cake was. It was quite a big piece too and was garnished with a few mint leaves. I always eat these if provided - nature's mouth freshener. The creme brulee was just as good as any.

I definitely would go back here. It was worth every penny and I really want to try all the different entrees. So glad to have discovered another gem in the suburbs.

Great service as well as great food.  The waiter new the menu and selected my meal for me a seafood pasta in a red sauce.  I have not selected a meal and left it int the hands of the restaurants and staff I am eating In and they did not fail to please.

They were also able to offer menu options with flexibility which was great since my mother is allergic to pepper, seafood, peppers, nuts, and a few more.  The waiter was able to put a dish together that met the needs of my mother and was delicious.

On top of all this we were able to dine in peace and comfort with three small children as well.

If you are willing to ask they will serve.

My husband and I have been here a couple of times and the food, service, and atmosphere have always been wonderful. 

But this past Friday night we decided to get take out...I ordered a dish off of their gluten free menu, I believe it was the al pomodoro (sp?). It was supposed to have a 'spicy tomato basil sauce'. Upon tasting it, I realized something was very, very wrong with this dish. 1) It had no spice whatsoever. Ok, no big deal, I can add spice. But as I took another bite it became clear that the chef had dumped about a pound of salt in the sauce. Now I love salt. I usually add salt to my dishes (bad, I know) but this dish was inedible. I was upset because the GF pasta itself was wonderful. It had great texture and was cooked perfectly. I wish I could've eaten it but there was no way anyone could eat this. 

I called the next day to speak to the manager. He was not in and I was told I would get a call back at 3 pm that same day. I never did.

I called back that Monday.  I was cranky upon calling because no one had called me back when they said they would. "Stash" answered, the general manager. He listened to my explanation and he was extremely kind and understanding. He thanked me for bringing it to his attention and told me to stop in and he'll cook me a new one. I went in that evening after work to pick up the new dish. Stash offered me a glass of wine while I waited. He was really so, so sweet and generous. As I waited, I noticed every one of his customers that walked thru the door gave him a huge smile and handshake (and a hug!)  He brought me out the new dish, this time a different one, a veggie GF pasta with a garlic herb broth. It was fabulous!! 

Stash certainly made me want to come back despite the poor dish I was given. He makes his customers feel right at home.
Always consistent.  Staff is always very helpful and will cater to your dining needs.

We have dined at Francesca's several times.   Always on the weekend, usually Sunday and various dinner times-early to later in the evenings. We continue to dine at Francesca's but with disappointment.  We dined recently on the Sunday after Christmas.  We thought it would be relaxing but not so.  The food and the service do not disappoint.  The noise level and children running in the restaurant are a problem. The child next to us bumped into our table and I quickly grabbed my wine so it would not tip over. The children at another table ran around our table bumping into the chair.  One child threw pieces of bread on the floor. The parents did not pick up but left for the servers to do. The children are not yet civilized to be taken to a tablecloth restaurant. I do not know what management can do about the unruly behavior. It is too bad because we enjoy the food. We do not think we can dine at Francesca's in Barrington again

I started dining at Francesca's after Sam's Club had special deals on their gift cards, kinda like Groupon where you can purchase a $50 gift card for $30.  This Francesca's is in Barrington, Illinois and is situated in downtown Barrington so it is a busy establishment.    The food is a little overpriced, however, the discounted gift cards keeps it within the market price.  The Calamari Fritti and Mussels Pomodoro have great flavor.  I found that their Chicken entrees tend to be overcooked.  The pizzas and salads are ok but nothing special.  The pasta dishes are tasty and rich but plan to run 6 miles the next day to kill those calories!  Overall, good place to go if you want to dine with the elite people in Barrington.

I've been  here for dinner several times. Most recently twice within three nights, once with my  husband and the second time with a friend. Both times were great! Cute little Italian restaurant in downtown Barrington. The minestrone soup is very tasty, their bread is awesome and I've never had a bad entree. Last night Montana waited on us and she provided excellent service. We were there for over two hours and never felt rushed. Smaller menu but seems to change often. Outdoor patio seating :)
Our favorite Friday night stops.  We enjoy sitting at a high top table near the bar and having some fantastic Italian food.
This place was amazeballs. The food was fantastic, the atmosphere was very family-friendly, and our waiter was a gem.

I dropped in for lunch while exploring the area and saw something I liked on the extensive menu outside. I go in to order and the waiter tells me they change their menu every few weeks. 

Interesting :) 

However, it is not the correct week for my dish. He says he will see if the kitchen can hook me up....

Delicious!! A plentiful steaming dish of pasta carbonara comes out. The bread was hot and soaked up the olive oil perfectly. The decor is very "Italian", but not as nauseating as most Italian chain restaurants. 

I will definitely come back!! Plus, the people watching in Barrington is choice!
It's a really good Italian restaurant. They have a homely type of feel excellent service and they have great dinner specials highly recommend this place

We moved into the area and decided to give this retaurant a try.  Background music is great... wine was good... but that's all.  Glasses were less than sparkly clean.   We split a pizza as an appetiser.  I don't eat frozen pizza, but I bet that is better than what we were served.  It was a soggy mess. My husbands pork chop was as dry as shoe leather, not edible and my roast chicken came out floating in heavy cream sauce.  I guess for some who like cream sauces, this would be a treat.  I'm not a fan and as the menu said nothing about the cream sauce, it was a dissappointment to us.  I say us, as after determining the pork chop is not edible I thought we could at least split the roast chicken.   Service is spotty.  People ask how everything is, but are in such a hurry to walk by the table, you can never say what the problem(s) are.

We were hoping this would become our new fave in the area, but no such luck.  The search for a good Italian restaurant in the Barrington area is still on.

Great (not inexpensive) dissappointment and we will not be back.

We came for Valentine's Day and it was our first experience here.  First and foremost the place was packed,  which some may find appealing.   Maybe it means they have good food?   Too bad there were SO many people waiting to check in, the lobby was literally packed.   Barely room to breathe.   We finally checked in for our 6:45 reservation at 7pm (yes we were on time and yes it took that long just to get to the hostess stand).  Were seated at a decent table and promptly ordered drinks.  My husband didn't like his and sent it back for something else.   Mine didn't come as ordered.   So both drinks had to be sent back.   We ordered the calamari,  which we found to be incredibly over cooked and didn't even finish.   The house bread and seasoned olive oil was delicious though.   We had been seated for about 30 minutes (maybe longer).  Finally had to ask or waiter if we could order our entrees.   He seemed surprised.  Food took a while but both our dishes were bone-in so would take longer than usual, they get a pass on this one.  The atmosphere could have been more romantic.   The place was very loud but family friendly.   We saw plenty of kids there.  Prices were about $15-$20 for a pasta dish and $25+ for a entre.   All in all a great more fresh version of the chain Italian restaurants.   Would be interested in dining there on a night other than Valentine's Day.

My family loves this place for our Italian fix.

We have been here many times. The only problem sometimes is the service, we have had some waiters that are not too good. One time we actually handed our tip to one of the bus boys because he provided a much superior service.

The calamari is the BEST, you must get it. We have loved all of their pasta dishes and have had everything from the tomato based, cream and olive oil type sauces. They always add enough seafood in their seafood dishes. The chocolate cake dessert is great too if you are looking for an extra treat.

This place is good for kids too - I love seeing families bringing their kids and teaching them good manners. Love it!

Met friends from Crystal Lake here for dinner. I'll call him Guisseppe to protect his innocence, because I still think he's in the witness protection program... He's an Italian from NY, living in Chicago... hmmm?

Anyway, we were celebrating his wife's b-day and had a very nice dinner, server had a great sense of humor and was able to play with us through the night. 2 1/2 hrs later, a bottle of prosecco, bread, salad, boat loads of pasta and some yummy desserts, I was entering food coma land. 

One neat thing too is the photography in the place. Lots of portraits (street style), food shots and in general just a very nice atmosphere with friendly folks. 

Definitely won't be hard to get them back there again. And on Sundays apparently kids eat free, so bring 'em if you got 'em!

How this restaurant survives is beyond me. It's supposed to offer authentic Italian food, but it doesn't. The Caprese had dry, tasteless Wisconsin blue cheese on it, instead of mozzarella. The carpaccio was sliced so thin that it needed surgery to get it off the plate. There was something advertized as "branzino" - a prized fish from the Mediterranean. It turned out to be a soggy, and sorry Chilean Sea Bass. The manager blithely explained he uses Google to write the "Italian" in his menu! When asked for a recommendation on wine, the waiter went straight for the most expensive which further discussion revealed he knew nothing about.
A real disappointment!

much better experience than the other francesca's that i have been to(at least 4 others on many occasions) 

matilda in the bottle : )

the server was busy but he managed to deliver on time.

I actually thought the handwriting on the menu was sooo nice that it almost ruined my meal knowing that my penmanship can never compare

good location.. nice staff.. good food.. easy choice

One of our Fav's, my husband never orders off the menu. They always make him Chicken Parm, there fish is out of this world and they Have a Gluten Free menu.
Try it you will Love it!
My husband and I enjoyed our dinner. It was delish!   Gets busy on a Saturday night around 6:30 pm.  Go earlier if you want to beat the crowd.

A group of us ending up here on a personal referral.  We had a early dinner around 5 when we got there the place empty.    Luckily I split a dish with one of my friends and when it was all said and done we both had food left over on our plates.  Not one person in our group finished their plate.  And it was not because we did not try.  The food was amazing.  Everything was cooked perfectly you could taste the freshness of the ingredients.  I got a pasta dish with scallops and shrimp with a light creamy pesto sauce.  Just AWESOME!  If I ever make it back to that neck of the woods I WILL be eating there.

My brother, sister-in-law & my nephew took me here for dinner on a Friday night as a belated birthday treat. 

My nephew & I had medallions of veal which we both enjoyed. They were quite flavorful and complimented by the sides.  My brother & S-i-L ordered from the days specials.  

My bro, had lamb shanks with mashed potatoes and vegetable.  It was not very "Italian", but the taste of it that I had, made me wish I had ordered the same. So, what's "Italian" anyway?  I guess there were some hints of a tomato based gravy.

My s-i-l had  Grouper, a fish that I like very much.  She didn't eat all of hers and asked if I wanted to finish the  remaining portion of it, which I did.  When I tasted the grouper when it was first served, it seemed very good, but after it was served, half-way through the meal, it had taken on a rather "fishy" taste.  I mean like it lacked freshness.  Grouper is not a fish that retains freshness well.  In fact, I normally only eat it when I visit an area near to where it is caught .

The herbed olive oil for bread dipping is fantastic.

My bro tells me that they go here for dinner quite often when they want to just "go out to eat".

One of the other pluses of this location is that it is connected to  free village indoor parking .

When I go out for Italian food,  I believe that the simpler the dish harder it is to make it great. But here from the appetizer to the entree the food was outstanding.  We had the bruschetta which was the best that I've had. We tried the pizza next, we made our own spinach and artichoke. This was great. The entree was a garlic, tomato, basil pasta which had the right amount of everything. Overall one of the best Italian dinners I have had.  Enjoy!

I will start this review by saying that the only thing that saved this from a one start review was the food. We have been to the city locations many times and had great service and great food. I work in the area and all my co workers frequent this Francesca's. So on my way back from the city I stopped in for lunch. We were seated right away, but We waited awhile before we were greeted. We figured maybe the server had been double sat or something. While we are sitting there waiting we see the manager go around to all the tables dining except ours!? Thanks guy. It looked like maybe only one server was on and another woman was helping her out but she wasnt actually serving tables so im not sure what was actually happening. All i know is we almost walked out in between our app and entree because it took almost 30min. Our total time being there for a burger and a meatball sub was an hour and a half. Thanks but no thanks. There are plenty of great restaurants in the area that give much better service.
Favorite place to eat in B-town.  Bar seating is a nice place for good eats on a week night.  Make sure to get a reservation on the weekend. Love the arugula salad!

Taking into account Aaron's review, perhaps the service was lacking because my daughter is half "ethnic"......but even so, the food was horrific.....and for those of you that use Open Table - take note that they edit and censor their reviews....I tried to post a similar review on their site, but they refused to post it because of "liability" issues, in the fact that I mentioned that there was sand in the mushrooms and the oil was rancid.

Wife and I came here for a casual Valentines dinner, and had a great experience combined with very good Italian food.

The location is nice, as it's tucked away on a small side street in Barrington.  Plenty of on street parking, and there's a parking garage right next door. 

Immediately after coming in the door, a gentleman took our coats and gave us a coat check ticket right at the door.  The Matre d' seated us immediately.  The dining room is somewhat busy, and tables are fairly close together.  My wife and I both felt comfortable wearing jeans, and there were plenty of people who had brought their children there (though I still felt like I was surrounded by adults, and not at Chuck-e Cheese's).

Drinks, appetizers and entres all came quickly and each was brought out after the other one was completed (they didn't bring the salad until our appetizer was finished).  Pasta portions were very large.  What we would call 4 servings at home was a single serving here.  However, looking around, there were others with non-pasta meals where the portions looked more reasonably sized. 

I'd classify the food as "pretty darn good Italian food".  Not the best I've ever had, but absolutely delicious and worth coming back for.

Never anything less than an excellent experience with the service and the food...like the cheery and white linen ambiance, and would kill for the lentil/spinach starter. I always overorder, which is a positive sign. Entrees are excellent, pasta portions (the Mrs. always orders pasta) are ridiculous, and kids eat free with each 'adult' entree ordered on Sundays. Love the kid's cheese pizza, too. A bite of the kids' gelatos afterward, and we're set.

The food was good, but because of the bartenders, I will never eat here again.  We waited for 30 minutes past our reservation time before we sat down.  We waited in the crowded bar.  I tried to order drinks for the four of us, but the bartender said he had to help another guest first.  He then spent 20 minutes just with them, talking about different wines to try.  So, without a drink, we were eventually seated, and we then tried to order drinks.  After 30 minutes of waiting (no kidding), our waitress informed us that the bartender was backed up and she didn't have our drinks yet.  The manager tried to make things right by treating us to a round of drinks.  So, when my second glass of red wine came, it was in a port glass!  Our waitress informed us that the bar had run out of red wine glasses.  The bartenders are definitely hurting the profitability and the reputation of this restaurant.
