There are plenty of other places to eat where they value my business.  Plus, this place is incredibly loud.

Save your money.  If you really want to experience a Mia Francesca restaurant head to the one on Clark or even the Lake Forest location.  The Barrington location has atrocious food and service.  Couldn't even find a decent pasta dish to order, so I got the roast chicken.  Tasted like airplane food.  And I didn't think it was possible to screw up bruscetta, but they did---under seasoned and bad quality tomatoes.
Fantastic service.  Manager is a class act.  Food is consistently solid.  For sure the best Italian restaurant in the area.

Francesca's always delivers.  Great food.  Great drinks.  Great service.  The Barrington location is my favorite but all are good.  It is pricey though I must say.  I rarely get out of there under $100.

Francesca's is one of our favorite places in Barrington.  The food is always good, and (almost) always the wait staff is extremely attentive.  Our family dines here at least once per month.  The salads and appetizers are fresh and wonderful.  The pasta and entrees wonderfully seasoned and prepared with care.  Don't worry if their  menu pasta selection lacks something you want - just ask, and they generally will prepare what you want - the sign of an excellent Italian restaurant.  Only once have we had poor service - and management made up for it by discounting the bill (unasked).
Whole family loves this restaurant. Great food at a perfect price. Feel like we know the staff and are always welcome.
Perfect place for the Olive Garden crowd. But wait Olive Garden has better service!
Great pasta, an excellent wine list and overall great service. My favorite place in town.
A great place to go out with the gals.  Bar side is a better atmosphere rather than the restaurant side.  If crowded can be a tad loud...but a fun place.
You're not going to have a bad meal at this place.  Good meals fairly priced, decent staff, good bar area.  Quality experience. If they had a better staff, this place would be 4 1/2.
Very good food. Even better service. Its expensive...but there are less expensive options like the pizza (which is great!) on the menu as well. I can't wait to go again!
Wish they would have a more diverse menu with specials updated more frequently. Wines by the glass are a little pricey.

I have never had a bad meal at any Francescas. Service, food never fail.Love the fish specials and fresh salads with an ever changing menu. However, this spot, which I have been to three times for dinner and once for lunch as I have business that takes me to Barrington often,, has one irritating fault. The clientele is more upscale,40plus yet during both lunch and dinner, we are assaulted by horrendous rock music like a teen radio program. Why? Ahh, to sip wine with a little Sinatra would be so much more appropo.

This place is awesome.  Great location downtown, not a ton of parking however.  There is not a ton of seating so definitely make reservations.  I had the salmon and my date had a pasta dish.  The food is top quality as is the service.  Date spot for sure....Definitely the best restaurant in Barrington!

Some friends and I meet at Smooth Fox every Wednesday.. $1 burgers and open mic night...who can say no?? This place just opened a few months ago and I'm so glad it did!! The food is great, the servers and bartenders are all fun and on top of their game. The have a large stage for performances, bar and seating downstairs  and upstairs they have ANOTHER bar, dance floor and DJ booth! Always a fun time at Smooth Fox!!!

I wanted to love this place when I visited on Saturday after a long day and stayed until 230 AM with family & friends. I waited and waited for things to get better. The poor staffing, the mediocre food, and the crowd all left a lot to be desired. 


If this restauranteur is to survive* in a highly competitive business, the service, and the food better be spectacular.  I think the management would greatly benefit from the secret shopper to offer training to improve the guest experience and/ or management consultant to improve the user experience.

 It used to be that a restaurant could open fairly quietly. You had time to work out the menu and staffing issues, relative obscurity to find your voice and style, and months of experience to adequately adjust the flow and feel of the front and back of the house.

*The fact that restaurants fail at an alarmingly high rate, as 90 to 95 percent in the first year, is actually wrong. According to recent studies done by Professor Dr. HG Parsa 59% of hospitality facilities fail in the period of 3 years.
I think the chili must have had beer in it. Wonderful if you're a beer fan...I'm not. Cheese curds were good. I'd go back if I'm in the area again.

How depressing .......
Grew up at this place with its burgers and the world best fries...now under new owners I wanted to relive my childhood and enjoy one of the best burgers ever!!
Very depressing soggy burger .. No real flavor all the love seems to be gone.
Fries were one of the worst displays of food... 3 day old McDonald fries would taste better..I was told nothing has changed since the new owners have taken over but that's hard to believe ....
Pass on this place please ....burger king is right down the street and it's cheaper ..
At least you can drink here ... You'll need to in order to enjoy the food

My last visit was more 3 1/2 stars than 4 stars.  I usually love  their burgers even after the new ownership.  I usually can't go wrong with the burger on the pretzel bun, but tonight it was just meh.  My Mom and son said their burger and cheeseburger were great as always; the cole slaw was good too.  That gave me a bit of hope for a next time.  This is a nice neighborhood joint and and I would like to continue coming here with the family; I just hope it was just an off night for them.

Stumbled onto this place last minute.  Had a burger build your own. Pretzel bread egg bacon.  Huge delicious with side of steak fries and Cole slaw. Amy was our waitress and she was great, helpful and friendly. My friend had fried chicken sandwich that he said was one of his best. 
I'd go back!

$35.00 after tip for two bland cheeseburgers, fries, one diet coke and a tablespoonful of canned baked beans and terrible coleslaw. The arrogant son of the owner..ugh...Catch the Metra to Cary and get a burger at The Tracks. This place lost its mojo 15 years ago.....

Best burgers in this area. Even the cole slaw is amazing. I won't go back on a Saturday because they do not have the square footage to operate properly. I get the charm of the place, but it's incredibly cramped and you're practically eating in the laps of the strangers next to you. Not comfortable at all, but the food is stellar. I'll be back, on a weekday.

Great burgers and tasty cheese curds!!!
The service was great!!!! This building has some history going way back to Prohibition!!

Besides the praise from my first review, Brandt's has shown me exactly how important their customers are to them. The OWNER of Brandt's personally came to my house to inform me that I had been given the wrong bill the night before and that I had overpaid. He wanted to make sure I was aware of it and corrected the mistake beyond my expectations! They have my business for life! Thank you Walt.

Brought the family here hoping it was " family friendly". Walked in around 4:00 on a Saturday afternoon to an empty restaurant and a few people sitting at the bar. Was greeted by a man, presumably the owner, told us to sit anywhere. Thought we had made a mistake picking this place to eat. After ordering our food customers began filling in. AWESOME food had by all. Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had, my son thought the same thing. Place was packed by the time we left. Waitstaff was great also. I am definitely making this restaurant our "go to" place. Great job Brandt's.

Most inconsistent take out. Owner is drinking at the bar. Staff can't find the order in the computer. I'm confused. Your place is empty which is really sad. This place was my go to 5 years ago. Wtf happened? Yeah you guys need a hip check. Seriously wake up!
A mighty tasty burger, served on rye with great fries. I wish I could have had a beer with it! But it was lunch time and I had to work. A great American Roadhouse!
Still the best!  Cheeseburgers on a pretzel bun, slaw and real pub feel! Still packs them in, yet still has the feel of a genuine charm of an old English pub!  Keep it up Jim and Walt!
The burger was very good. The home made chips from earlier in the day should have been warmer

An excellent joint. Packed with friendly locals. The food was excellent.

Started the night off with some cheese curds, the cheese tasty, the dough light and airy, with honey mustard to dip it in. Recommended.

The burgers.. Where do I begin? You HAVE to order a burger. It's necessary. I had a burger with Munster, bacon, mushrooms, and all of the toppings.. The burger was cooked to perfection, just the right amount of fat in the meat. Don't forget the Mac and cheese, heavenly. Worth it, has a lot of cheesy punch. The coleslaw slightly peppery. And the house made chips, excellent.

The boy had buttered burger with american and the toppings it comes with. The steak fries were tasty.

Only downfall, our server was delightful, but it took a bit of time to get the check and to also have it picked up to run the card. Also, during hawks games, the area we sat in, down the stairs, the volume needed to be up a bit more so we can hear the TVs! But we're definitely coming back in the future, many many times. This place is heaven

This is a nice local neighborhood joint, and I've eaten here a few times.  Everytime its the same problem.  
Their burgers are bland.
Almost positive they put zero seasoning on their patties before they hit the flattop, further evidenced by their appearance on Chicago's Best.  There is also no sear, which is how you get great flavor.

The service is always fine, and the people are nice, but you can tell the owners' experience isn't in restaurants.  As someone who's worked in restaurants for over a decade, you know to season your proteins.

So as a suggestion, put some salt (kosher/sea) and pepper on your patties right before you cook 'em!  Also, cook em on a higher heat for a better sear.  Basic restaurant fundamentals.  These things seriously lack flavor.

On a positive note, the burgers are moist, and could be pretty decent.  And I hope these guys do well keeping a Palatine staple alive, but SEASONING!

First time there,  went because of all the good reviews.  Food took forever,  horrible greasy burger,  cheese curds were not good my chicken quesadilla was just OK. And weird tasting sweet potato fries.  Over all I feel sick after from all the grease and definitely not returning ! No idea why they have good reviews.

Forty-five dollars for three orders of burgers. Good but overrated for me. Fries were greasy. Burgers were big but nothing extra special. Sorta miffed when I got six Ketchup packets for three orders of fries.

A crowed place, yes, but not really a big place either.

Happen to be in the area and was invited to have lunch there with a friend who lives in Palatine and knows the area well. This spot has a great burger!! Nothing fancy or anything but the burger tastes really good and is very fresh. Service was good and I overall the place was crowded for a Friday. 

Given that this place looks like a house, the interior also feels cozy and you feel like you are in someones house having dinner/lunch! If I am ever back in that area I would definitely go back to this place for another burger!

When your goal is a great burger and something cold, this is your destination.  Yes, it's crowded.  And loud.  But the servers move quickly and efficiently, which is all you're really after for a burger fix.  NOT a first date place.  NOT a last date place.  Just good food and fun.

I love the fact that they have pretzel buns and sweet potato fries options for no additional cost.  There are also a lot of other options. It is a very good burger which comes with a side and coleslaw. It is small and can get busy, but it is a really charming place.

Remember going there when I was a kid as lived in one of the houses nearby. And we moved out of the area. Now 30ish years later...with new owners I am very impressed on how much they have changed/updated. Im now back in the area. 

Very friendly staff and very attentive. Order was right. Best burgers in the area hands down. I have a hard time finding places that does preztel bun burgers. They had different choices of buns... pretzel bun , sesame, sourdough and others I forget. 

Tonights order was pretzel bun, cheddar and medium done. Perfectly cooked, juicy. Got steak fries and they trumped Red Robins fries. Quality of the meat also was great as well. The cheddar portion was generous as well. Melted into some of steak fries which I love cheesy fries added to the mix. 

Also liked their mac and cheese. The coleslaw was on the sweet side freshly made. 

The price is kind of a good deal for the portions as its huge burger and fries portions and quality.  I am definitely coming back.

This is the epitome of a dive bar.  The food is excellent and the service is friendly.  I had the ribs and really enjoyed them. Right up there with some of the best.  The burgers were cooked perfectly and juicy.  The homemade chips are way better than the fries.  I can't wait to go back.

Although this appears to be my first review of Brandt's, we've dined here many times over the years and I am certain I've review it before. However, with the change in ownership last year, Yelp must have created a new profile.

We ate at Brandt's last over a month ago and the experience was great. I posted an updated review complimenting the staff about how much better the place was under new management. But, I hope our experience this night was just a bad night.

We were seated right away. Brandt's is small, and we were put at a table that was crowded in by other tables leaving little room for movement. The waitress was energetic, but was not attentive. We placed our order shortly after sitting down. It took her about ten minutes to deliver my drink, a coke. We were all talking and didn't realize it until we checked, but 1/2 hour passed before they finally delivered our food. 

Two items (three people in our party) had to send food back. My hamburger was supposed to be cook medium - their burgers are at least 1/2 pound and usually great. But one side of mine was charred and the other side was raw. Well, I guess if you take the average of them it was medium? I didn't mention that the fries were under-cooked.

They were apologetic and said they would replace the burger, which they did. The second burger was fine, and the fries were still under-cooked but better than before.

One hot button of mine is the server's attentiveness to drink refills. I drank my coke while waiting for the meal to be served. When they dropped off my second burger, they ran off quickly and did not notice all three of us had empty glasses. I was finally able to flag her down and ask for refills, but they really should watch for that.

I'm disappointed about this visit. While I don't consider myself a regular, we've been there over a dozen times over the years, and three times since they changed owners last year. So, again, I'm hopeful this was just a bad day for them. But, it was memorable for us in an unsatisfying way. I really hope they get their act back together or they will lose some of their hard earned customers.

My wife and I try to visit different places each weekend and last week we tried Brandts. We had heard about the legendary burgers and were not disappointed. Our party of four each tried a different burger and even the sides were very good. Our martinis at the bar were served promptly and the staff were extremely friendly. Good choice of draft beers, including IPA, complimented the food perfectly. Only disappointment was extreme noise from close proximity of tables but otherwise it was a fantastic evening.

Brandt's has been at this same location making great burgers since I was a little kid. I had the chicken quesadillas last night, and they were also quite good. If you're looking for good, solid bar food Brandt's is a great choice.

The food was alright - given the prices and wait however, I expected to get better food. The food for me in general lacked a good texture and could've had more refined flavor combinations. Most notably, the burger really lacked flavor in the meat (could've used some more seasoning or wood/charcoal grilling) and could've used a well toasted bun. The steak fries and sweet potato fries were simply soggy with no crispyness at all. The homemade chips and baked beans tried to do too much in terms of flavor and as a result, didn't really present a clear theme. The BBQ ribs were too dry and lacked flavor.

Given the other good reviews, maybe I came when they were too busy and would get a better experience if I came at a slower time.

We were in on a Friday night around 6 o'clock. 

Our only seating choice was in "the basement" to the right of the entrance.

It's a small space with the fine stench of mold. That coupled with country music that was too loud and three flat-screen TV's was almost too much to take.

It took awhile to get a waitress and when she came, she wasn't the most pleasant woman.

Uncharacteristic of Brandt's (though we'd only been there two or three times previously), it took the better part of an hour to get our food (there were three of us).

The burgers tasted better on previous visits and the fries were cold.

I'll chalk it up to an "off" night for them, but they could do better.
Place is small but packs a flavor punch. The burgers are huge and juicy. Recommend on a pretzel bun. The southwest chicken wrap has wonderful flavor. The sweet potato fries were crisp and plentiful.

Brandt's is ok - they didn't blow me away, but I don't hate it.

When I came in, I immediately noticed how there wasn't very much room at all. The tables are squished together (we ended up sitting at one right by the bathroom), you have to squeeze through people at the bar to get to your table or the bathroom, and the tables themselves are pretty small. Cozy would be putting it nice. I like to have a little more room to move.

The menu is pretty limited - one burger that you can customize with your choice of potato, some other sandwiches, soups, and salad. I got the burger, which was very tasty and juicy. I really don't have any complaints about the food or the prices. It's good for what you pay. They also have a decent selection of beers on draft and bottled.

The service was meh. When I first walked in I wasn't greeted. I had to ask if you seat yourself or if someone is supposed to seat you. When I was seated, I had a choice between 2 tables, neither of which had much room. Our waitress was a little snippy at first, but got better later on. 

I would come back, but it wouldn't be my first choice. I definitely wouldn't come here with a big group of people.

Remember going there when I was a kid as lived in one of the houses nearby. And we moved out of the area. Now 30ish years later...with new owners I am very impressed on how much they have changed/updated. Im now back in the area. 

Very friendly staff and very attentive. Order was right. Best burgers in the area hands down. I have a hard time finding places that does preztel bun burgers. They had different choices of buns... pretzel bun , sesame, sourdough and others I forget. 

Tonights order was pretzel bun, cheddar and medium done. Perfectly cooked, juicy. Got steak fries and they trumped Red Robins fries. Quality of the meat also was great as well. The cheddar portion was generous as well. Melted into some of steak fries which I love cheesy fries added to the mix. 

Also liked their mac and cheese. The coleslaw was on the sweet side freshly made. 

The price is kind of a good deal for the portions as its huge burger and fries portions and quality.  I am definitely coming back.

This is the epitome of a dive bar.  The food is excellent and the service is friendly.  I had the ribs and really enjoyed them. Right up there with some of the best.  The burgers were cooked perfectly and juicy.  The homemade chips are way better than the fries.  I can't wait to go back.

Although this appears to be my first review of Brandt's, we've dined here many times over the years and I am certain I've review it before. However, with the change in ownership last year, Yelp must have created a new profile.

We ate at Brandt's last over a month ago and the experience was great. I posted an updated review complimenting the staff about how much better the place was under new management. But, I hope our experience this night was just a bad night.

We were seated right away. Brandt's is small, and we were put at a table that was crowded in by other tables leaving little room for movement. The waitress was energetic, but was not attentive. We placed our order shortly after sitting down. It took her about ten minutes to deliver my drink, a coke. We were all talking and didn't realize it until we checked, but 1/2 hour passed before they finally delivered our food. 

Two items (three people in our party) had to send food back. My hamburger was supposed to be cook medium - their burgers are at least 1/2 pound and usually great. But one side of mine was charred and the other side was raw. Well, I guess if you take the average of them it was medium? I didn't mention that the fries were under-cooked.

They were apologetic and said they would replace the burger, which they did. The second burger was fine, and the fries were still under-cooked but better than before.

One hot button of mine is the server's attentiveness to drink refills. I drank my coke while waiting for the meal to be served. When they dropped off my second burger, they ran off quickly and did not notice all three of us had empty glasses. I was finally able to flag her down and ask for refills, but they really should watch for that.

I'm disappointed about this visit. While I don't consider myself a regular, we've been there over a dozen times over the years, and three times since they changed owners last year. So, again, I'm hopeful this was just a bad day for them. But, it was memorable for us in an unsatisfying way. I really hope they get their act back together or they will lose some of their hard earned customers.

My wife and I try to visit different places each weekend and last week we tried Brandts. We had heard about the legendary burgers and were not disappointed. Our party of four each tried a different burger and even the sides were very good. Our martinis at the bar were served promptly and the staff were extremely friendly. Good choice of draft beers, including IPA, complimented the food perfectly. Only disappointment was extreme noise from close proximity of tables but otherwise it was a fantastic evening.

Brandt's has been at this same location making great burgers since I was a little kid. I had the chicken quesadillas last night, and they were also quite good. If you're looking for good, solid bar food Brandt's is a great choice.

The food was alright - given the prices and wait however, I expected to get better food. The food for me in general lacked a good texture and could've had more refined flavor combinations. Most notably, the burger really lacked flavor in the meat (could've used some more seasoning or wood/charcoal grilling) and could've used a well toasted bun. The steak fries and sweet potato fries were simply soggy with no crispyness at all. The homemade chips and baked beans tried to do too much in terms of flavor and as a result, didn't really present a clear theme. The BBQ ribs were too dry and lacked flavor.

Given the other good reviews, maybe I came when they were too busy and would get a better experience if I came at a slower time.

We were in on a Friday night around 6 o'clock. 

Our only seating choice was in "the basement" to the right of the entrance.

It's a small space with the fine stench of mold. That coupled with country music that was too loud and three flat-screen TV's was almost too much to take.

It took awhile to get a waitress and when she came, she wasn't the most pleasant woman.

Uncharacteristic of Brandt's (though we'd only been there two or three times previously), it took the better part of an hour to get our food (there were three of us).

The burgers tasted better on previous visits and the fries were cold.

I'll chalk it up to an "off" night for them, but they could do better.
Place is small but packs a flavor punch. The burgers are huge and juicy. Recommend on a pretzel bun. The southwest chicken wrap has wonderful flavor. The sweet potato fries were crisp and plentiful.

Brandt's is ok - they didn't blow me away, but I don't hate it.

When I came in, I immediately noticed how there wasn't very much room at all. The tables are squished together (we ended up sitting at one right by the bathroom), you have to squeeze through people at the bar to get to your table or the bathroom, and the tables themselves are pretty small. Cozy would be putting it nice. I like to have a little more room to move.

The menu is pretty limited - one burger that you can customize with your choice of potato, some other sandwiches, soups, and salad. I got the burger, which was very tasty and juicy. I really don't have any complaints about the food or the prices. It's good for what you pay. They also have a decent selection of beers on draft and bottled.

The service was meh. When I first walked in I wasn't greeted. I had to ask if you seat yourself or if someone is supposed to seat you. When I was seated, I had a choice between 2 tables, neither of which had much room. Our waitress was a little snippy at first, but got better later on. 

I would come back, but it wouldn't be my first choice. I definitely wouldn't come here with a big group of people.
Small place, so getting in some nights is hit or miss. The food is really good, and the divey bar ambiance is great. Prices are pretty reasonable.
New owners are still making one of the best bugers I've ever eaten I mean everything is really really good here

Great food marred by horrible customer service... Don't let them seat you in the basement if they ask, unless you want to be ignored for the night. Had to ask another waitress to get our waitress two separate times. Then after getting our food, we didn't see her until we got check - otherwise I would have told her that my medium burger was still bright red inside. 

Food was great, but I sure didn't feel taken care of.
Brandt's do Palatine is one of my all time favorites! I've frequented this establishment numerous times and continue to reccomend this restaurant to everyone I know who enjoys awesome food!

We went to this place couple weeks ago, because we wanted to try the burgers everybody is talking about in their reviews. And we weren't disappointed! The burgers were amazing!! Great buns, great meat. Everything seemed fresh and was just very delicious! I'm taking a star off for the environment though. The bar area is ok, but the dining area is just ugly. Not cozy and not beautiful. We didn't check out the basement, so no comment on that ;)
Best burgers around! I love this place

Fresh half pound ground burger, fresh, fresh.....cooked anyway you like with trimmings of great pickles, sweet onions,  lettuce,  tomato. Several bun options. Fresh chips, good slaw. Perfect lunch spot. Dinner, get in line and put your name in.....always busy. Great neighborhood place, always freindly staff.

Back at Brandts, after 15 years.  My friend said it has not changed except it's been remodeled. Walking in the door nothing has changed. A remodel that looks 15 years in the past!!!! It does not matter. This burger is still one of the best in the Chicagoland area. Yum. Yes it has a small menu.  It is famous for burgers...not enchiladas, not ribs, not pasta,#SoGetABurger!!! Even the coleslaw is Yum!

Brandts has been remodeled and looks great!!!Amy was our server and she was great!!!When we came in there was a wait upstairs but found the basement to be open seating . So we chose to sit down there  which was nice and cool on a humid day. We started with cheese curds they are a must they are battered like fish and chips and come with 3 sauces. The homemade garlic ranch was the best!! We also ordered the  sunrise burger which  wasn't listed on the menu but has a fried egg  bacon cheddar cheese and your choice of bun we choose the butter bun for around $11 came with your choice of fries homemade chips and came with with coleslaw. We ordrred a full slab of ribs and meat fell off the bone it was so tender. Our friend ordered the corned beef sandwich on rye . The meat so tender and chopped with sauerkraut.  The beer selection was great too some nice ipa s... dogfish head, founders and anti hero. They also had Guinness, Stella ,miller, etc. If in the Palatine area stop in for a great burger cheese curds

My husband and I went Feb 13th.  It was a disaster!  
1. Impolite rushed waitress,  kept interupting as we ordered.
2. My burger had a pool of blood gushing all around plate-NOT the way I ordered it.
3. Sent the burger back and Waitress was "mad".
4. Plate came right back I guess they wiped the blood but didn't finish cooking it as it was still Bloody... 
5. Sent it back, to which the waitress replied meanly "thats the way its suppose to be!".
6. Decided to order the small wing appetizer.
7. While WAITING long time, another customer had Same BLOODY problem had to send hers back.
8. The owner/manager went back to kitchen with 2nd complaint
9. The other customer waited long time but got a NEW burger.
10.  I'm WAITING and my husband is now done and he remarks:
A. The burger is NOT monsterous. like they claim only 1/2 lb. BUT the BUN is monsterous.  
B.  The flavor was as a steamed burger not grilled, pale and no flavor.
C. After about 1hr he felt sick from it.
D. His sweet Potato fries appeared to me to have cornstarch coating which some people with dietary issues do NOT want.. but nothing was said... it had a coating on it. like burger king use to do.
E.  Finally paid check, stood still WAITING for 5 peices of wings.
F. Got Wings, got outside to car, looked in bag and the carton was not sealed so grease was in the bag.. and on the outside of the carton. 
G.  NOTHING but GREASE coming off wings. Yeah a pale red to show there was some hot sauce but the "sauce" was all grease and all pooled up in the bottom and disaster.
H. I got out of vehicle as I didn't want GREASE all over and thru it out in their trash can.

never again.  the waitress was not helpful, nor kind, nor willing to help out

Nice little beer and shot bar atmosphere but for a bar burger place...very poor value. Way too costly for below average food and service. Not really a destination location and the chances of me going back are very slim.

Worst service I have ever had. My daughter and I went for a dinner. We ordered an appetizer after which our waitress promptly disappeared.. 25 minutes later I had to look for someone to help. When the waitress finally came back, our appetizer order hadn't been entered. So another 20 or so minutes go by and we finally get our appetizer and order dinner. A half an hour after that the waitress comes back and tells us the cook left and we won't be getting anything. We arrived at Brandts about 6:15. We left after 8pm only having an appetizer. They comp'd the dinner but I will never go back. I get being busy. I get mishaps. But there was no communication or honesty about what was going on. That is ridiculous.
Very nice place, and super super super good burger...make sure to add bacon ($1.75)....again, it's vereeeerry good burger :)
Don't expect high end dining here. this is a great local beer/burger joint that does it right. can it be overcrowded? Yes, but its a BAR. the burgers are among the best in Chicago land area.
Amazing! Delicious. So good. Haven't had a burger this great in a long time. The pretzel roll melts in your mouth!
It would be nice if they posted closed on Sunday. Jus pulled up and they are closed on Sunday. Most businesses have it on the Website or Yelp alerts you they are closed.

Excellent food and their staff is incredibly friendly. Their burgers are amazing! Only thing to be aware of is that it's super small inside. If you go with more than 4 people, the wait is really long because there just isn't room.

Great little local place for a tasty burger, fresh cut fries and some darn good cheese curds.  The batter is light and delicious.  People are friendly, food is good, albeit a bit greasy (but what does one expect from a burger joint?). Worth checking out if you're in the area.

I discovered Brandt's about 2 years ago through a friend's recommendation.  The Brandt's Burger is seriously one of the greatest things that has ever happened to me.  I take my kids here with me whenever I go, and I'm the guy that always puts Creedence on the jukebox.  Love this place!!

I've seen Brandt's driving by and had always wanted to go.  From the outside it looks like an antique looking house, turned restaurant/bar so it caught my eye.  Last night my friend recommended we go so there was my chance.  As we walked in, we didn't get greeted right away so I was a little confused, but sure enough our waitress seated us and was very nice.  The place is smaller than what I expected but cozy.  The menu is very small.  Just some appetizers, a simple burger that you can customize, and a few higher end items.  Everyone raves about their burgers and sure enough they were right!  One of the best burgers in Palatine!

Worst service I have ever had. My daughter and I went for a dinner. We ordered an appetizer after which our waitress promptly disappeared.. 25 minutes later I had to look for someone to help. When the waitress finally came back, our appetizer order hadn't been entered. So another 20 or so minutes go by and we finally get our appetizer and order dinner. A half an hour after that the waitress comes back and tells us the cook left and we won't be getting anything. We arrived at Brandts about 6:15. We left after 8pm only having an appetizer. They comp'd the dinner but I will never go back. I get being busy. I get mishaps. But there was no communication or honesty about what was going on. That is ridiculous.
Very nice place, and super super super good burger...make sure to add bacon ($1.75)....again, it's vereeeerry good burger :)
Don't expect high end dining here. this is a great local beer/burger joint that does it right. can it be overcrowded? Yes, but its a BAR. the burgers are among the best in Chicago land area.
Amazing! Delicious. So good. Haven't had a burger this great in a long time. The pretzel roll melts in your mouth!
It would be nice if they posted closed on Sunday. Jus pulled up and they are closed on Sunday. Most businesses have it on the Website or Yelp alerts you they are closed.

Excellent food and their staff is incredibly friendly. Their burgers are amazing! Only thing to be aware of is that it's super small inside. If you go with more than 4 people, the wait is really long because there just isn't room.

Great little local place for a tasty burger, fresh cut fries and some darn good cheese curds.  The batter is light and delicious.  People are friendly, food is good, albeit a bit greasy (but what does one expect from a burger joint?). Worth checking out if you're in the area.

I've seen Brandt's driving by and had always wanted to go.  From the outside it looks like an antique looking house, turned restaurant/bar so it caught my eye.  Last night my friend recommended we go so there was my chance.  As we walked in, we didn't get greeted right away so I was a little confused, but sure enough our waitress seated us and was very nice.  The place is smaller than what I expected but cozy.  The menu is very small.  Just some appetizers, a simple burger that you can customize, and a few higher end items.  Everyone raves about their burgers and sure enough they were right!  One of the best burgers in Palatine!

The Brandt's burger is fire!  Best burgers in the area. Order it with a pretzel bun, it's delicious. The place gets busy very quickly during lunch, which is the only time I've ever been here.  The place is on the small side so get there early.   Friendly and prompt service, and the burgers were cooked perfectly. If you're craving a burger, this is a must try spot.

You'd never really guess that Brandt's is a restaurant when you drive by, it has a slightly 'haunted house' vibe to it from the outside. Once inside that vibe turns into an over crowded but friendly neighborhood bar feel. 

We were a party of six and were seated at a table in the corner and were so wedged in that it was impossible for most of us to get up if we had to without the rest of the table also getting up. It really is a tiny restaurant with a few too many tables. 

I've been to Brandt's several times and I usually stick with their specialty, the Brandt burger, and this time was no exception.  I like my burgers pink and juicy, and this one was cooked pretty close to well done even though I had ordered it medium. No worries though, it was good. The burgers are pretty giant and I happily took half home for lunch the next day. 

The bar area is small and only has two small TVs, so if you're looking for a place to watch a game this may not be the best bet. 

Overall - good food, really good service but a little bit small and crowded.

Cozy neighborhood favorite. My burger was excellent, perfectly cooked with a side of homemade fries. The seating a little uncomfortable but it's a small price to pay IMO you can't get quality non chain restaurants just anywhere and I'm happy to support this favorite.

Brandt's is undoubtedly the best burger joint in Palatine. Not just because of the awesome burgers and "you got your money's worth" drinks, but they treat every customer there like they are family. Every time I go in there before I even sit down the bartender says "the usual?" And Even though they ask me how I'd like my burger cooked each time I order it, I'm sure they already know. When ordering, they are so particular about how you'd like your burger even going as far as asking if you would or would not like lettuce, tomato, grilled or raw onion. They'd rather take the time to ask customers instead of you waste your time picking off what you don't want. All of this has been the Brandt's tradition since it has been there. Anyway I give 5 stars to a place that no doubt deserves it!
Cool joint to just hang out at. Food and beers are decent. But watch out for that burger, it can be a slippery mess to eat.

Go for the 5 pack of sliders. Better than the regular burger. Ask for your fries to be crispy or they can be mushy. The ribs are really good and paired with some deep fried shrimp; really really good!

The food is good, known for their burgers! Although the Tee shirt sales seemed to stress our waitress out a bit. It was before they started getting busy.  Too bad they don't have a small display case there you can see what they had.

Best burgers in Palatine or the vicinity. Period. Since the reopen, the quality of the service went WAY up, too. The new butter bun is incredible, and they're always cooked to perfection. 

Other things we've ordered have been just fair...like the boneless wings, mac & cheese or the pretzel appetizer.  But the burgers bring tears to my eyes they're so good...every time.
Awesome food with great service. Had their Buffalo chicken wrap and loved it. I will be back.

Simply updated decor and remodeled 'wine room' makes Brandt's of Palatine a 'new' old favorite! 
The sliders on the appetizer menu are a nice touch for people looking to get that classic Brant's flavor in a smaller portion.  Sweet Potatoe fries are a nice addition to the newly updated menu. 
The bar scene is still the same, Tommy and all... and that's a good thing! 
Service is excellent! 
Can't wait for them to *hopefully* expand!

The burgers here are the best around. Aside from it being small with tightly packed seating, this place is kick ass. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is cozy. Waitress was very nice and our group felt very welcomed. Highly recommend to anyone who has driven by but hasn't stopped in.
One of the best burgers I've had! Small place so get there early. Worth the wait tho.

Brandt's is an OLD family favorite....The burgers were outstanding...good old fashioned juicy burgers.  Wine and beer selection was good...the Wine I had was very nice just a little high priced for a location like this. The only reason we didn't put a 5 start...was the service.  Waitress was nice, but felt she was rushing us at one point and forgot us at another.  Not a reason to never go back though....look forward to the next time!

I can honestly say brants has the best burger in the Chicagoland area and yes I've had kumas. It's small and a bit cramped inside but the service is good and the staff are friendly. Get a pretzel bun and I like the sweet potato fries. A bit pricey but worth it.

By far the best burgers in the suburbs. They are cooked to order so it takes some time for them to come out, no problem, this is not a fast food restaurant. The atmosphere is cozy but crowded, you have to keep in mind that this is a historic building. But the food is delicious, I tried the fries and other appetizers and wasn't disappointed a bit. The drinks are generous in size and not overpriced. Service is good but not the best, they seem to be able to get the food out in the right time but don't seem to always be able to keep the beverages replaced. This issue would never keep me from going back, definitely a must try.

Went to Brandt's in Palatine last night. Arrived at 7:15 got a table at 7:50. No problem there, there is usually a bit of a wait. Ordered right away. 8:45 and no food in sight. I did however notice that carry-out orders were "flying" out of the kitchen in record speed. At this point 6 tables were occupied but none had received their meal. When I noticed a party of 7 seated across from us, 45 minutes earlier, still had not received their food I knew something was amiss. One member in our party ordered pretzels which took 30 minutes to arrive. At 8:50 we asked for our check as we had no desire to wait any longer for our food. Just as we were about to leave our waitress told us our food would arrive at any minute. Too late. We told Jodie- the manager on duty of our dissatisfaction and she was very apologetic and professional but had no explanation for the delay. We have been patrons of Brandt's for 35 years and have never experienced this. My question is who's decision was it to fill all the carry -out orders before the people actually sitting in the restaurant?

Classic palatine staple.  Like being in a north woods tavern.  New owners have put lots of $ into upgrades, but old charm still there . Great burgers, solid food, excellent bar, great prices and happy helpful service .  Can't wait to see if they add outdoor seating.  Must stop by

I went get a burger, but i am not eating wheat or dairy.I ordered the burger with grilled onions lettuce and tomato. The waitress was super generous with the lettuce leaves and the tomato. I made lettuce wraps with the burgers. The burger was perfectly cooked. Thank you to my waitress who made my bun less burger experience worth a return trip soon

I finally visited Brandt's after they reopened with a slightly different name (Brandt's of Palatine instead of Brandt's Little Cafe).  Upon entering, I noticed that there was very little change from the last time I was here, which is good because I loved the character of the little cafe.  The downstairs area looks like it was the most renovated, now there's a TV & a few high top tables with stools compared to what appeared to be maybe a total of 2 tables before.  

They used to have a small illuminated board with a few menu items, now they have a regular menu which has a lot more choices than before which was a much needed change.  Their burgers haven't changed which is phenomenal, but now they give you some choices to go along with your burger.  Each one comes with 2 sides, you can choose from fries, chips, sweet potato fries, cole slaw. mac & cheese, veggies & maybe 1 or 2 other things.  You can also pick which kind of bun you want, I opted for the pretzel but found that it was tougher to bite through than your typical buttered bun.  The fact that they added a whole appetizer section to their menu makes me want to stop in, have a few drinks at the bar/downstairs & order some appetizers instead of a full blown meal like I've been accustomed to.  Make sure to check out the historical significance of the building when you're reading the menu, it's a trip to picture this place back in the prohibition days!

I come here just for the burgers. The restaurant is very small and the noise from the bar carries over. Despite this, the Brandt's burger is just too good to pass up. It comes with a myriad of bun and cheese selections, and the fries it comes with are delicious. Very reasonably priced for the large portion. I'd recommend the Brandt's  burger on a pretzel bun with American cheese, and the homemade fries.
One of the best burgers I've had! Small place so get there early. Worth the wait tho.

Brandt's is an OLD family favorite....The burgers were outstanding...good old fashioned juicy burgers.  Wine and beer selection was good...the Wine I had was very nice just a little high priced for a location like this. The only reason we didn't put a 5 start...was the service.  Waitress was nice, but felt she was rushing us at one point and forgot us at another.  Not a reason to never go back though....look forward to the next time!

Their burgers haven't changed which is phenomenal, but now they give you some choices to go along with your burger.  Each one comes with 2 sides, you can choose from fries, chips, sweet potato fries, cole slaw. mac & cheese, veggies & maybe 1 or 2 other things.  You can also pick which kind of bun you want, I opted for the pretzel but found that it was tougher to bite through than your typical buttered bun.  The fact that they added a whole appetizer section to their menu makes me want to stop in, have a few drinks at the bar/downstairs & order some appetizers instead of a full blown meal like I've been accustomed to.  Make sure to check out the historical significance of the building when you're reading the menu, it's a trip to picture this place back in the prohibition days!

I come here just for the burgers. The restaurant is very small and the noise from the bar carries over. Despite this, the Brandt's burger is just too good to pass up. It comes with a myriad of bun and cheese selections, and the fries it comes with are delicious. Very reasonably priced for the large portion. I'd recommend the Brandt's  burger on a pretzel bun with American cheese, and the homemade fries.

Got Brandt's to-go tonight.  It was delicious!  Even after the drive home the fries were still crispy!  That's an accomplishment for take out. The only reason I'm giving only 4 stars is because I would like to see a little more diverse menu.  What we had was delicious, but we had to compromise on our food choices.

I've been going to Brandts Little Cafe for years and was heartbroken when they closed their doors...

But now that they have reopened, my heart has been mended.  The food is excellent with great new additions to the menu.  My personal weakness are the sweet potato fries.  They are KILLER.... and addicting!

The new owners did the place justice!!! It's hard to change a regular's place and make them like the place more.  My entire family are regulars now... three generations brought up on Brandt's.  Have to love a place that can make the whole family happy!

You have to check them out for classic pub food with some surprising twists.

I used to go to Brandt's at least once a week for lunch, but although the quality of the food is the same, since they re-opened I'm always afraid to.  It seems that the kitchen now is always really slow.  I only have 1 hour for lunch so I give them a try about once a month to see if they have fixed the problem and today was the day.  I just ordered the hamburger which is what they are famous for and it took 40 minutes to get the food.  It's a burger not a 7 course meal.  That means I had to eat it too fast so that I could get back to work.  Val kept my glass of tea full, and kept telling me it would be soon, but waiting 40 minutes for a burger means it is going to be awhile before I go back again.

Nice to have a great burger place close by.  The new owners have fixed up the place but kept the old charm,  At our table we tried burgers, chili and ribs - all were excellent.  Must order the home made chips on the side.

Had lunch at Brandt's yesterday.  Food was excellent and the place looks pretty much as it did before the new owners took over.  Was with a friend and we both had the Brandt burger..just as good as before.  Also had the fresh chips with ranch dressing...prefect with my burger.  The new owner, Walt came over to see if everything was OK which was cool.  Price was right and there is something good about supporting a local business.

I have been here 2 times now and I really really enjoy it. 
St Charles Place is your classic simi formal steakhouse. It has a candle lit atmosphere and present background music to really set the mood.

Service is always fast, professional, and on top of things. 

Each time we go we are in a large group and each one of us really enjoys our meals. Everything is presented well and the TASTE IS INSANE. I live in Chicago and have been to some "snooty" steak houses and they don't compare to St Charles Place.

All in all, keep doing what you are doing St Charles Place.

Was in area and stopped in for Dinner..
The host was super friendly and we waited only a few minutes.
The decor is so cool...beautiful! We loved the music too..a nice mix
of standard and current hits.
My husband had the calamari which was really good..
Hot Rolls were to die for..and the baked clams delicious!
We both had Filets perfectly cooked..with a delicious potato..
we were too full for dessert but next time..
We will be back..really great night!!

This place was recommended for our work Christmas party, so I thought I'd try their dinner. The outside is awful. If it wasn't so highly recommended, I wouldn't have even came in. Inside, however, is absolutely gorgeous! The wood atmosphere is very cozy. Dan was our waiter. He was very attentive and was psychic a few times (I think about a refill and there he was with another drink). We ordered onion rings (tasty!) and the crab cake (too wet, wouldn't order it again). We were served hot rolls and a big square of butter :-) I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo (extremely buttery) with cream of spinach soup (itty bitty bowls) and hubs had the 16 oz prime rib with fries (prime rib was good, very tender). Bill was $92. Not worth it, in my humble opinion. Not sure if I want our company party here ...

Have been to st. Charles Place more than a handful of times. Wonderful Burger steak drinks. St. Charles Place is wonderful for special occasions my wife took me there for our anniversary and I devoured the prime rib all 40 ounces of it can't wait to do it again.
Really great place, I love the Prime RIb here.  Everything I've had has been very good to excellent. I make a trip here at least once per month.  Friendly staff and lovely fancy place.

I've driven past this place a thousand times but it wasn't until my parents invited me out to dinner that I had the opportunity to eat here. I was impressed. The decor is lovely, the ambiance it sets is warm and inviting. 
My dirty martini was spot on (for some reason, other bartenders can't seem to get the perfect pour) with large blue cheese stuffed olives that rocked. 
I ordered Beef Bordelaise from the specials menu and it was one of the best I've ever had. Meat was a perfect MR and it was seasoned well. The plate was piped with mashed potatoes and the sauce...oh em gee...awesome. The rest of our party of 5 loved their meals, too.
Most entrees were between $25-35 with the exception of the burgers that were slightly less and had at least 8-10 options to choose from.
I think I'm going to have to convince the 'rents to take me here for dinner more often!

Impressed by the prime rib.... The filet mignon medallions had an amazing sauce to it but unfortunately it was a tad over cooked and very dry. It did take us a long time to get out food so make sure you aren't rushing when you come here! 

Warm (really oven fresh and hot) bread rolls were soft and fluffy.

This place is very outdated. We had to move tables 3 times due to comfort. The seat cushions in the booth were horribly uncomfortable.  The staff was friendly and the food was decent....Nothing to brag about though. I guess I didn't understand what the fuss was all about...

First time here, even though we have lived in area for 21 years. We purchased a Groupon and made a dinner reservation. What a great move, the resturant is  in great shape, a real throw back to a great style that has been lost in the present day translation. The service was great and the food fantastic. Our server, Katrina, was perfect, helpful and made great recommendations. We will definitely be back and place this resturant in our regular rotation . Thank you for a very enjoyable evening.

Seriously, wheres the 6th star? I will describe my overall experience here as "INCREDIBLE!" On a Friday night after enjoying wine festivities at the Wine Exchange, our friends insisted that we try this place. The outside is as described in some reviews, very simple. We walked in and the ladies all left me and went to the restroom, that left me in the lobby by myself; the inside was anything but "simple". I stood there looking around at the retro decor, trying to figure it out, busy but beautiful; I would not change a thing. I turned to my right and looked into the bar and there sat a rather friendly man waving me over, I declined and said I was waiting for my party, he shrugged it off. Our group got back together, and as the hostess was walking us to our table, the guy at the bar called over the hostess....turned out he was the owner...oops. He directed her where to seat us. We got amazingly personal service, this guy made our experience unforgettable. I am a simple meat and potatoes guy, a career firefighter, not an educated foodie, but they went to great lengths to make sure we left as foodies. The steak, pecan pie dessert and cognac I had were amazing. I can't say enough about this restaurant, its owner and staff. We shall return as soon as possible, believe that.

St. Charles Place is a favorite of the old folk around the area. It's supposed to be a date-night quality place with intimate lighting and booth seating, but it just comes off as old fashioned with a touch of dingy. With dated decor and a safe Americana menu, you could do better if you're looking for steak, but you could also do a lot worse.

I went to St. Charles Place this past Monday (Half Price Burger Night). It is a steakhouse as well as a banquet hall.

We arrived at 7:45 P.M. for our 7:30 P.M. reservation. The restaurant wasn't packed but it wasn't completely empty. My party was seated in a very secluded part of the facility.

The dim lighting and old fashioned 'vibe' the restaurant gave off was comforting. I knew that St. Charles place had existed but I had no idea what it was or how big it was inside. My mom mentioned that it was akin to an old supper club (she's not even that old but older than me).

St. Charles Place features standard steakhouse fare; steaks, seafood, pasta, sandwiches, and burgers. They have some unique appetizers and specialties such as Steak Tartare and Roasted Duck.

I ordered a bowl of the French Onion Soup to start off. It was extremely cheesy and I enjoyed it. It was a bit overpriced for $8.99; probably a $4.99 value. 

For my entre, I ordered the 11 oz. Filet with a garden salad and Italian vegetables. As one can see in my photo, the steak was served topped with an onion ring and side of mushrooms! My steak was cooked perfectly to a medium too. The garden salad was pretty small, but the balsamic vinaigrette with the salad was actually the best vinaigrette I'd ever had! As for the sides, well, they were excellent as well. Not over seasoned, either!

I expected to pay a high price for my meal ($38 plus soup), but I was very satisfied with the meal. Why not five star? The service at STC place was average at best. The waitress was nice, but she disappeared at various points during the night. Also, I don't know if is policy, but she never refilled our waters; only the busboys did it. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience here. They are known for their Ribeye (seen on Chicago's Best). If the service improves the next time I'm here, I will give them a nice bump.

Great restaurant, good service, awesome food.
Reasonable pricing, highly recommend it!

Recently took a trip to saint charlie's place for a birthday.  The food itself was delicious, and although it was expensive and service was slow, the steak au poivre alone was enough to deserve 4 over 3 stars.  I would give it 3.5 if I could. 

Food- We decided to skip apps since it was pricey and it took a long time for the waitress to come take our drink orders.  So straight to dinner.  I had the steak au poivre and holy balls it was good.  The steak was cooked perfectly to medium, the mashed potatoes were creamy and prepared steakhouse style with the skins in them, great asparagus, and that cognac sauce.  Tasted like my grandmas champagne gravy and that is the highest grade of compliment I can give.  Would recommend this dish to anyone.  Warning: don't order the kids steak.  My ten year old brother cut it in half, but I could have eaten it in one bite, and it was fifteen bucks.  

Service- Nice but slow.  Forgivable because of how busy they were.  

This restaurant definitely has a lot to work on, but because of the amazing steak, I'm giving it four stars.  I would highly recommend for special occasions, but otherwise there are less expensive options.

Nice place great host excellent waiter steak perfectly cut but no flavor. 32oz of flavorless meat. Looked like a million bucks tasted like 9 bucks. Not even a hint of seasoning or marinade. Came with mushrooms but they had no taste either. Go to Perry's in oak brook order a steak bring it to your chef and tell him to season it. It's a waste of perfectly cooked meat. It's a shame. The place could be a go to but for a steakhouse its lacking.

I am from Lisle-- I ventured out this way Feb 2016 for my wedding anniversary.  I read reviews and the menu before dining.  My husband had remember this place from the TV show "Chicago's Best".    
I had a special, Filet and Lobster-- both to die for!
Husband had the large Filet-- very very good!
We were impressed with the food and ambiance, we will be back soon!

I've been to this restaurant several times each time the food is amazing and the service is friendly quick and very attentive.
I get the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken every single time I go there it's hard when you find something good at a restaurant to switch to something else because you know what you order is going to be good. It is large portions so bring a hungry stomach when you come to the store because the portions are big! The environment  and the  decore is amazing it's very comfortable, you can be casually dressed or Bring your prom party to the place it's a good fit for either way!

I seem to sit in the same booth each time I dined there and get the same server and he is very attentive very quick very kind good conversation but takes care of his customers!

A family gathering at St Charles Place was planned by my brother for a "bon voyage" meal for my snowbird mother and her husband who were leaving in a few days for southern climes. Ugh. My wife and I were obliged to attend, but having eaten at St Charles Place several times in the last few years, my expectations were low. Let's just say our experience was "Below Expectations".

There are many great steak houses in Chicago. If any of them were nearby this place would be put out of business. Benny', Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Capital Grille, and Sullivan's all put St Charles Place to shame. And local steak joints such as Harvest, Fox Fire, and Rox City Grill - that maybe aren't at the same level as those listed above - are still light years ahead of St Charles Place. So when Thom, the troglodyte owner, pissed me off, I decided my fellow Yelper's should be warned. Here's the run down:

* The decor is dated, and not in a good way, but it's hard to tell because it's so dark, making it difficult for the mostly elderly patrons to read their menus. 

* Yes, this is blue hair food. Meant for the blue-blockers crowd who like it better than the drivel they serve at the Alzheimer care facility. The Yelper's who gave 4 or 5 star reviews must not be let out of the home very often, as they clearly have no idea how great a modern american steak house can be. 

* If you like large slabs of meat of unknown provenance, they do that here, though not cooked or seasoned with any apparent skill. Of the 7 meals served at our table, the prime rib looked to be the safest choice in the event that you too are pressed into service at a family obligation at this establishment.

* The Minestrone soup was mostly salt water with a few remnants of withered vegetable parts and a day old crouton. Get a salad instead and hope they don't screw up the salad dressing like they did for my brother.

* I had the special, which was supposed to be "Filet tips in a red wine sauce". It was more like horse meat in canned gravy. Meh! I gave the leftovers to my brother. He took one bite the next day and threw them out.

* I asked for the "Filet Tips" to be served over fettuccine instead of over mashed potatoes, but was told there were no substitutions. The waitress was not rude about it, and to be fair, they honored my request without much resistance. But seriously - I'm the customer, I am at your place of business, spending my hard earned cash, and I am asking for the food to be prepared the way I want it, so I can enjoy eating it, yet the policy of the house is "No Substitutions". This is your fault Thom.

* Another Thom issue - He loaded all the tables in our waitresses section simultaneously. As a result, our waitress was overwhelmed, so it took two painful hours to finish our meal. Our reservations were at 6, but by 7:25 we hadn't gotten our main courses yet. I'm not sure why I was surprised, as the slow pace of service is typical at this establishment. 

* The music was so loud I couldn't hear the other people at our table. Don't get me wrong, I love loud music and usually the louder the better, but not at a restaurant while I'm trying to engage in conversation with my family at a large table. So I requested that the music be turned down. The waitress warned me that Thom would probably not cooperate with my request, and true to her word, Thom changed the channel to a less raucous radio station, but didn't lower the volume. He then came to our table said that he had changed the channel, but ignored me as I tried to engage him to repeat my request. Thom, I didn't ask for you to change the channel, I asked you to turn it down. You purposefully ignored my request and pissed me off, so I hope you like your new Yelp review just as much as I enjoyed eating your horse meat.

And before you go fire another waitress like you did after other bad reviews, remember you're the owner Thom. It's all your fault that your restaurant sucks. You need to fix everything except the bread, and then go fire yourself so somebody who understands customer service can take over as maitre d'.

We were "walk-ins" last night (Saturday) and although the restaurant was busy we couldn't have been more welcomed. We really only wanted a light supper and ordered the steak salad. It was beautiful to look at, tasted great and the service couldn't have been better. Sarah was our wattress and although busy, made time to chat since it had been awhile since we had been in. She cheerfully accepted our "Groupon" and let us know she was glad we had come back! We live in St. Charles and although we do love different restaurants we enjoy St. Charles Place as we always feel "at home". We will be back

8/25/2015 My wife and I enjoy coming here occasionally for the ambiance in the lounge and the good food. The service has been consistently unpleasant the last few times. I'm not sure who the older angry lounge server is, but she has some anger issues. After waiting at a bar table for 10 minutes I finally went to the bar itself asking who our server might be. She snapped at me "I am! I'll be right there". The lounge was not overly busy - and we are patient people.

She finally came over and asked us what we wanted to drink. It was a couple of martini's. She came back with the drinks - set them down without a word and she was gone. We wanted to eat as well.  So now I have to go back up to get some menus. The general rudeness persisted, culminating with our expensive appetizers being more or less dropped in front us, the dirty dishes not removed throughout the evening and the check silently dropped off. No thanks - nothing. The bill hovered around $130.00.

The food is great - hand down. The martini's are delicious. The service though for the last two times was so bad - it breaks my heart to move on. It's a wonderful looking restaurant and a great place for a quiet busy couple to relax, however lousy service just puts a little back rain cloud over everything. If we were treated even average, this would be a 4 or 5 star review.

Update: After reading previous reviews I think we had Amanda as well. Our wife and I will try again and if she is gone and the service is where it needs to be for a restaurant of this caliber I will certainly adjust the review.

Disappointed in the service. Our sever Amanda was short, disrespectful and borderline offensive with her demeanor. 

While the food was yummy, steakhouses should pride themselves in more than just the quality of their beef. After all, in Chicagoland there are well over 100 different steakhouses. Go to Chamagaucha, Benny's, Morton's or Gibsons. The staff there truly values the customer, which makes the quality of a fantastic meal even better. 

I will not be back.

This is such a great place.  Doesn't look like much from the outside, but definitely a hidden gem.  Old school supper club style with a definite eclectic Chicago feel. Our server, Katrina was very helpful with pinpointing the house specialties, we ended up ordering the shrimp cocktail for appetizer (the best I've had in Years) and the filet aupoire and prime rib for dinner.  Both dinners came with choice of side dish and soup (take notice of the new England clam chowder) or salad (house made dressings).  We had no room for dessert but the offerings looked incredible.  We will definitely be back.  This must be one of the areas best kept.  secrets

The terrible service last night left a bad taste in my mouth it nearly muted out the great potential the food had at St Charles Place.  My date and I arrived around 8pm Monday night.  It took about 10 minutes for us to be assigned a waitress, who eventually came around and said, what would you like to drink?  No welcome or nothing.  

Examples of bad service:

Never asked us if our food was to our liking 

The first martini my date ordered had blue cheese olives when he specifically asked for regular olives and the second martini had no olives

I was having a deep conversation with my date and the waitress yelled at me from two tables down and asked if I needed something then walked to our table and told me I had a facial expression like I needed something (huh?) 

Didn't offer us dessert and instead gave us the check,  we asked if we could have dessert and she said oh yeah sorry kitchen is closed you guys are actually my last table we closed the kitchen long ago...  What?  Why didn't you tell us? 

Stayed by our table to get the check and watched us leave the tip and stated she needed to do her paperwork 

In between all of this she was practically throwing our plates when she put them on our table and when she would ask us if we needed anything she would walk away as she was asking.  Ughhhhh..  Now I get when people say they wouldn't return to a restaurant with bad service no matter the food.  Ambience,  food,  quirkiness,  all was muted out by one very inhospitable waitress. 

Unacceptable.

$130 down the drain.  
NEVER returning,  I would rather go to chipotle across the street.

We went to St. Charles Place for our company Christmas party. We had 25 guests. They have an area in the dining room that is just perfect for a party of this size. We had the hot meatball appetizer as well as the baked clams. They were spectacular. Its amazing to me how all of our entrees came out hot and everyone said that their dinner was delicious. The service was unbelievable. Everyone wants to go back next year. Happy Holidays! See you next year.

I went to St. Charles Place for the 1st time because I had purchased a Groupon. I was having dinner with my friend, who had also never been there.  Dan was our server and he did an excellent job!  He was friendly, entertaining & prompt. Great service!  He knew the menu well and helped me decide what to order!  He highly recommended the Prime Rib, which the very friendly man who seated us also recommended.  Being a red meat lover I decided to take their advise. I ordered the "Skinny" portion, which was the smallest portion available. It was SOO DELICIOUS!!  The flavor was AMAZING!! It was tender & juicy!  It was the BEST Prime Rib I have ever eaten!  And there was NOTHING skinny about it!! Huge portion!! The decor is very cool!  I loved the music they were playing, the soft lighting and the fireplace.  It was very cozy & the staff makes you feel very comfortable! I highly recommend St. Charles Place!  We will be back!!

So delicious! Went here for date night and had such a great time. We shared their steak for two. To die for!!! The chef came by and told us how he cooked it. Great old school steakhouse atmosphere. The drinks were also very good. We had a French martini and a regular martini. Very yummy! We will definitely be back.

I'm visiting from Arizona and we stopped in for a late dinner. Not only was the service superb, but the food was amazing. The filet with cognac sauce was so flavorful and delight. The owner, Tommy, stopped by our table to be sure we were well taken care of and that we enjoyed our food. I will definitely be back!

Overpriced and falsely advertised. First of all, I am from MD so maybe my standards are a bit high when ordering a "Jumbo Lump Crab Cake". However, in all of the places I have ever had a crab cake this was by far the WORST. There was nothing jumbo or lump about these overly processed, overly seasoned, fishy tasting patties. I dislike bad food but what I dislike even more is paying too much for bad food. $30 for two nearly inedible crab cakes (I was hungry and could only finish one) with terrible sour succotash on the side and a few pieces of iceberg drowning in dressing. Not worth it. Honestly you are better off at the Panera across the street.

This place has an awesome atmosphere. As Morty Seinfeld said, "Cheap fabric, dim lighting...that's what sells merchandise."

We arrived about 745 PM with our 730 PM reservation (which wasn't needed on a Tuesday night). The pictures on the wall and the menu are different. Let's just say they have a lot of character. Drinks were ordered and service was particularly slow. This wasn't a HUGE issue but it was late and some people had to be up early the next day. MONDAY NIGHT IS BURGER NIGHT BUT NO SUBSTITUTIONS (which is weird to think about...restaurants should aim to please, no?).

I bookmarked this place due to it being on Chicago's Best in February 2015. I always love when suburban places are highlighted. I try to get as many as I can.

Anyways, I ordered the 11 oz. filet mignon and it was cooked to perfection. One of the best steaks I've ever had. I haven't had that many. I don't have those "RICH PEOPLE PROBZ". This came with vegetables and a salad. Plus one gigantic delicious onion ring. 

This place is also a banquet hall so it is HUGE. It made me feel like I was in with the F. Scott Fitzgerald "Great Gatsby" crowd.

I want to go back, but I hope the service improves! Can't imagine how it is when it is busy...! THE PLACE (HAHA) to be!

We're in Bartlett so we discovered St. Charles Place online while trying to help some of our new neighbors find a sit-down place to eat in the area.  They didn't go but made a note to ourselves to try it sometime as we were intrigued by their web site and the description that it "brings back the times of the classic supper club".   It's not actually a 'supper club', but it does have that kind of vibe.  So if you're looking for a high-end steak place (like Morton's or Ruth Chris'), this won't be what you're looking for.

It was, however, exactly what we wanted and were not disappointed.  We're early diners so it wasn't crowded at all.  Piano music in the background that wasn't too loud and really liked the throwback atmosphere and the way some of the dining areas are separated a bit.  Food was good and has enough variety to satisfy most palates and price ranges.  I had the Steak Diane and my wife had the Coconut Shrimp, sharing between us.  Both entrees came on warm plates, were tasty, and had good sized portions.  The warm, fresh rolls were a nice touch, which I guess is one of the things they're known for.

We didn't have any issues with the service or staff and found them all attentive, polite, and if anything too speedy with bringing our food.  We were prepared to linger a bit longer, but our salad and soup came out almost right away and entrees followed before we were completed them.  We're not usually big desert people but got a Key Lime Pie and Carrot Cake to go.  Pie was okay (good, not great) and same for the carrot cake except that the portion was HUGE...probably enough to feed three people!

Our only quibble is that they changed the music from piano to more of a pop station which seemed out of place.  It wasn't so loud we couldn't talk (or we would have asked them to turn it down), but the piano music was a much better fit for this place which otherwise is ideal for a nice meal and conversation with friends or family.  We'll definitely be back and recommend it!

Despite having a very cranky, unfriendly waitress, I really enjoyed my experience with St. Charles Place.  I am usually not the biggest fan of steakhouses because I really dislike a la cart side dish orders on top of meat I could cook at home very easily.  We had a Groupon, which helped the price.  This place didn't feel so expensive because you get some sides along with your steak.  My husband had a standard martini, which he wasn't happy with.  I told him it was his fault b/c he didn't specify which gin he wanted, but the waitress also didn't really give him a chance to.  I had an ok glass of wine.  Overall, I think it was fine, I liked the interior of the restaurant.  It's got a whimsical feel, especially with the Christmas decorations, but I think that was our last visit.  We don't go back to restaurants very often unless they are outstanding or super close to home, and this place was neither.  I'll just say again that the waitress was pretty crabby, never introduced herself (or else I would totally be name dropping).

Great place with lots of charm and pretty good food to boot.

Just celebrate my birthday at the St Charles place steak house.  I had never been there and was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was inside.  The place has character for sure.  A big, warm fireplace, nice romantic lighting, and interesting decorations makes it very inviting and comfortable.

Our waiter was nice but seemed distracted.  He did his job and made sure we had everything we needed but really didn't interact with us anymore than that.  Which actually, sometimes is nice.

The food was excellent.  I had the filet and lobster and my girlfriend had the ribeye.  Both steaks were prepared just like we ordered them and the lobster was melt in your mouth delicious.

During our meal the manager stopped by the table to make sure we were enjoying ourselves, which I think is a really nice touch.

All in all, a great experience.  The one downside is the place is pretty pricey.  They do have items like burgers on the menu which are less expensive but if you are going to have a steak, seafood, or wine, plan on dropping some coin.

I would say St Charles place is a great place for a special occasion or a romantic date night.  The food is excellent and the ambiance is great.
If you're looking for a man sized steak get the steak for two. Pricey but it melts in your mouth!!! Beautiful atmosphere. The outside could be updated but beautiful on the inside!

Having been a long time favorite, it's sad to have negative feedback. Portions are small and cost is excessive. Our visit was a Wednesday evening and slow, yet the courses came out so fast that we couldn't finish what we were already eating. Almost like the waitress wanted to go home. It was rushed and not relaxing. Steak portions and plating are so tiny, not like I remember this place to be. No way to share a creme brulee either. The portion is that of a sample. Tastes good but way too small. By comparison you can go anywhere (Wildfire, Sullivans, Perrys, Gibsons) for a better value, quality and consistence.

The food is fresh, the service is great.  

Omg the steak and burgers.  

I love the ambience here too.  Quite romantic.

This was my second time visiting this restaurant. The owner was really cool and the service was exceptional. They go above and beyond to make sure you are happy with everything. 

The food was nothing short of perfection. I had the oysters Rockefeller and the shrimp dejongue for appetizers. The flavor of both of these were out of this world!  

For dinner, my friend and I split the 32 oz bone in ribeye and lamb chops upon the owners recommendation. We were not disappointed. They sliced the ribeye into strips for us and the whole platter was covered in mushrooms at our request. We were able to serve ourselves with tongs.  The meat was cooked exactly how we ordered it (medium-rare is definitely the way to go). Au-Jus was served with the ribeye and a lemon flavored juice with the lamb.  

I will definitely be back!
I love this food. It is top notch, way above average. I also like the supper club, country club ambiance. Service is always great.

Food was delicious and service was fine. I am, however, disappointed that the only unlocked door was a revolving one. These are not handicapped accessible. Nobody saw us trying to open the other doors. Only after we mentioned this did we get an apology and were told it is ok to unlock them to let her in. It is simply unacceptable to make a person with a handicap wait outside while another person in their party enters the restaurant and tries to figure out how to open a door that they can go through.

Overall a disappointing experience for us.
