We went here since we got a Groupon deal, and we always love some good steaks.  Upon driving up to the restaurant, the HUGE sign by the road for the restaurant seemed outdated and tacky.  Once we entered the restaurant, we waited for about 5 minutes before the hostess showed up.  I told her the name we made our reservation under, she asked rudely:" What the name?"  So I had to tell her again.  Once we were shown to our table, she put the menus down and walked away quickly, her parting words were:" Sort them out yourselves." I guess she meant that we should sort the menus out ourselves.  Anyway, the first impression was poor.  We didn't really feel welcomed since there was no smile and warmth from the hostess at all.  

We waited about 10 minutes before our waitress showed up.   She took our drink order and then disappeared for another 10 minutes before I saw her near our table again.  I told her we are ready to order, she told me she would be right back.  Once she was back, she was perfectly nice and professional.  We were fine with her service from then on.

The food was mediocre.  The beef veg soup was way too salty, tasted like leftover soup from yesterday.  My son was happy with his cheeseburger, but we have had better steaks elsewhere.  The green beans was overcooked, and the mashed potato was blend.  

The entire place seems to stuck at 1980s', from its decoration to the food preparation.  

For a $85 check, we didn't feel like we've got our money worth, even with the Groupon deal.  We will not be back.

We were a group of 13 and very well taken care of.  Everyone enjoyed their food. Among favorites: Prime Rib, Shrimp DeJonghe, NY Strip, Burgers, etc (cognac peppercorn sauce was awesome). Stiff drinks and a great waiter too!

Sat promptly, clean, excellent service. Good food and very fresh, Was in, sat, fed, and out within an 1hr15mins. 

Crab cakes tasty and moist, shrimp cocktail zesty and fresh, 32oz Rib eye (split for 2) covered in mushrooms, 2 sides and 2 side salads. Plus one glass of wine.  Total $107.
A tad expensive for us but excellent choice for our anniversary meal.

Decor a tad cheesy (red antlers over fake fire and leopard print chairs) tho I think that's the feel of the place.  low lighting (tough to see menu) similar to a supper club, guy who greeted us at door was a lil sweaty (oops thats the owner)
. 
So all n all very pleasant experience and would give it 9/10 and would go back.

I've been here several times and the food and service is typically middle of the road ..but since I live literally right down the street it's very convenient.  I'm a huge burger fan so I wanted to one of there's but was really disappointed by their egg burger and oily fries.  In addition to the bogus burger experience I was floored by the some of the bad attitudes of the staff and the lack of interest by the manager.  Sadly I probably won't be returning.

I have been here twice. The first time, I went with my wife. We went at the last minute - and it appeared to be busy. We were seated in the "private room" -- towards the front of the restaurant. Food was good. My wife had the burger and I had the prime rib. Prime rib was great - no fat on it. The saganaki was OK but I would pass. A bit pricey, but we had no complaints. However, I wasn't too impressed with the restaurant(see below). The private room takes away from the ambiance of the place. It's huge, and you don't get to enjoy any of the decor when you're tucked away in that room.

So Yesterday May 8th 2016 My wife and I took our son with my parents for a Mother's Day dinner. I called in on the 4th for a reservation. The guy on the phone was EXTREMELY rude (i've seen this mentioned in other reviews too. Can't be a coincidence). He told me the only time available was 4:30 or 6:30. Since we had a little one with us, we went with the 4:30. That's fine. A little early but better for our son.

So we show up. Go figure, the restaurant is empty, and they try to shove us in the "private room." I objected, was given a dirty look, and then seated at a table. Then I realized how awesome the decor in this place was. And how large the actual restaurant really is. Our waitress was fine. She did a good job. But......there was a limited menu. I mean very limited. Which is fine. But, not everyone at our table was in the mood for a $30 entree. It would have been nice if they told us on the phone that they had a limited menu for mother's day. Other restaurants would do that. Even the kids menu only had two options. I felt kind of scammed. It was like they were trying to keep the quality high by offering a small menu, but also capitalize on it in terms of a money standpoint. You think they would have offered some sort of sandwiches. All of the food was good. But the prime rib was better the last time I went. This cut had a lot of excess fat and un-edible portions on it. Based on the price and the miniature sides I received, i'm not sure if I would order the prime rib again.

I will probably give this place another try. We like the decor. And the proximity to our house in Wayne. And the servers have all been nice. But for the price I would expect a little bit more.

I came back w my parents the other night because we have always enjoyed great restaurants and we were not disappointed. My parents are older don't eat as much as they used to so when dad ate a good portion of his steak tonight that is huge.

We sat down and my parents were as impressed w the dcor and roominess of the area we were in. We ordered drinks and were able to enjoy them casually because the waitress, Sherrie, gave us plenty of time. Dad ordered the NY Strip, mom had the 10oz prime rib and I had the rack of lamb served double cut. My mom and I enjoyed the cream of spinach soup & dad had the salad w bleu cheese toppings. A lot of bleu cheese. 

The steaks were done as requested w fresh mushrooms on the NY Strip and nice pinkness on the prime rib w a horseradish dressing on the side. My lamb was very good w a decoratedly cut lemon in the accompanying au jus.

Anybody who complains about the dcor is nuts which we were quite comfortable. We all wished that St Charles wasn't so far away because we would be regulars. The drinks were great and we appreciated the bartenders "loose" arm.

Also appreciated Sherrie's fine service.

Looks like nothing special from the outside but just awesome on the inside. Really a great atmosphere and ambiance. Great service and the best steak Ive had in ages. I recommend the prime rib and the Filet. Celebrated our 23 year anniversary and they really took care of us and we are sure glad we went there. Big thumbs up. Thom was also very accommodating at the front desk and our waitress was fantastic. Look forward to going back and turning some friends on to this place.

I love coming here! One of my favorite places to relax and enjoy and good steak.  Tom, the owner, greats you at the door. The ambiance is second to none.  His staff is well trained, you will not be disappointed.  All his food on the menu is exceptional, but I always come back to the ribeye with mushrooms.  Tom is the best!  Come visit, you will not be disappointed!!!
I have been here several times and ger the chateaubriand, it has always been very good, never seem to be able to quite finish it. Service always good as well.

St. Charles Place has great food, no doubt.  However, the hostess could leave a lot to be desired.  We went for an early dinner on a Saturday, and when we entered into the restaurant, there was no one at the front to greet us.  As we made our way further into the restaurant, we were approached by the hostess who was rude and short.  I would have given it a much higher rating, but the hostess was that rude that a month later I still remember the experience.  Due to this, I personally will not be back.  The food was great, and I enjoyed the atmosphere and the waitress, but the hostess completely turned me off from this restaurant.

The food was fairly good though the cognac sauce with my steak was very salty. Our waitress was tolerant of us at best and at the end of the night  when i presented a Groupon she lectured me on how  I  should have  mentioned that upfront since one of the cocktails we ordered was a special  and you can't have special with the Groupon.  I  doubt that we will make the trip back here.  I looked more closely at the Groupon and after the restrictions about when you could use the Groupon was a list of things you couldn't use the Groupon on. That is just too much stuff for me to  keep track of.  There are just too many places with great food and service too waste my time here.

The food was ok. But I expected the cast of Bar Rescue or Restaurant Impossible to come in at any moment. This place is straight out of the 60's and needs an update in the worst way. Atmosphere is part of the experience and they fail in this regard.

My wife and I stumbled upon here after a day outing. We got right in without a reservation. We shared the Chateaubriand and it was superb. Every bit of it was done to perfection. Afterwards we talked about how this might have been the best meal out in our 24 years together. It was that outstanding. We could only eat half of it and our waitress packed the leftovers with the same care and attention that went into the meal itself. This is how restaurants should be. Wow !

We sat in the room with the giant fireplace. So pretty! I had Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo and my husband had the NY Strip Steak Au Puivre. Both our meals were awesome! We'll definitely be back! Highly recommend! Entrees aren't cheap, but the food portions are plenty!!!
Our server, Dan was amazing and the Food was great. I had the medium rare Fillet with the horseradish crust and it was divine. Tender does not describe it well enough.

Now that's stand up!!  Manager took care of the small issue that I had...therefore,  I'm upping my Yelp status to 5 stars....which this place deserves!!

Ford, GM, Chrysler take note.  This is how to properly handle a problem. Identify it, fix it, and let your customer know that it's been done! !

To  the Mgr of the St. CHARLES: THANKS FOR THE OFFER TO RETURN OUR TIP. You took care of the problem and that's all I can ask! Let the server keep it. She earned it and probably would have received more as we really enjoyed our night there!!

Great job!! And a great place to have dinner in St Charles! !

Great food, great service, friendly, and a beautiful and unique restaurant!!!  It is very large inside and there is plenty of room to sit and relax.  They will give you plenty of time to sort through the menu and place your order.  I also really enjoyed the decor of this place....it had a sort of woodsy, rustic, and artsy feel all going on at the same time.  I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a great steakhouse with awesome service and character.

St. Charles Place is one of the Best steaks and prime rib I have ever had the place is beautiful the people are great the servers are awesome everybody's kind and polite Tom the owner is just listening and taking care of you we go there for special occasions you pay for what you get and the money is well worth paying for what you get good food for what you pay for I definitely give them a FiveStars plus I've never had a bad meal there and it is a great place to go to so at least give it a try once and I guarantee you you will always want to go back and try there Monday night half price burger night it's the best hamburger you've ever had I highly suggest anyone who wants a great meal to go there and really go there and enjoy yourself it is great for the money and time and Katrina in at all the people there are great so go there and have a good time thanks Donna G

A bit too high priced to get a 5 star out of me - though everything was pretty darn good. The staff were good, selection was good, parking - bla bla bla. What really let me down was the inability for the staff to excel here and turn this solid 4 star into a 5! I believe what really holds it back is the price - without expert service - and a tad better tasting food - this one will remain a 4 until I return for another try. But folks - 4 stars on the first visit is quite impressive - please stop by and give it a try!

Went here for my fiances birthday dinner on 12/13/15. Sat down at 7:10 pm and ordered some drinks and apps, apps were out right away and as were the drinks. Apps were pricey, but were good. Put our order in at 7:35 pm for our entrees, fiance ordered filet mignon and I order a steak burger that they were known for according to the menu. Finish our apps around 7:45 and dishes taken away. At 8:20 we were still waiting for our dishes to come out and the waitress comes out and apologizes that they had a group of 50 that they were serving in the back. I'm sure the group of 50 had reservations and the restaurant should know how to staff the restaurant accordingly. Finally our meals come out at 8:35 pm (50 minutes since we last ate), fiances filet mignon was good and the steak burger wasn't impressive at all. Total meal was around $140 for the 2 of us for the dinner. We were the youngest couple in the restaurant, we just think this place is full of old timers who want to spend their money. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Very disappointed since we live in Saint Charles and was looking forward to this restaurant. Won't go back.
OMG!  The absolute best steaks I've ever had. Very friendly wait staff. Kind of pricey but worth it.
Great food and service.  We split the 32 oz ribeye and was more than enough.  Meet was cooked just as requested and wait staff pleasant and attentive.

The steaks are amazing. Cooked to perfection. Dinner included bread, salad and side dish. Great value. The New York strip steak was so good. Flavorful and juicy. We got shrimp cocktail as appetizer and they were delicious. The dcor was unique and I felt relaxed with the dim lighting.  I have gone hear three times since we moved to St. Charles almost two years ago. Will be going back again and again.
3 stars only because it's like a retirement home in there but the food is real good. Burgers are the best in the area. Food gets 4 stars.

I've driven by this place a number of times, and was recently invited to attend a special event here- so this review is really only for special events. Our group hosted an event with just over one hundred people. We had a buffet of appetizers and desserts only- and it was wonderful. They had numerous options for apps, all of which were delicious. My table mate loved the eggrolls the most, while I enjoyed the chicken fingers and the mini-cheesecake dessert. The servers were very friendly, quick, and helped the event run smoothly. As I had such a good experience with a special event, I would certainly consider coming back her for a regular meal another time. There were a significant number of people eating here (some of whom appeared to be regulars) for a Thursday night. I will definitely give this place a try again in the future.

I was introduced here in 1998  on my first date with my husband..we have enjoyed this place for almost thirty years..at least monthly with our family our  drinks at the bar...I stopped in tonight and the new bartender was having a very nice conversation with some single man.. I did wait patiently and then it was just wtf here..totally ignored!!...this bartender was involved in a deep conversation and I just sat there!!  Finally I spoke up for myself..and was treated as if I was interrupting ..wow... I just walked out after getting my wine...who the hell would sit at a bar and be treated like that..

Me and my family went there tonight for an impromptu dinner. Had no idea that it was a nice place. Definatly should have a reservation and wear nice clothes. The service was great considering the house was full. The menu was complex and large. My cup was always full and the server was flustered at first and seemed crabby but when the rush died down she seemed happier. My food was fantastic. I ordered the meatballs for a starter. They were great. The conaq sauce was amazing. I got the 11 oz filet mignon with green beans and a garden salad. I was not very happy with the salad it seemed like it had been frozen but it was still good. The juicy delicious steak made me forget about the salad. The rolls were warm and butter was delicious. The biance of the building had a 1950s retro feel to it with incadescant lighting and lovely photos on the wall. It is warm and a very friendly but sophisticated environment.
Tom, you and your staff are wonderful. The food is amazing! Prime rib, chicken liver pate, white zin! We definitely will be back... lots of love and hugs from Iowa... Monica

Tried St. Charles Place for the first time because I saw some of the pictures on yelp. Wanted to have an evening of celebration with some friends who just opened a new business. We really enjoyed the atmosphere. The staff were friendly and efficient. We were seated in a nice quiet little corner which is nice because I requested that. The dinner was good. I ordered the monster ribeye and we split dinner - as we always do. It tasted good, very tender, but very fatty - maybe that's how it's supposed to be. I tried tomato and onion salad with blue cheese - thumbs up on that. Girlfriend had the Caesar salad and said it was good.  Four people, two drinks apiece totaled about $270 after tip. About $70 apiece. The food, while good it wasn't anything that really stood a part for me but the atmosphere was excellent! Go there if you want to celebrate an event in your life and you're not worried about saving money.
This place is a gem. Lived in stc for years and was always top of the list. Never had a bad meal. Love the dark and stormy thing.  Maybe a little pricey but I never left hungry.

Service was great. We had a very friendly server and she remained friendly even after notifying her of our Groupon :) the food is a little pricey but it was good quality and delicious. The decor is nice and I like the dim lights. Gives it a vintage elegant look. They have 1/2 price burgers on Monday! Remember to always tip your server based on the total bill before applying the Groupon or coupon :) always makes them a little happy. First time trying carrot soup and it was scrumptious! Prime rib was juicy and tender and the flaming duck we gave two thumbs up.

No not perfect, but pretty darn close. Our waitress greeted us with warm rolls. Oysters rock started dinner. Very good. The wife ordered the lobster tail. Perfectly cooked. The star of my show was the rib eye for two. It's big and tasty. I always get the one for two people since it comes with salad and two sides. And you always get enough to take some home. Twice baked potato came along also. Good service, friendly wait staff and good food at fair prices. You won't be disappointed.
The steak Au Poire filet mignon was the best I've ever had.  The atmosphere takes you back to the good old days when the Rat Pack (Frank & Dean) roamed the Vegas Strip.  Service was excellent.
I'm so confused how anyone could be impressed with the food, the service or the decor. Terrible service terrible food. Dined here on Friday and 2 days later I'm still creeped out.

Having lived in St Charles now for roughly 8 years, I have passed by this place many times.  It always seems to be busy so I figured it must be fairly good.  

My girlfriend said the filet was "ok".  It came with a side of what I swear were canned mushrooms. I tasted them and they tasted like they were from a can. If they were not canned, then they were terribly prepared. 

I ordered crab cakes (lump) that came with a side of a spicy mayo sauce, some sort of corn mix and chef's potatoes.  The dinner also came with soup or salad. I chose the soup which was shrimp bisque.  

The soup was sort of odd. It did not taste like any bisque I've had before. 

The crab cakes were mushy.  Mushy to the point where I was questioning if they were frozen. You expect lump crab cakes to have lumps of crab not what appeared to be shredded crab.  The flavor was ok but the texture of the cakes just threw everything off.  It reminded me The side of corn blend did not mix at all with the flavor of the crab cakes. 

I dropped $70 (minus tip) on an ok petite filet with horrible mushrooms, mushy crab cakes and 2 soft drinks (which were $3.00 a piece).  Which by the way, neither of us finished eating. 

The pricing of the food does not in any way match the quality. 

I would not return.

Very, VERY disappointing! It is a treat for us to go out to dinner, and not something we can do often. I rarely complain, but the service was horrible and food was just okay. Our waitress, Christina, apparently is a family member of the owner. We ordered the ribeye for two which was very fatty. Our drinks were watered down, and the baked potato was cold.   Even the dessert tasted old and not fresh. The salad and coffee were good, however, but that's it. I feel more than anything we were shocked at the poor service and how ignored we were. Took forever to order drinks and to get our food. After dinner we were totally ignored and it took an hour to get a dessert. I told Christina, the waitress, when she finally walked by to just forget the dessert. She ignored me and then brought it. Most disappointing of all was that the waitress added her gratuity to the bill which was well over 20%. I usually tip very well, but after such poor service this would have been one of those times I'd like to control the percentage. As we were leaving I asked the hostess if it was customary for a waitress to add the gratuity for a party of just 2? She said, no it is only done for large parties, which I understood. I asked to speak to the owner and the hostess went to get him. She returned saying that even though he was there, he was too busy. Guess he was cooking. ??? Needless to say, we will not return, and I would strongly advise you not to give your business to them. Such poor service seems to be a repeating problem for them and one the owner obviously doesn't care to address. Too many other good places to support in our area.

We went there last night for the first time. From the minute we walked in the door we were blown away by the decor and ambiance! It's hard to describe but we couldn't stop looking around and everything just seemed to work. Instantly relaxed. 
We sat down for dinner and everything on the menu looked amazing. I went with the seared ahi tuna which was prepared perfectly. Hubby had the strip stead, also prepared perfectly (he likes it's rare). Our waitress was awesome and the owner Tom was personable, funny and loves what he does.  

I can't wait to go back there again!

The food was delicious! Cannot complain about that at all! Both the tomato soup & French onion were great! Prime rib was also excellent! Sad to say the service was absolutely terrible!!!!! When we walked in no one greeted us and when they did, they didn't seem too excited to walk us to our table. It was a solid 8 minutes before we were even greeted at the table! I went to the restroom, & had come back and decided on a meal before anyone had come to the table. Our server never introduced herself nor told us about any specials. If we would have known about the chateau Briand we would have ordered that instead. When our food came and one of the sides was wrong, our waitress blurted out "son of a bitch!" & then said she'd bring the correct one. From then on we didn't expect much of the service. All in all great food & atmosphere, but we got bar quality service instead of fine dining.

Awesome place!!  We went for the Thanksgiving meal and it was as wonderful as usual!!  I love everything about this place--Tom, the decor, our server Katrina, and of course the food.   The steaks are great along with the prime rib; great burgers also.  If you like your carbs, the dinner rolls are addicting.  We are always happy with the food and service when we go here.   We are so glad we found this place!!

My wife decided to take me there for dinner. We were both pretty impressed. I had the filet. It was really tender and had great flavor. It was one of the best steaks I have ever had. I would recommend going here and I'm sure we will be eating there again soon.

We tried this place for the first time the other day based on a friend's recommendation and of course, all those Yelpers!  We'd passed this place many times before and completely overlooked it.  So glad that has changed.

We loved the decor and they had quite a bit of holiday decorations mixed in as well - but not in a tacky way.  It blended well and looked very festive yet elegant.  They have a big fireplace was crackling, twinkle lights above with exposed beams...just lovely.  The perfect location for date night or a special occasion.  They have at least one private room for larger parties or events.

The only thing I felt they could improve upon (and partly why I'm holding back that 5th star) is the music.  The music simply didn't fit with the ambiance of the establishment.  I love Classic Rock but based on the type of restaurant it is and how it's more of an upscale place it just didn't go together for me.  The place seems more like they should have some Dean Martin supper-club-esque type of music playing rather than CCR.

Our server was Bill and he was such a pleasure.  Just the right amount of graciousness and fun with humor.

The food did not disappoint, either.  We both had the special, a steak dish (I forget the name), and it was so tender and delicious.  Plenty of mushrooms & sauteed onions in the delicious sauce as well...and the mashed potatoes!  Oh the mashed potatoes!  The creamy, buttery, heavenly potatoes were so elegantly presented piped around the platter with a large star tip.  It looked too pretty to eat but of course we devoured it!  The portion was also large, we both took leftovers home and will get at least one more meal each out of it.  Even the calamari we ordered was enough to feed at least 4 people as an appetizer.

We will definitely be going back and just may become our new fave for dinner!

Well the music was very loud and made talking to our 6 was not easy we asked to have it turned down.  That was a joke. The wait staff was a nightmare inattentive at best. Asking for water refills and getting a look then taking their time. We need ice teas refilled, they filled it with to much ice and very little tea and never asked if we needed more everywhere, else  I have gone for steaks at: Ruth's Chris, Mortons, Gene and Georgetti's-Chicago the service impeccable. The staff would show up briefly serve us and disappear. This restaurant needs to send the wait staff for appropriate training. The food was not up to par. I had the steak salad there was bad lettuce I asked the waitress to take it back and I was told that's the lettuce mix we have its fine. I know bad lettuce it has a smell and is very wilted. Others had fish, prime rib and filets none of us were happy with the meal. The flaming cheese was not the appropriate Greek cheese. If the food and service would have been good the pricing would have been fine. Not recommended and not going back.

This is one of our favorite restaurants.  We've never had any complaints regarding the quality of the food or level of service. The escargot is a must,  the entre's are top notch and we always save room for dessert.  Highly recommend this place to everyone.  Reservations should definitely be made for weekends.

To be honest, I've only been here once and I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon. I only came here because I had an expiring groupon that I needed to use. I've driven by this place numerous times and never knew it existed. It looks so old school and dark from the outside. Should probably revamp the place up. But I guess they are going for the old school feel since the inside atmosphere makes you feel like you're going back in time. The lighting is so dim though, and that was so annoying. 

Food was crazy expensive. For 2 people with no drinks, just 2 meals, the total ended up being $75....whoa.  My steak was alright, not worth the 32 dollar list price. My companion got the 32 dollar scallops, and yes they were big, and I understand it is seafood, but there were only 4 of them. That equates to about 8 dollars a scallop. 7 maybe if you include the mashed potatoes in there. 

My biggest complaint had to be about the service though. No offense to the guy that was waiting out table, but he was so slow. Like crazy slow. He gave us bread and never asked if we wanted more. Maybe they don't give you more, but who knows, I wouldn't since he didn't say anything. I barely got my water refilled, and that was even through a different guy, bus boy type person. The waiter gave us our food, and never came back to ask if we were doing fine or needed anything. Maybe just one time throughout the meal when obviously I was short on water like the whole time.

 Then when we finished( I literally timed this part since we were trying to catch a movie at the nearby theater), it took 40 minutes from when I asked for the check to us leaving. Like I'm just speechless. The place was not packed, so what could he have possibly been doing.

He came back when we were done and  I said we were finished and if we could have the check and a take home container. 10 min goes by, he comes back with a take home container. Another 10 minutes go by, he comes back with the check. Another 10 min goes by, he takes my credit card. Final 10 minutes go by, he gives me my card back. Ended up missing the beginning of the movie too. Not too happy with that.

So I ate here tonight to help celebrate a friend of mine's birthday. We were early for our reservation, but we're sent to the bar. There were plenty empty tables to be seen. Took to long for drinks, then our appts took just as long. We had salads coming, but the time between the appts and salad again was long.
When our dinners came, the Ribeye was over cooked, but the owner was fast in replacing. I had the Lobster Club, looked good, the bread really wasn't a good match. But there was plenty of lobster.

The decor was all over the board. You really couldn't figure out what they were trying to say.

It was my first time there. Don't think it will be on my list for a second dinning. Disappointing experience from the moment we walked in he door. Hostess who we later found out was the wife of the owner. Was less than welcoming when we walked in. First thing out of her mouth was "Do you have a Reservation?"  A more welcoming would have been "Welcome to St. Charles Place" or " Good Evening, How many in your party"

my husband and i came here and really liked the ambiance of this place (though i did think it was a little too dark). i felt that service was lacking a bit in the beginning, but got better as the night went on.  we spent a lot of money - i had the fillet medallions in a cognac sauce (their #1 special) , and my husband had the charred ribeye - another menu favorite. for the money we spent, it did not quite meet expectations-i felt my medallions were a little too dry. overall, it was very good and we will come back, but i do not think i would recommend ordering an expensive steak here. the bread pudding and goat cheese bruchetta were VERY good, and i highly recommend those items.

My sister and I went there today for an early dinner.  WHO KNEW such goodness existed in such a non-descript building.  The food was wonderful.  The server, Sherrie, was equally good.  I had the Steak Au Poivre with Filet Mignon Medallions (fabUlous)and my sister had Shrimp de Jonghe.  I am already planning on going back for the Shrimp de Jonghe dish.  

Again...WHO KNEW!  Looking forward to returning.

Great Food... really!
I love the Ambiance of this place.  So much to see and finding hidden little treasures in and about the rooms.
Very Friendly, I thought!

I will be back!

We had a wonderful experience here. Tom, the owner, was extremely hospitable and the good and service wee outstanding. Highlights were the saganaki, perfectly cooked lobster tail, steak bruschetta, and panko breaded tilapia. It is on the pricy side, but you get what you pay for. (Note: We went in March, but for some reason, my review didn't save. Thanks, Tom!)

Favorite place to go.....great for that special occasion.  Excellent Filet Mignon.  Great on atmosphere....cozy fireplace....unique bar area.....unique dcor.....Tommy (the owner) sees that all of his guests are satisfied.  Highly recommend.

I have now been here 3 times in the past year, and each time I leave happy with the meal I just had.  I normally order the filet, and it's always cooked perfectly.  Part of the reason why this restaurant is appealing is that you know you'll get a good meal no matter what you order, so it's an easy option when you can't think of anywhere else to go.  It's especially nice when it's a weekend night and you don't have reservations anywhere else in town (where a lot of restaurants are overcrowded due to lack of quality options in the St. Charles area).  

My only negative experience was with ordering a cosmo; tasted like it was made with a mix of some sort, very sweet and not enough vodka added to it....I'll stick to the wine from now on.
The ribeye for 2 dinner was excellent, you won't be disappointed. Oysters were legit. Ambiance was cool and relaxing. About $70 for a dinner for two.

It was late and we were looking for someplace to have a good meal when we saw the sign Steak House. We pulled in, simple enough looking building but much different when you get inside. We were greeted by the very friendly Tom who I assume is the manager and then by our waitress Sherri who was spectacular.

Sherri recommended a very nice wine and then let us order a Steak Diane which she was happy to split for us and without an argument.  My experience is that some restaurants are not too happy with splitting a meal so her "sure you can slit it" attitude was very welcome.  The Steak Diane was perfect and I am sure if anyone orders it they will not be disappointed.  The Creme Brule my business partner had for desert was excellent and my chocolate mousse was so good.  They don't have espresso but the Bailey's and coffee was a good compliment.

i travel to St. Charles occasionally for business and I will look forward to coming back.

I do not write Yelp reviews often.  I believe in writing quality and not quantity.  As a Restaurateur, I also only believe in writing Yelp reviews for places that I am moved by in some way.  St. Charles Place (SCP) moved me.

True Story: 1 American, 2 Italians, 2 Swiss, 3 South Africans, 1 Dutchman, 1 Belgian, 1 Turk, 1 Mexican, 1 Austrian were in the city of St. Charles for the next few weeks and wanted to celebrate an occasion - they looked online on Yelp and found St. Charles Place, to celebrate and made RSVPs.

Prior to arriving, I reviewed the web-site and was so pleasantly surprised that SCP catered to a variety of tastes.  The menu was fairly extensive in my opinion and had some very classic offerings for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.

When we arrived at SCP, I was impressed at the sheer enormousness of the place.  The current web-site does not do justice to the size of this place.  If you are looking for a place for any-sized celebration, SCP can definitely accommodate.  My group was greeted by a friendly man, by the name of Thomas - came to find out that he was the Executive Chef and Owner.  Very down to earth and funny, with a little bit of Chicago moxie mixed in.

We walked through a crowded main dining room at 8:00 pm, to the back of the restaurant, with our own private dining area.  Then appeared the goddess Athena herself, as our waitress.  Our waitress, was very friendly and commanded a very pleasant demeanor which was great for our unruly international contingent.  Owning a restaurant, I was impressed, that only 1 waitress was assigned to our table, as I observed a full team in action at the vast restaurant.

We put in our drink orders, a couple of red wines, some martinis, imported beers and a coca-cola classic for me, the party animal.

Then came the really fun part - ordering.  I ordered 5 appetizers for the motley crue.  Didn't really need too, as SCP serves so much food.  Warm bread and butter is delivered to the table and the main entrees usually come with a house salad or soup and a side.  Seriously, SCP, is not frugal in anyway.

For starters, I ordered the Coconut crusted shrimp, Goat cheese bruschetta, Maryland crab cake, Calamari and Garlic Bread.  I was so in love with the dipping sauce that the Coconut crusted shrimp came with, that I practically confiscated the sauce and told everyone that if I couldn't have all of it, that I would start an international incident at the restaurant - the look in my eyes meant that I was serious; hence, my international team allowed me to eat most of the sauce - it was phenomenal - a raspberry reduction with a hint of wasabi or horseradish.

I need to pause here to comment on the decor.  I loved it.  High vaulted ceilings with a woodsy lodge theme, with trees growing inside the restaurants, that were decorated with tiny white lights.  Gave it a rustic romantic charm.  Perfect for a date or a very nice evening with a bunch of hooligans like us.

For main entrees, the ladies ordered their demur dishes, like vegetarian pastas or fish dishes; however, for most of us, we ordered carnivorous dishes.  I ordered the Canadian Baby Back Ribs.  When my order came out, I thought, that they were surely mistaken, because my dish was huge - enough for two people and only at $23????  Surely, there was some mistake; however, the person across from me got the same and hers was just as big.  We could not stop laughing in awe on the portion size.  And the most memorable aspect of my dish was the sauce.  What is it with this place and the sauces???   They are phenomenal.  I am not ashamed to say this, I ate very primitively and with my hands and had sauce all over my mouth and literally licked the shot of sauce that came with my already drenched ribs - the sauce was that good.  I woke up this morning still thinking about it.

After dinner, the crew ordered desserts and coffees as well as after dinner drinks like Frangelico.  The mousse and turtle pie were good.

What made the experience really memorable was the hospitality.  I told the waitress how much fun we were having and she liked hearing that.  Later, I can't remember how it was disclosed, but it turned out our waitress was part owner and the sister-in-law of Thomas, the Executive Chef.  Shortly before we closed our tab, Thomas came over to our table and chatted with us briefly.  I thanked him for a wonderful time and told him his food was awesome.

Being a restaurateur, I know what it takes to run a restaurant.  It is not for the faint hearted.  The glamor, glitz and lifestyle that you think we restaurateurs have, is just a very nice romantic allusion.  The truth is, that it is a lifestyle that we have chosen and one that we are committed too.  Thomas and his team are obviously committed as well, given the top notch non-elitist service that we were afforded.

We closed the restaurant down and Thomas chatted with us while we were waiting for the taxis.  2 words - Magnanimous & Charismatic.  Will be back
For the best French Onion soup you'll ever have, come here. I've almost everything in the menu by now and you can't got wrong with anything. Great place!

I adore this place - the menu and decor are retro enough to be unique without being kitchy. I've been several times over the past few years and have always had a wonderful meal. St. Charles Place is a fun dining spot - plenty to see and a professional wait staff. It's nice to go out to get a great steak at a local (non-chain) restaurant.

About 8 ounces of meat for $60.

We ordered the Chateaubriand special for two at $30 per person. This entre was served in a huge canoe shaped dish with loads of vegetables including parmisian stuffed tomatoes, roasted red and green peppers, mashed potatoes, whole green beans and asparagus. 

We each had eaten one slice of meat when I realized there were only 2 slices of meat remaining. I discovered the meat was resting on several slices of french bread which I assume was to absorb the excess juice or possibly mask the small meat portion. By then it was too late to discuss with management.

Also, there was nothing noteworthy or creative about the preparation of the Chateaubriand. I could have done at least as well at home.

We liked several other aspects of St Charles Place: linen table cloths, quality utencils, decor and ambiance, room between tables. The Maryland Lump Crabcake at $13 was very tasty except it was not lump crab, unless it was shredded lump crab. Our search continues for extraordinary crab cakes like The Capitol Grill in Lombard. 

My Hendricks martini at $10 was very good with large bleu cheese olives. (I know I should be asking for cucumber with Hendricks, but I like bleu cheese olives.) Only 2 Cabernets were offered by the glass. the top of the line was only $10, good wine and a generous pour.

We will go back but wiser from our first experience and alert for management slight of hand.

Good quality, decently priced food served by a friendly staff.  The regular ole house margarita is very respectable, and the fajitas are excellent.  Also try the bistec con rajas y queso, which is basically strip steak sauteed with poblano pepper strips and smothered in melted chihuahua cheese.  Mmmm.  

Oh, and that sweet, tiny little grandma who greets you at the door?  We think she rules that family with an iron fist.

Overpriced and under-flavored.  Take the money you would spend here and buy two meals at El Faro's just down the road.

Sorry to be overly negative, but I've been here a few times and have never been impressed.  I really don't know how they stay in business.

I suppose if I wanted to be nice, which I suppose I do, I could say that the atmosphere and service isn't that bad.  But this isn't the opera, I'm here for the FOOD!
Incredibly authentic & amazing Mexican food. If you only check out one of the Mexican restaurants in Elgin, make it this one.

In its favor, this is a family run place.  This same family has run a mexican market here in Elgin for ... hmmm I started going there about 33 year ago, so for quite a while.  The market always had homemade specialties at low prices, so I've gone there for years.

I did look forward to the opening of this eatery, too.  And although I've eaten here several times over the years my impression remains true.

The food is Americanized, the portions are small, the prices are high for what it is.  Still worth a try.

This is my go to place for Burritos! Hands down. To be clear this place is a dive. But the staff are pleasant, and the food is top notch. 

Prices are very reasonable.

I usually walk in, order, and have a real sugar Coke while I wait. Food comes out quick and is consistent from visit to visit. 

Perfect place to get burritos to go and bring back to the family.  I stick to the red sauce. The green gets a little spicy. 

High recommend.

A small and personal place where you can dine in or carry out. This is your basic taco place, but you know it is good, because all of the locals go here to eat. 

I had the three taco special, which was three tacos with rice and beans. For the meat I chose Al Pastor (pork), and it was topped with onions and cilantro, which is the authentic way. The meat was marinated nicely, and piled on street style corn tortillas. The beans were basic refried beans that were topped with cheese. The rice was the only thing that seemed to lack flavor. It was good, but I've had better. 

My boyfriend had the burrito pequino with rice and beans. He chose chicken for his meat, and he said it was good. Overall, service was quick, and the food was good. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants some authentic Mexican food. Also, the price is reasonable. Oh! And they are open late!

I've gone here a few times after a night out with friends and fell in love with their chicarones tacos. However, this is based off my recent trip, yesterday. As its been months since I have been here, but I was disappointed to where I won't be returning again.

I had the 3 taco dinner (steak, tripas, and chicarrones) the sides of bean & rice lacked flavor and was super bland, where it tasted like it was from a can or a box. 

The steak taco was dry, the tripas were decent, and the chicarones were not how I remembered them to be.

To be honest, we did eat a majority of it because we have been drinking, but usually I'm not picky and just realized knowing if I was pretty sober eating that, I would've most likely left everything on the plate. 

My friend had some spicy shrimp dish, which also lacked flavor and her husband got the shrimp cocktail, which only came with maybe 5 pieces of shrimp in there as it was all mainly the tomato juice. 

Too bad, this was our go to spot whenever in the area. We will now be looking elsewhere for tacos.

Love their food. Nice people and great food!
Love their 3 taco dinner, strip steak dinner and burito's. 
Garlic Shrimp fajitas are good too. 
They make fresh pico degio and its very good!
The steak taco was pretty good, the meat was flavorful and was nice and tender! I also got their tamale with a side of salsa verde which were also great. The food is definitely worth getting!
The tacos, Arroz and frijoles hit the spot and burrito was huge. A little too much cheese in the quesadillas, but my daughter loved it. And very affordable.

This place is as good as it gets! Food taste very home made, fresh and everything I had here so far is excellent, place is clean, very small but welcoming, staff is friendly and they try to accommodate you. I I will return.

The nachos are a joke. I almost never came back because of that. They threw some chips with some nacho cheese and VERY greasy ground beef together and it reminded me of shitty cafeteria food, on a bad day.

The tortas are decent but the meat had too much chewy pieces and fat. tacos are decent. Wet burrito is pretty good.

I'd give them a try if you are in the area, just don't get the nachos

Such an amazing place, felt like I was at home. Such amazing food. Service was amazing! Food here had the spot for good mexican food. I was definitely in a food coma after I left there. 

Please try this place out!

Original Tacos was an average taco joint to me.  The tacos were slightly above average, NO free chips and salsa :( , decent prices, and the sauces (green/red) they brought to the table were REALLY watery, which was frustrating as the liquid would run down my hand and wrist when trying to eat the taco.  I would come back as I am having problems finding a good taco place for lunches in the area, and this one is currently near the top of the list.

This place made me so sick. Their tacos are the smallest tacos I've ever seen with little tiny pieces of what was not meat, but pieces of fat. I ordered their Jamaica water and it was sugared red water, gross! $5 for chips and salsa is RIDICULOUS!  My toe still hurts from jamming it on their stupid tables,  which the waitress showed no empathy.

My father-in-law used to say if you want to find the best food in a neighborhood, find out where the locals eat.  Well when it comes to Mexican food, I'm guessing the locals eat at Original Tacos.  The prices are reasonable, the food is tasty and English is NOT the primary language spoken by the wait staff. :-)  I had heard about this place from a friend of mine when we were telling them about Taco el Norte and raving about how authentic is was.  My friend mentioned that this place was good and I figured I'd give it a try.  The guacamole was good, the salsa was spicy (but not too much) and my ground beef macho burrito was more than I could finish. (Maybe because i also got a side of rice and beans.)  The co-worker I came with also got the macho burrito, but his had shredded beef and he said he'd make a point to go out of his way to eat at this place again.  So if you haven't been here and you like tasty Mexican food, it's worth the effort to stop in for lunch or dinner.

Local place with ok food.  We ordered steak tacos for the family and at first bite they were really good, but as we ate on they were not that great, just average.  I wish the steak had better flavor to it.  The lady server was very nice, but once she had 3 tables she was overwhelmed.  Just and OK place, but we would stop again if hungry and its easy.

This place is tiny, dinky, and you could miss it very easily, but you would be missing some of the best Menudo in town. 

The broth is not as dark red as I usually like it, but the flavor is HUGE. For only 5.75, you could have the deliciously meaty bowl of tripe goodness just like Grandma used to make if she were a living on a farm in San Jacinto, MX and just butchered the family cow. 

Fresh, tasty, simple. I will be back.

Ordered food from here for the first time tonight after reading so many good reviews here on Yelp. Man, people weren't kidding when they said this was a small hole in the wall" place. Actually drove past it and had to make a u turn to get there. Place probably seats 12 people at the most. HOWEVER... their food is delicious! I had the Mucho Burrito with Carne Asada and it was the best burrito I ever had! The thing was HUGE! My wife had the fish taco dinner and my daughter had the chicken taco dinner. While my daughter absolutely loved hers, my wife thought the fish was a bit overcooked, but she is excited to try something different. We usually order out mexican food once a week and will be doing so from Original Tacos every week from now on!  Oh, one more thing, they are VERY affordably priced!
I was originally hesitant to try this place at first but it is a hidden gem!! I get the Tacos Original religiously, the chicken is so moist and flavorful. So glad that I gave it a shot.

Tried them for lunch yesterday. I really wanted tacos but I ended up with the enchiladas. I got the dinner plate which is 3 enchiladas, rice and beans. I liked that you can see what is being cooked, and all of the aromas coming from behind the counter smelled amazing! The restaurant itself is tiny, I think I counted 8 tables, and it was very clean. They have a decent size menu, a lot to choose from and they sell beer! 
My order was done and ready to go in about 6 minutes. I was very impressed with the size of my meal but the food didnt wow me. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed and liked my meal but I wish I would have ordered the tacos. I got a cheese, a steak and a chicken enchilada. The meat tasted delicious, full of flavor and just right but I wasn't impressed with the sauce. There was nothing special about it. The rice was ok but I didn't like the beans at all. Im a beans girl and these beans were not good, very bland. So I give this place 4 stars because I loved the flavor of the steak and chicken and I know the tacos would be delish and their horchata was great. I will for sure go back for the tacos!

BEST BURRITOS IN PALATINE , try out the wet ones and u might get moist yourself...

They said this review is too short, but I ain't no food critic so fts. U can sit down there and they give u chips, service is good cuz it doesnt matter if your black or white .. can't go wrong... geez

Nice cozy place tucked away in a little strip mall.  I had the steak tostadas and was a happy camper.  The steak had a good flavor and wasn't fatty like you get at some Mexican restaurants.  The staff was friendly and made me feel at home.  I had a very pleasant experience and will definitely be back to this nice little neighborhood spot.

Tip: you go past the GFS market place and Chen's (all within small plaza) then you will see a small sign that says Original Tacos.

It was my first time trying out the tacos here. And it wasn't all that great.

I ordered 3 chicken tacos and 3 fish tacos for pick up. They gave me about 5-10 minutes so it was pretty quick in terms of cooking. 

Each taco comes with lettuce, onion, cilantro upon your request. It's about the size of your hand as for the portion. 

Chicken taco was quite disappointing to say the least. Chicken was very dry and overcooked as it became harder to eat without pouring a load of salsa that came with the order. 

Fish taco was better however. It was a fried cod filet that also appeared to be overcooked. It had a dark brown coating which showed sign of being left in the fryer for too long. 

I paid about 13 dollars for 6 tacos, but I felt like I didn't get what I paid for in terms of quality. Good thing I was at least hungry.

This review is solely on the tacos so I can't say much about other things on the menu. 

If you're looking for good quality tacos, I'd suggest you find somewhere else.
Amazing staff with great quality authentic food. Will recommend to anyone. I love this place !

What a treasurer. A true treasurer. My carne asade macho burrito arrived quickly, the burrito is full of flavor. The meat is seasoned well, and it's filled to the brim with meat. The salsas delicious. Here's a picture to oggle at, admire, and give you a comparison shot of what you'll be eating. Plate ratio/knife ratio/fullness of burrito is on point and exceptional.

The worst Mexican food I have ever had in my natural born God given African Indian American life.. I ordered there once and that was enough to completely and utterly turn me off from this place forever. I ordered steak nachos and steak tacos, a standard order for me when trying out a new Mexican joint. I was so disappointed when I opened the container filled with oddly chopped tomatoes and onions and a sprinkle of meat. I gagged at first bite and nearly choked to death because the meat was so damn dry. I immediately regretted the decision to skip the horchata. I wish I could describe how bland the meat tasted but I can't describe a flavor that wasn't there... THERE WAS NO FLAVOR, which frightened me...
The tacos had all the fixings that should have made them bomb and a hit right off the bat, but of course life couldn't be so rewarding, I nearly choked again. Trying my hardest I swallowed and tried to find the flavor...again it was missing...
I hate the waste of time and money and I wouldn't wish this devastatingly disappointing restaurant on my worst enemy...not even a LAPD cop...

You'd be better off going to taco bell around the corner... You're welcome for the advice.

Decent customer service though...

above average Mexican place ... 
great fish tacos...
decent enchiladas...
descent quesadilla....
great horchata ....
open late so an added benefit ....

Overall a nice local Mexican business for quick grabs

I've been ordering the Macho Burrito from these guys since an old buddy of mine turned me on to the joint about 19 years ago. Tacos are excellent too, still one of my favorite places for comida Mexicana after all these years. Open til 3am on Friday and Saturday nights as well. Perfect for night owls and partiers.
Hands down my favorite hole in the wall Mexican joint! Huge burritos meaty tacos. The pastor and chorizo are better than la rosita and Los arcos 2 other palatine spots

Original tacos is a solid, no frills Mexican restaurant. They make a great steak burrito and the enchiladas are also very tasty.  Drink selections include pineapple water (my favorite), horchata and a standard array of jaritos (sorry no aqua de Jamaica).  They serve a number of Mexican beers too.  Great Mexican food for the burbs! I'll be back real soon...

Very good tacos but the steak torta with avocado is my favorite!  The meat is always cooked perfectly and everything is proportioned nicely. Great Aguas frescas too the jamaica is the best!! The service is great as well the waitress is always happy and smiling and the foods ready pretty fast.
Whenever my husband or i need a quick meal we go here. Cheap AND Good . Get the steak tacos.
Easy to miss (small sign) but solid food at a solid price. I am a snob with my Mexican food (grew up in Pilsen), and these are the best tacos in the nw suburbs. Great prices too!
Awesome place and very reasonable ! staff is very friendly :)

Awesome food, nice friendly owners and great take out for a family on vacation.  Small eat in area but good food, authentic Mexican taste made to order.  My kids are picky and they accommodated!!! Give this small place a chance to dazzle you, they will!

This place is the definition of: "Hole in the wall".
A place you can pass by a million times and never suspect what you are missing.

I got the macho steak burrito. It was huge, greasy, but PERFECT. It was the kind of meal I think about days after eating it.

They keep it simple here, it's cheap, and they do it right.
We just moved to Palatine and our neighbor suggested this place. I'm so glad they did! We love it! I'm a big fan of the tacos.

First time Visit, a pickup to bring back for lunch.  

I didn't call ahead, but they did cook thing promptly.  

Very small dining room, not lots of staff on to handle a lunch rush, so if your time sensitive, please call ahead.  Otherwise beware cranky Clock Watching HR/Boss types.  

I had something interesting...  A Hawaiian Burrito.  BBQ Sauce, Steak (or Chicken), pineapple, refried beans, rice, lettuce, and perhaps a few other odds and ends.   It was nice sized, and certainly a unique taste.   Encouraging enough to try them again, but likely not for another Hawaiian burrito.  It's ok, and worth trying once, but just didn't grab my attention for a long term favorite food relationship.


***Leftover Edit****

Eating the Hawaiian Burrito Cold, as leftovers..  Pretty damn tasty!
Their huevos rancheros are fantastic!!

Delicious, affordable, friendly hole-in-the-wall with a sign outside of it that says all you need to know, "tacos."

3 meals cost me a hair over $20. 6 hours later and I'm still so very full. 

In my quest for the tastiest Mexican food in the NW burbs, I've been tricked many a time with a beautifully presented dish that lacked flavor. Not here. Authentic, a hint of kick and everything was well cooked. 

The biggest highlight was the quick and friendly service. 
It's unfortunate this place doesn't have more reviews. It needs and deserves it. 
Stop by, pay less than the McDonalds-owned burrito chain and treat yourself to something bigger in size and better in taste!

Came here for fish tacos and was super disappointed. The fish was deep fried and overcooked with 2-3 tomatoes and a little lettuce. Also got the beans and rice which was just as bland as the tacos. You have to pay for chips and salsa and the guacamole was just ok. Should have taken the extra 5 min to go to Mexico Uno.
Best Mexican food around! Eaten here many times & will definitely be back.
Very fatty steak
Very good steak tacos, quality steak. Salsa is flavorful but not overly hot.  Chips and salsa not complimentary, but available.  Definitely recommend!

Fantastic Mexican food at typical cheap Mexican food prices~ it's all just so freaking tasty. I'm not saying this is the best around or that they can do no wrong but they do so much good! Please Please Please try the Shrimp Cocktail. With that hot sauce and lime and extra avocado. Oh my gawd...

Ate her a few months back. Wanted to try a more authentic burrito than if I were to just go to Chipotle. I got a steak burrito with everything, and I thought it was average. I was expecting a lot more after reading the reviews here, but it wasn't good enough for me to consider coming back.

Granted this small gem is only minutes from my place, I have been coming here for roughly six years now.  Good size portions and good quality foods.  I've custom made a dish there with is pretty much steak nacho fries, just like fully loaded mexican nachos but replacing the chips for fries instead. Drooooool!  Think it's about $12 or so but definitely worth a try! Thank me later!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!  Really good food. Really good price. They need a bigger dining room. Be prepared to take it to go

This place is fantastic! My husband used to go here when he was growing up in the area and he took me to it one time a couple of months ago. Ever since then, we go here to get Mexican food. It is a small place but you can eat-in. My husband loves the Hispanic shows they have on their t.v. First of all, you can't beat the price and the food tastes great! We love all the workers there. They treat us like family and take really good care of us. Our usual meals are the chicken taco specials. They seem small when you see them wrapped but when you unwrap it, they are decent sized. The meat tastes great and the vegetables are fresh. Their tortillas are just the right temperature and have great flavor. We also recently tried their huevos rancheros and are hooked on that too. It comes with rice, beans, and tortillas and is just a nice, hearty meal that really fills you up. Their horchata is delicious. We usually get a large one to share. My husband especially loves their beans and I really love their rice and green hot sauce. I have also had their fish tacos which are quite good. We are looking forward to trying more items on their menu in the near future (maybe tonight! lol). We definitely recommend this little gem!

The burritos here are pretty good.  It's a hole in the wall type place, and it can get loud if the jukebox is playing.  The food is tasty, and not too bad on price.  I generally order pickup to avoid dining in.  Get a steak burrito, and you will be very full and happy.

this place is a dump and had a 70% on their sanitary chart.. their other ratings were in the 90's except for the most recent one.. so knowing me, my boyfriend and i tried it anyway.. not a good experience. the guy at the counter (seemed like he was the owner or manager) and the guy in the kitchen with him microwaved my plate of food.. i ordered an enchilada and burrito that came with rice and beans. when it came out, my beans and rice were CRUSTED to my plate.. the burrito and enchilada was not bad. my boyfriend ordered steak and chicken tacos, and the steak tasted exactly like fish.. (no one wants steak that tastes like fish.) totally gross. the chicken was alright. good thing i was feeling nice that day because i was very close to asking for a full refund on our food that tasted like microwave and fish!
Absolutely awesome steak tacos and the macho burrito doesn't lie, it's the size of a football.

Found this place while looking for any open taco eatery after a late night concert. EXCELLENT food!! This is the only place I ever came by that served tacos with pork skin. My hubs said the pastor was the best he ever had. Very sad to move out of state soon and only discovered this place now. Having it again today for lunch!!

Hands down one of the best Mexican places in the Northwest Suburbs.  Way better then Tacos El Norte which is right down the street.  The place is a little bit of a dive but they use fresh ingredients and the food is excellent.  You can't go wrong with the burrito or the tortas.  Check it out!
This place is a little hole in the wall but they have some great food! Carne Asada, steak tacos and guacamole are especially good.

This place is located in a little strip mall center.   We happened upon it on Christmas Day when looking for something to eat.  It took a little bit for the food to come out, but I guess that could be because of it being a holiday.  It was well worth the wait though.  I had steak tacos.  The meat was well seasoned with a delicious char from the grill.  The beans were delicious as were the chips and salsa.   The prices are very reasonable too.

Juan (the owner) and his staff have some fantastic eats here.  Super authentic and affordable.  I have been coming here for sopes and posole for what seems like forever now and have never been dissapointed! My parents come for the burritos and although I have never tried one (not a huge fan of burritos in general) the rave about them... and they are HUGE!!!! It's not a question of IF I will be back... it's a matter of WHEN!! :)
love love lovee! this place, best mexican food around

I tried their torta last week and it was very good. Size was bigger than I'm use to closer to my home. I went during lunch time and the place was not too packed. I ordered to go and service was okay. The cook was a bit too serious and looked annoyed. But I would definitely go back some other time.

Was looking for a place to grab a quick bite while waiting to get my nails done. Saw Jaqueline B.'s review of this place down the street and decided to check it out. Definately the right choice.

I was greeted the moment I walked in, & even though I was ordering to go, I was offered a glass of their homemade chia water. It was sooo delicious that I added it to my togo order. I ordered the Picaditas, which were super yummy!! They had a great flavor & the homemade tortilla like things was wonderful. Everything tasted fresh. Next time I will eat in on their patio!

I cant wait to bring my husband here sometime on the weekend to try one of their pozole de Guerrero.

My friends down the street at Kindred Coffee suggested the tacos over at La Cocina de Maria, so naturally I took them up on this suggestion when I was in the area last Saturday.

I was a tad confused when I walked in, because I didn't really see a menu or counter to order at. Once someone saw my confusion I was helped and given a to-go menu to look at. I was lucky enough to see fellow Yelper Osiris V. dining in, so she let me try a bite of her food -- a fried quesadilla (not sure of the real name) and pambazo. Both were really good! The pambazo sandwich was ginormous --you can definitely split it between 2 (or maybe even 3) people!

I had tacos on the brain, so I ended up ordering 2 chicken tacos (classic style, not American), 2 carne tacos, and a chorizo quesadilla to split with the hubbie. I wanted water to go and at first was upset because I didn't see any water bottles in the cooler, but then they offered up some pretty delicious options! They brought out two adorable tea cups for me to try their chia seed water and hibiscus water. Both were delicious and refreshing! I decided to go with the hibiscus water and ordered a large. It's to be noted that a large size drink is a GINORMOUS beverage (think big gulp style) that basically kept me hydrated the whole rest of the day.

Of course I'm sure my food would have been even better if I dined in as opposed to bringing it home, but I still really enjoyed the tacos! The steak tacos were my absolute favorite and I thought the chicken tacos were just okay. The chorizo quesadilla was really good too but extremely greasy. I love that they gave me sour cream, limes, and three different kinds of salsa to go with my meal. I thought the red salsa was very good and it had a nice kick to it!

For all this food it cost me about $16 which was well worth the authentic Mexican taste!

Pro tip: They now have a back patio you can enjoy!

In one word, "Wow!" I literally joined Yelp just to post a review on this place!

It's a small restaurant with massive flavor. I had 3 Steak Tacos and my wife and I couldn't be happier. The Chips and Salsa starter where amazing, and the Chocolate Flan was the perfect textures and flavores, fresh and not too sweet.

This is an epic date night place. Food presentation was like a 5-star Chicago restaurant. If you don't believe me check out the pictures I took:)

Great service too, it's like you are a guest in their own home!

It looks like this place needs more business, but I am writing this at 3:46p on a Friday so I don't know what their weekends are like.

Wow! Pot roast tacos. Come on! They're as good as you think they might be. Maybe better. And I also had Cochinita Pobil (SP?) tacos for the first time. Never heard of them before, but it's basically a pot roast but pork. Delicious. I didn't notice if they had the usual al pastor or steak, but I don't think they do. You won't miss them, however. 
THREE complimentary salsas and chips, too. Gotta drag a couple people over here so we can all try and share a bunch of different stuff.
This is a tiny place with only 5 tables inside, plus a small picnic table out. Either way, get over there and eat.

Wonderful food.. Definitely the best tacos I've ever had in my life! And trust me.. I know tacos. Mom and pop feel. The staff is so sweet, they make you feel apart of the family. Support a family owned business! You won't regret trying this place.

Hubs and I ordered a bunch of tacos, rice and beans... Nothing complicated. The meat on the tacos was very flavorful, but the rice felt unoriginal and the beans were a little tangy. I also did enjoy the variety of salsas provided.
As for the service, the staff was very pleasant and felt more like your aunt and cousins were serving you vs. formal experienced wait staff.

What a pleasant surprise! This restaurant specializes in pre-Hispanic Mexican food. With only 5 tables, the cooking staff also waits on the customers and treats them with kindness.  The food is incredibly delicious and very affordable. Highly recommended.

Family owned - they take pride in their restaurant!!
Great food (& service) - you don't have a server - but they bring your food to your table & clean it up after you are done.

Haven't had a better GYROS anywhere! 

I always come to this location for my Gyros - I really don't try anything else, cause I love their gyros too much!

YUMMY!!

My Elgin colleague took me here for lunch - I should say he drove me, because I paid for my own lunch! 

Ok - please was clean, typical good parking, pricing was decent and selections was good. However, my Italian combo was really really good! Though my french fries were just mediocre - the sandwich was great! It's a shame they only basically have one diet soda and no freshly brewed unsweetened ice tea - what they have I think is a powdered tea!

YES - I would return for sure!
Their gyro with all the fixings is amazing! Don't go for that chicken crap though, you have to be authentic and get the lamb! For the amount you get, it's a great deal! I'm coming back!

Been going to Skippy's since I lived near the Hanover Park location! Now I work and live in the South Elgin area and love these guys! My go to meal is the King Chicken Gyros! The best part is they know me so well that by the time I hit the counter they have it ordered and all i have to do is pay for it! Love love love this place!!

This place has been my go to place for gyros, for years. You get plenty of meet and it's always fresh and delicious. The fries and fried mushrooms are great as well. The restaurant is always clean and great service.
Just had the king gyros and it was delicious. It completely filled me up and hit the spot!!

This one is a hard one for me.  I spend some time in Florida near Tarpon Springs which was settled by Greek Families and there are a number of greek restaurants in the area.  Louis Pappas for one.  Also, I took a number of trips to Athens during the 2004-2006 time frame and ate out in some of the great restaurants there.  
I had the Gyros Pak which includes a gyros sandwich with Tzatziki, onions and tomatoes, a side of fries and a soda.  The fries were good.  The sandwich was good.  However, the gyros and tzatziki didn't have enough flavor to them.  Don't get me wrong.  it was good but not great.  
The place was spotless.  The price was around $8.91 for the Pak, not cheap but about right.  They brought the food out to me after it was prepared.  This was going to be a 3.5 rating but, hey, they have Pepsi products, so it's a 4.

I went to this place with my husband this evening. The place is very nice and the food was delicious and fresh. I had a mini gyro and shared a large fry with my husband. The mini gyro was the perfect size. My only disappointment is the restaurant closes early on the weekends.
Just want to say I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! Always friendly, great food, their chicken and rice soup is AWESOME!!!

Best gyros in town! The food is consistent and the staff is friendly and pleasant. Dining in is always nice too, they keep the restaurant clean and inviting! Only downfall is that the pricing is a bit night but it's worth it!

Skippy's is always a good go-to restaurant if you are in a hurry or just want some decent food. The Italian ice is great and really cleanses the palette. Some of the other good dishes are the Super Taco, Skippy's sub, Italian Sub, Italian Sausage, and some of the other dishes. Overall the service is good, and people are nice.

Love this place! Good fresh food fast and tasty! What's not to enjoy!? 

I def will go back to try their other menu items!!!

The inside is kept nice, updated and clean. Italian ice is yummy! Kids meals are affordable and come with Italian ice! I had the Athenian chicken pitta. The chicken was cooked perfectly with a slightly char taste and feta! It was awesome.

I really enjoyed the restaurant's interior design lol. The floors, tables, walls, artwork, wall molding, and even the bathroom were quite impressive for a gyro joint! Umm the tables were granite if I am not mistaken! Wowzah. Are all Skippys' like this? The food was great. I've had better though...around the southside Chicago/southern suburban areas, there are incredibly tasty Gyros and Greek food. I just tried the Athenian chicken pita and the chicken gyros. I am not sure how the other selections taste, but I trust they are good. 4 stars magnifico.

This location has always been one of my local favorites

My friend and I stopped in to fulfill our gyros addiction. We were a little surprised at some of the cosmetic and menu changes that left us wondering whether this location was under new ownership or management. Something just didn't feel right. The tables seemed to have a somewhat greasy feel to them which was uncharacteristic of its' usual lustrous appearance. The food quality also seemed somewhat diminished.

About 1am it was confirmed when we both seemed to come down with nausea and abdominal cramps.

The gyros are great and I love the curly fries. Unfortunately they have Pepsi products!!! Their prices are high. If they lowered the price I would definitely go more often. It's a great location, easy in and out and close to a lot of other businesses that I use.

Place sucks, pricy and managers  not friendly at all?
$6.48 for a chicken quesadilla plus $2.99 for 7 onion rings and $1.79 for drink wtf 
Pricy dinner for crappy place. 
Would definitely not come back.
It was ok. I did like that they had a mini gyros. Fries were good.

Yummy gyros, hot dogs, Greek chicken and fries. It's fast food but it's a notch above the others. I actually think I prefer this to Portillo's just down the street. One of the things I really, really like is there are NO garbage cans in the dining room. They clear and clean all tables in a prompt and efficient manner as soon as the table has vacated. It's very clean, you'll never find a mess anywhere. Might be a weird reason to like this place but let me tell you, it really does make a difference.
This place has really nice people and a awesome facility. It is very nicely furnished for a fast food place. The gyros have a really good amount of meat to them as well.

Skippy's is a decent gyro place in the Fox Valley (and, apparently, also with a location in Roselle.) I had a craving for gyros, so I hoped this place would fulfill it.

I had a standard gyro, and it was pretty good. Not awesome, but I still felt I got my money's worth--well-seasoned lamb, tasty cucumber sauce and pretty fresh tomatoes. I appreciated that they had sweet potato fries, but thought they could use more salt (which I just added at the table anyway).

My wife's Italian Beef was also quite good; very moist, very flavorful, with crispy fries to boot.

In general it seems the food here is simple but worth the price, and a great fast food alternative to the other chains up and down Randall Road.

I really like their Gyros!  (Their chicken Gyro is ok, but not my favorite)
The place is clean.  The food is hot, well prepared, and tasty.  I liked their burger the two times I tried it, but always seem to order the Gyro.
Can you find a better Gyro? Yes - but you will have to drive a long way.
If you are in the area and want "fast food" Skippy's is well worth trying.

Make sure you check your order before you leave the drive-up window! Every time I've ever been here, the order is wrong.  I'm giving this place two stars because we like the Greek salad, but I'm not sure we'll ever go here again. Today I asked for a side of pepperocini peppers for my husband's salad (which is outrageously priced, like everything else here), and the guy gave me three dinky peppers in a one-ounce cup, and charged me $1.79 for it!  I understand charging a small up charge, but c'mon, I could've bought a whole jar at the grocery store and had change to spare for that price! The Greek potatoes were two tiny potato spears saturated in oil for over $2.00. No thanks. Goodbye Skippy's!

Very clean restaurant, but overpriced food.  Over $11 for a gyro meal is a bit too much given the other greek restaurant choices available in St. Charles (like Just Kabobs). However, the inside is very clean, and the chicken gyro is delicious!

Stay away from the side salad, as it is very bland.

If you are Hungry and want a Gyro in Elgin then get on down to Skippy's 

this is a no thrills dinner with Gyro's, Burgers and Hot Dogs all for a good price and damn fast too, the booths are a little old as this place looks like it has been here a while but don't let that put you off 

I would rather go to a place like this for lunch as you know they have perfected there menu and know how to feed a customer some damn good food 

the Gyro was hot as were the fries and as I said I didn't have to wait long for my food

Amazing Gyros and salads!  The fries are a bit greasy for me, but everyone else I know loves them. The wait for the gyro and fries can be a bit long, and I usually have to pull ahead for them to bring me the order; but if you want it fresh, you wait.....so I shouldn't complain.  I don't get in line though if I'm in a hurry, and the only thing I would change is the beverages.  I wish they would get rid of Pepsi (yuck!) and switch to Coke products.  I enjoy their food so much that I buy my food at Skippy's, and drive over to McDonalds for the coke....seriously.  It's the only thing that needs to be changed.  Then, I would've rated it with 5 stars!

I had there mega beef and it was awesome!!!!!!!!!!!! 
Friendly service and a nice casual setting.
The best burgers, chicken gyros, and chocolate cake around... Love Skippy's!
I've never had a complaint about skippys! They're gyros are really good and I love their Italian Ice!

This place is quite awesome =). I work pretty close to it, so when I'm in the mood for a good gyro, burger, or torpedo sub (OMG TORPEDO SUBS ROOOCK!! try them) , this is where I go! mm! I recently found out I can not eat Wheat, so when I go to Skippys I have to ask for no bun on my burger or no pita bread with my gyro and they never give me an issue about it. Some places look at me very weird when I ask for no bun on my burger (are you on a diet??). I am not on a diet!!! I have an allergy that can be quit serious and I would appreciate it if people would stop making me feel weird for being this way. SO GOOD JOB SKIPPYS FOR MAKING ME FEEL LIKE I CAN BE MYSELF =D
I will continue to support you!
