Awesome Gyros (Chicken Gyros as well). Always extremely friendly and fast service. I wish it was closer to my house. Worth the trip if you want a giant pita stuffed full of meat.

username: R I C K Y B O B B Y.
review_text:
Probably the best Gyros in the area.  I like the fact that you can get either a mini-sized or king sized as well as a regular sized gyros here.  Plus, they will make it any way you want.  Grilled onions, yep.  All toppings under the meat?  Yep.  Everything on the side?  Yep.  I have yet to ask for something and they say no.  Drive-thru seems to be a bit slow, but the quality of food is worth the wait.  

Also, if you like Spinach Pies, you have to try Skippy's.  I don't know what it is that they do, but it is outstanding!  

Inside of the restaurant is nice, with flat screen Tv's all around to watch while you wait/eat.  I have taken my family here numerous times with no concerns.  All in all, nice place and I will be back!

Gyros is very good but pricy. The beef n sausage combo, well I said "wow" when I first bit into it. The bread is flaky, not heavy at all, absolutely fantastic. The beef is great, the sausages just the right amount of spice. I give this place the highest marks possible. I wish there were more locations. Happily adding this place to my list of favorite Chicago style locations and I will try the hot dog next.

Had a taste for a hot dog, so of course I stopped in a Gyros joint... This can't end well, can it?

Surprise! I got the combo #9 -- two dogs with fries for less than $6 with a pop! Nice dogs, the thick Viennas, with all the condiments (a little skimpy on the sport peppers) including a huge slice of crispy dill pickle! Excellent!

I'm fed up with Portillo's tiny dogs and "no refills" policy. Skippy's is officially on my short list for hot dogs -- next time the Gyros, or maybe a beef...

They deliver to your table ala Augustino's..

Nice and clean, good food, will be back.  Gyro was good, but I have had much better, fresher tasting meat.  A tad on the pricier side for a "faster" food type of place.  The Dogfather in Bartlett has the better Gyro, in case you feel like debating me. :)

I go here almost daily.  This place is the best in the area by far.  I am a picky finicky eater, that is hard to please, but this place has quality ingredients, and they prepare the food well every time.  The staff is great and beyond friendly.  Always would recomend.  The Polish's are kick butt too.

Whoops. Turns out I wrote this review for the wrong place originally... contacted by an owner, all is well. 

(Original review written spring of 09)

It's a drive through, but you're going to be waiting for a while while they prepare them. Delicious and totally worth it. The sauce comes on the sandwich already so if you want it on the side you have to be specific. The fries were just ok, very similar to Burger King fries (the sort of battered, crispy kind). Pretty good...pretty good.

I stopped in Skippy's today in South Elgin. I have not been there in a while. I use to see the special board with the prices on it for the specials . They did not have the prices there. Are you kidding me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Wherever you go to any fast food place they have prices for the specials. For example ( beef, fries and a coke $8.49). I asked the person where are the special combinations with the prices. She said they don't have them posted, I will tell you how much it is. Are you kidding me!!!!!!!!!!!! I asked how much for the gyros meal and she told me. How much for the beef meal and she told me. How much for the cheeseburger meal and she told me. Are you kidding me!!!!!!!!!!! Most people want to see the combinations and their prices to decide what they want to get. Maybe I don't want the gyros for $9.69, maybe instead I want the cheeseburger for $ 6.69. I cannot believe they don't have the prices for the specials listed That is nuts and stupid. I almost walked out, but I wanted their gyros special. I had to ask her for 5 different combination prices and then forgot what she said. I cannot believe this would not bother anybody by ordering something and not caring about the price. I know they have always been high prices their, but not having prices showing the cost and not even offering me the receipt. Plus they sometimes seem rude there. As I left I saw the bus boy put the napkins I did not use back in his pocket,  maybe he put them back in the mix with the other clean napkins.  Anyway I definitely will never step foot in there again. The gyros was good though but no at that cost. I hope  they put the special prices back up there for their customers to see or just go in and order any special and don't worry about their cost.
get the battered mac & cheese wedges!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! they are s00000000 good!!!!!!!!
Great atmosphere and pretty good food. I ddint try the beef but its a great stop for a quick dog and fries.

I give Skippy's 4 out of 5 and I'm having a hard time not justifying a 5!!!  Great quality, huge portions, and in a very clean environment, Skippy's has discovered a niche in fast-food Greek style.  The Gyros are their signature sandwich -- one of the best!!!  The Chicken Rice soup is a must have each time I visit.  The restaurant in South Elgin is a Wendy's converted into very nice fast-food environment.  Great place to take the kids -- there's something for everybody on their extensive menu.  Good value!!!

Best place to stop for a gyro, hot dog, spinach pie, Greek salad,or just anything on their menu! And they have the best homemade Italian ice! They also make homemade cream if chicken rice soup! Yummy!!! They are awesome!!
Good gyros-- that's about all I get here.  The sauce is just the right combination of tang and cucumber flavor.  Food is always hot and fresh, and the combo meals are just huge.

I love the gyros here. Super tasty, huge portions, and clean. I don't feel all greased up or messy when I'm eating these gyros and I love it. I think it's in the way they assemble them and wrap them. 

The place itself is a huge step up from typical gyro joints. It's extraordinarily clean, well decorated, and sporting 3 flat panel TVs. The middle one is usually on the Disney channel and the other 2 are on sports. Skippy's is awesome, I love taking friends here for a bite and they've been impressed.

heard the original owner sold their shop on lake street and opened this location. i moved to vegas about 12 years ago, but this was my spot when i did live in hanover park. the brothers were always courteous every time me and my family stepped into the joint, our food was more then reasonably priced (at least back then) and they literally had THE best gyros in town. 12 years later i still get urges for this place, and would take a gyros combo extra sauce as my last meal on earth. EAT HERE!  no chicago trip will ever be complete in my life if i dont eat here at least once every day when i am in chicago.

Skippy's gyros are excellent!  Get the King Gyros if you're *really* hungry.

The italian beef sandwiches are very tasty (not Portillo's but close), they have curly fries (YAY!), and the burgers are quite good as well.  Top it all off with a lemon Italian ice and I'm a happy camper. :-)

We've never had a bad meal here...everything's always hot, fresh, tasty.

They're open until 9 most Monday-Saturday, 7 on Sundays.

Skippy's took over the old "Wendy's" that failed, and what a difference!

I've had many gyros on multiple continents and I have to say these are among the best.  Pay the extra for the feta cheese and you won't be disappointed.  Huge portion of tasty meat leaves nobody hungry.  Can't wait for my next visit.

I wish I had a Skippy's nearby.  St Louis really needs a franchise near the downtown with late hours.  I'd kill for a Skippy's!

Sorry, I have to dissent from the masses.  Skippy's is alright, but it's far from the best gyros (as far as the TriCity area, Mr. Beef trumps them with their lack of drive thru and rude service, still better).  Their prices are on par with similar joints, but they dice the tomato (not traditional) and the meat is just okay.  The cheese for cheese fries, gross-- it's like hot yellow.  The fries and chicken gyro also aren't all that.  I will give them props for th Italian Ice and also variety of flavors they offer, but the food is decent, not as good as Munchie P's for burgers or Portillo's for beefs.  They do everything alright but nothing that well.  Sorry Skippy's...just not that into you!

I can honestly say Skippys helped me gain 20lbs when I moved back to the area.  Over time I was able to battle my addictions and I am happy to say that today, I am down to one Chicken Gyro every two weeks.  That's not to say I don't still indulge in their Lamb Gyros, Italian Sausage or Mega Beef.  Special mention should be made to the Italian Ice.  If you really want to keep the party going, ask for a tub of cucumber sauce to go.... yes, they sell it by the pint, to go.... with you....home....I use it in my morning coffee.

This is our local favorite gyros' place.  We have gone here a few times and have never been disappointed!  We have now introduced my sister and brother-in-law to it and they loved it too!  We always get the gyros, and I get mine with grilled onions and they get it right every time!  We also get the cheese fries which are okay and yesterday I finally got a side of their oven roasted potatoes which were EXCELLENT!!  They, of course, have a bunch of other items like souvlaki, spinach pie, pizza puffs, burgers, steak sandwiches...pretty much everything.  And you can either go through the drive-through, order inside to take it to go or eat there where they have plenty of clean seats.  You've just gotta try it!

**Also while I was waiting to take my order to go, I saw the cook making a ribeye steak sandwich and the steak looked SO good that I think I may have to try one next time!**

***One last thing...I saw that there were a few reviews for a Skippy's Gyros on Lake St. in Roselle (http://www.yelp.com/biz/skippys-gyros-roselle-2)  and I looked it up on manta.com, which is apparently a website about businesses and their information, and it said that this one has only been started since 2006 and I have seen that other one on Lake St. for a long time, so from what I found they are not related.  Just an FYI.***

For what it is, quick food, it is fantastic.  Food is fresh, hot, consistent, and the vegetables they put on the hot dogs are fabulous.  Gyros are good, not great, and the fries are always some of the best; very little grease.  Give Skippy's a try.
The Athenian Chicken Pita was delicious.  Nice place.  Everything looked good.

Been here a few times, they have really tasty gyros. Try one cooked well done with American cheese, they are really good. They also have good Chicken Nuggets, they taste like the one's McDonald's used to have before they changed over the recipe.

So far I've had a gyro and an Italian beef sandwich here and I both times I enjoyed it very much! It's kind of an upscale fast food joint where you order up front and they bring it to your table, and I think they might have a drive thru?  Good stuff.  I plan on returning.

I love this place!! My boyfriend and I frequent both locations but tend to go to third street more just because it's bigger and you aren't sitting on top of the people next to you. 

The servers are great and always make a point to say hello and remember us when we go. They are attentive and are very staffed which is great because the service is fast even when they are busy. They are all so friendly and you can tell they enjoy their job- which I can't say about most servers in most restaurants. 

The food is great! Best tacos I've ever had- and Definitely the best tacos in Geneva! I like the al pastor! The esquites is delicious !!!! Their margaritas are fantastic! I get different ones every time I'm there- and I can't tell you which one is my favorite- because they are all so good! We always get pineapple guacamole as an appetizer too- it's always delicious and super fresh! 

This place is definitely our date spot on the weekend and we go to the Main Street location on Sunday afternoons a lot when it's not so busy. 

I would highly recommend this place!! It will not disappoint and is consistently great!

What a great place! All the dishes we ate were delicious and all with their own flair.
Fish Tacos, fajitas, chicken tacos, queso fundido....all great.
Special shout out for the delicious coleslaw on the fish tacos!

Still waiting on my horchata. Oops it was dishwater and bleach. But they took it away and offered a free ice tea. It took 21 minutes to get tea and chips and salsa.
The taco sample was good but not for $13.95. Portion was small and on super small corn tortillas.
Don't recommend this to anyone. It's better if you go out of business and let someone else in.

I'm getting sick from the dishwater drink already.

I'm not really sure what happened here but the term hot mess comes to mind. We came for restaurant week, which was a great deal...2 margaritas, chips and guac, 2 taco plates (each with a side), and a dessert for $39. 

But with every table filled and only one waitress running around, we were often forgotten. 2 other tables that got seated after us had their orders taken before us. Our chips and guac arrived before we even had waters. The waitress was very nice whenever she would come by but she just needed more help! 

Overall food was fine but not great. The chips were really greasy and had no salt. All the food was delivered with nice presentation and we did agree the meal was very pretty. We also both loved our margaritas. Mango & Blackberry, yum!

Also, the interior was surprisingly nice considering the berry houses are a bit...run down, if you will. But the lighting was super bright and it didn't feel very intimate or cozy. The music was really quiet and we could easily hear neighboring conversations. It just felt a bit awkward.

Very lovely third floor patio setting with welcoming staff . I was pleased with vegetarian menu choices. My service dog did not cause a blip in service as it does in some local places . Food was excellent. Servers were on point! 
Chile Rellanos was very authentic and vegetarian burrito was tasty. I will be back!

Food = Great!
Service = Terrible!

Be sure to bring your own bottle of water because they won't refill yours!
Food was okay, but it was overpriced for the portion.

So one of the nit picky reasons I am chopping off a star in comparison to the other location on State Street is the Tacos Duros is not offered. This is a unique deep fried taco which is hard to find at most Mexican restaurants. The people at the other location claim they will make it for you, but I tried asking for it and they had no clue what I was talking about.  Also the lunch menu is not offered. Even though I think the portions are a little big for lunch you can certainly take something home and at least you will get filled up.  Please don't let my nit pickiness deter you from experiencing this stellar establishment. In my review of the other location I describe the available menu items in more detail which are available here. Unlike the other location a beautiful outside patio is available for dining el fresco.  Despite the fact that an elevator is available the second floor location will be a little challenging for someone who has mobility issues. I think it is manageable though for most people.
Food was great. Our server, Emily was very helpful and attentive. The patio is very cute and is great for people watching.

One of my favorite Mexican places! Great food and service, without the high prices and long wait times of Bien Trucha. The margaritas are fantastic, and the pineapple guacamole is always light and refreshing.
This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in town. Fantastic food, margaritas and owners. I especially their carnitas flautas available only on the weekend. It has great outdoor deck sitting.

First time here and the food is really delicious and so is the horchata drink!!!!! Service is so slow and they seem to have many servers there so not sure what is going on. Took a long time to get out drinks and then just as long for chips and salsa. I ordered the Mole Enchiladas and they were DeLisH. My friend ordered shrimp tacos and was very happy with the dish. 
Second visit :
Walked in for fried ice cream and horchatas and we told the hostess this. She said ok she would tell our server. We proceed to sit outside and the server comes out greets us and we repeat what we are there for. We order our stuff and minutes go by and still no drinks or even water. Still waiting .......
The Manager ( I assumed because she had to come explain) comes and apologizes they have no ice cream.  She offers ,the only dessert available , the Flan. At this point we are annoyed cause it took so long to be informed of all of this!! I guess the the server had no clue they were out of the ice cream that the only available dessert  was the Flan!? I tell the manager it's ok we will still take our drinks. Another 10 minutes go by still no water and still no rice waters. We finally decide to get up and grab our rice waters to go.  I walk up to hostess stand and server still had no drinks made for us. They were kind enough to give us the one drink on the house. I do hope to be back and have a better experience.

Not a busy night and awful service. I had to ask for water refill several times. The bus boy clearly saw the empty waters and walked on by. I'm not a person to usually complain but the food wasn't great either and our order was wrong. Our waitress was rude as well. She dropped off the bill said "here" and turned away. Not coming back here again. Sad, because I love downtown Geneva area.
Drinks are good, service is slow and less than enthusiastic. Food bland and not imaginative. There are many better choices for Mexican fare in Geneva or St. Charles. Try El Tiro or Bien Trucha

Went there for the tortas that I heard so much about. I liked the food at the smaller shop on main street and thought I would try the 3rd street restaurant. First of all the menu online was not updated and the those prices were two to three dollars less than the published menu inside. When I told the hostess she just said sorry. Which is fine, but it shows a total lack of communication between the staff and the management. I was going to stay for a drink while I was waiting for my food, the prices were just too outrageous for alcohol. So I went down the street to grab a beer and wait for my takeout. When I picked it up I knew I was in for trouble because for three tortas my bag was way too light . Especially for the money. I am Hispanic and have travelled enough to recognize that there are plenty of smaller Mom and Pop Mexican places that are authentic and you get much for your money.

We've been her a lot.  I'm not a huge Mexican fan but the food here is exceptionally fresh.  I don't love the location on third street but it is convenient.  But I keep coming back for the food.  On Fridays they have carnitas that is delicious.  The soupa Jalisco is also fantastic.  It is amazing.

This was the absolute worst Mexican food we have had in our entire lives! You're fooled by the outside deck but the ambiance was lost when the food was so bad...plus my drink tastes like soap! We are ones to always give rave reviews, but let me tell you...it's a warning to save you time, money, & a stomach ache.

We went with a large group. The service was excellent, the patio was Perfect for the warm night, and the food and drinks were on point. 

Really looking forward to going again! Finding it was a little tricky (look up, it's on the second level!) but once we were there it was all good!

Amazing! This place has such great Mexican food. The tacos are just delicious, especially the pescadillos and the Carne Asada. The drunken beans and corn sides are literally some of the best I've ever had. Also, it's a pretty chill place, quite with a great outdoor patio.

This sunny upstairs restaurant looks like it would be great in better weather, but we still enjoyed our meal.  The margaritas ($9.50) really stole the show- the cucumber one had a nice flavor and the one with tomatio (?) was black and delicious!  Their specialty seems to be pork because there were so many variations.  
Only complaint was the little burritos only had meat and beans inside.

Party of 10 for a Saturday night- food was ok. Really slow service, no real continuity by wait staff, had to ask for them to remove bottles from table and at times it was 15 minutes plus for a new drink to arrive or beverages to be refilled.  It wasn't overly busy, but it was clear they were struggling to keep up.  The worst part was they forgot half the tables dinner sides. Just a real bad service experience with so-so food.  The patio is nice and it was great catching up with our friends- without those items, I would have likely walked out and given my money to other quality places within a few steps away. Note to management: you have a great location, get great service; bring in some experienced folks vs young and cheap.
Great, fresh tasting drinks. Tacos, burritos, tortas are all delicious.

Newly opened satellite of the original on State, which I've never been to but understand is excellent. I am puzzled by the fact that they opened a send spot four blocks from the first.  
Great patio, great food, just needs a little time to evolve.  You can tell this place opened on a shoestring budget:  terrible, small tables that probably came from Menards or Target...way too small for mor than two diners.  No decor at all, except for the super bright, obnoxious neon "open" sign on the patio.  
Getting past that, all was great.  It won't take long for this awesome patio spot to be filled every night, so get there while you can.    Quiet enough to have a conversation with your guests.  Really enjoyed this place and will be back.
Great food.  Love the chips and salsa.  Rooftop seating is amazing on a sunny day.
